original: @1b # // thabs dang ldan pa'i las rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @1b # // thabs dang ldan pa'i las rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Four verses on the analysis of the function of the bodhisattva's method.

original: gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa'i skabs kyi rjes la thabs kyis bsdus pa'i las bshad par 'brel ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa'i skabs kyi rjes la thabs kyis bsdus pa'i las bshad par 'brel ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the explanation of the function subsumed under method and the section on instruction and teaching?🔽The three topics of the above verse are the basis of training, the content of training, and the means of training.

original: gong du gang la bslab pa dang / ji ltar bslab pa dang / gang gis bslab pa gsum las 'di yang ji ltar bslab pa'i skabs yin te /🔽de la yang gang bslab pa'i khyad par zhes smos pa de yang brjod dgos la /🔽bslab pa de yang gang la dmigs nas slob par byed pa de yang smra dgos te /
analyzed: gong du gang la bslab pa dang / ji ltar bslab pa dang / gang gis bslab pa gsum las 'di yang ji ltar bslab pa'i skabs yin te / de la yang gang bslab pa'i khyad par zhes smos pa de yang brjod dgos la / bslab pa de yang gang la dmigs nas slob par byed pa de yang smra dgos te /
translated: The present section is the third of these.🔽Moreover, the content of training must be mentioned, since it is referred to by the phrase “the content of training. ”

original: de la bslab pa'i khyad par de zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bslab pa'i khyad par de zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: And the object of that training must be mentioned, since it is referred to by the phrase “the content of training. ”🔽The content of training is the method of the bodhisattva.

original: de la bslab pa ni gang bslab pa'i khyad par ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bslab pa ni gang bslab pa'i khyad par ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the content of training? What is the method?

original: rang gi bya ba bsgrub pa ni bslab pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba bsgrub pa ni bslab pa'o //
translated: The content of training is the accomplishment of one’s own aim.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong du ma gyur pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong du ma gyur pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: The method is the non-commonality with the disciples, etc.

original: rang gi bya ba bsgrub pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rang gi bya ba bsgrub pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of performance of one's own duty:

original: spyi dang khyad par ro //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par ro //
translated: general and specific.

original: de la spyi ni lus la sogs pa'i las la phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa ste /🔽de ni thabs kyis bsdus pa'i las nyid de las de dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad la khyab pas na @2a * //
analyzed: de la spyi ni lus la sogs pa'i las la phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa ste / de ni thabs kyis bsdus pa'i las nyid de las de dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad la khyab pas na @2a * //
translated: The general is the correct engagement in the actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: spyi zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: spyi zhes bya'o ;
translated: That is the action subsumed by method. It is called general because it pervades all the virtuous actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: / khyad par ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: / khyad par ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa ste /
translated: The specific is the performance of the six perfections.

original: de ni phyis 'chad do //
analyzed: de ni phyis 'chad do //
translated: That will be explained later.🔽Just as forests, mountains, and rivers

original: tshal dang ri dang lus can chu bo dag / thams cad ji ltar sa la gnas pa bzhin //
analyzed: tshal dang ri dang lus can chu bo dag / thams cad ji ltar sa la gnas pa bzhin //
translated: all rest on the earth,🔽so, in brief, the wise say that

original: de bzhin sbyin pa la sogs dge ba dag / mdor na blo can las rnams gsum las brjod //
analyzed: de bzhin sbyin pa la sogs dge ba dag / mdor na blo can las rnams gsum las brjod //
translated: all virtues rest on the three actions.

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis dge ba rnams ldang ba'i thabs bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis dge ba rnams ldang ba'i thabs bstan te /
translated: This verse shows the means of engaging in virtue.🔽For example, just as forests, mountains, and rivers

original: dper na tshal dang / ri dang lus can te sems can dang / chu bo dags chen po'i steng na gnas shing /
analyzed: dper na tshal dang / ri dang lus can te sems can dang / chu bo dags chen po'i steng na gnas shing /
translated: all rest on the earth,🔽so, in brief, the wise say that all virtues rest on the three actions.

original: sa la brten pa dang sa las skye ba de bzhin du /🔽mdor na blo can byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus dang / ngag dang / yid gsum gyi las rnam par dag pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams dang ; byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun la sogs pa'i chos rnams de la gnas shing /
analyzed: sa la brten pa dang sa las skye ba de bzhin du / mdor na blo can byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus dang / ngag dang / yid gsum gyi las rnam par dag pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams dang ; byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun la sogs pa'i chos rnams de la gnas shing /
translated: Just as the tree is based on the earth and grows from the earth,🔽in brief, the pure actions of body, speech, and mind of the wise bodhisattvas are based on the perfections such as generosity and on the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, and🔽the perfections and the factors of enlightenment grow from those pure actions.

original: las rnam pa gsum dag las skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las rnam pa gsum dag las skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: dpe'i skabs don rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: dpe'i skabs don rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
translated: Four types of examples are taught:

original: longs spyod dang / za ba po dang / brtan pa dang / mi brtan pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod dang / za ba po dang / brtan pa dang / mi brtan pa'o //
translated: enjoyment, the enjoyer, the stable, and the unstable.

original: de la tshal smos pas ni longs spyod kyi dngos po bstan te /
analyzed: de la tshal smos pas ni longs spyod kyi dngos po bstan te /
translated: Among them, the mention of the forest indicates the things of enjoyment.

original: mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mdo las kyang /
translated: Also, a sutra says:

original: bcom ldan 'das dze ta'i tshal na bzhugs zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dze ta'i tshal na bzhugs zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavat abides in Jetavana.

original: lus can zhes bya bas za ba po bstan to //
analyzed: lus can zhes bya bas za ba po bstan to //
translated: The phrase “embodied beings” indicates the enjoyer.

original: sems can dang @2b ri zhes bya bas brtan pa bstan to //
analyzed: sems can dang @2b ri zhes bya bas brtan pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “sentient beings” indicates the stable.

original: chu bo zhes bya bas mi brtan pa bstan to //
analyzed: chu bo zhes bya bas mi brtan pa bstan to //
translated: The river shows the unstable.

original: de yang mdor na rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ste /
analyzed: de yang mdor na rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ste /
translated: And that is in brief of two kinds.🔽The mountains and forests show the stable things.

original: ri dang tshal gyis ni brtan pa'i dngos po bstan /🔽lus can dang chu bos ni mi brtan pa'i dngos po bstan to //
analyzed: ri dang tshal gyis ni brtan pa'i dngos po bstan / lus can dang chu bos ni mi brtan pa'i dngos po bstan to //
translated: The beings and the river show the unstable things.

original: sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa'i grangs su dbye na ;
analyzed: sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa'i grangs su dbye na ;
translated: When classified as animate and inanimate,

original: lus can ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus can ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: the beings are included in the animate.

original: tshal dang ri dang chu bo ni sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa'o //🔽da tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ldang ba'i thabs bstan te /
analyzed: tshal dang ri dang chu bo ni sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa'o // da tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ldang ba'i thabs bstan te /
translated: The forests, mountains, and rivers are included in the inanimate.🔽Now two verses on the method of rising from that meditative practice.🔽And that is of two kinds: the method of rising from the meditative practice of the universal vehicle, and the method of rising from the meditative practice of the other vehicle.🔽The universal vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the universal vehicle.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis las bslang ba'i thabs bstan to //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis las bslang ba'i thabs bstan to //
translated: The other vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the other vehicle.🔽The universal vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the universal vehicle.🔽The other vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the other vehicle.🔽The universal vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the universal vehicle.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni theg pa chen po la skyo pa las bslang ba dang / theg pa gzhan du ltung ba las bslang ba'o //🔽sna tshogs rang bzhin bskal pa mang pos mthar phyin pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni theg pa chen po la skyo pa las bslang ba dang / theg pa gzhan du ltung ba las bslang ba'o // sna tshogs rang bzhin bskal pa mang pos mthar phyin pa'i //
translated: The other vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the other vehicle.🔽The universal vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the universal vehicle.🔽The other vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the other vehicle.🔽The universal vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the universal vehicle.🔽The other vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the other vehicle.🔽The universal vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the universal vehicle.🔽The other vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the other vehicle.🔽The universal vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the universal vehicle.🔽The other vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the other vehicle.🔽The universal vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the universal vehicle.🔽The other vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the other vehicle.🔽The universal vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the universal vehicle.🔽The other vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the other vehicle.🔽The universal vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the universal vehicle.

original: rab tu dka' ba'i las la brtson pa'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: rab tu dka' ba'i las la brtson pa'i bdag nyid de //
translated: The other vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the other vehicle.🔽The universal vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the universal vehicle.🔽The other vehicle is the method of rising from the meditative practice of the other vehicle

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi mtshan nyid las rnams la //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi mtshan nyid las rnams la //
translated: In the activities of body, speech, and mind,

original: rgyal ba'i sras dag zhum par yongs su mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras dag zhum par yongs su mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the victors’ spiritual heir does not become discouraged.

original: sems can rnams kyi don dang ched du byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don dang ched du byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, in order to perfect the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas phyi'i dngos po bu smad dang / nor rdzas la sogs pa gtong ba dang / nang gi dngos po mgo dang rkang lag dang mig la sogs pa yan lag dam pa gtong ba ni sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas phyi'i dngos po bu smad dang / nor rdzas la sogs pa gtong ba dang / nang gi dngos po mgo dang rkang lag dang mig la sogs pa yan lag dam pa gtong ba ni sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva gives away external things such as children, spouse, wealth, and possessions, and internal things such as the most excellent parts of the body, the head, legs, hands, eyes, and so on, through the three doors of body, speech, and mind. This is called “the various kinds.”

original: de lta bu yang lo dang zla ba rnams kyis spyad pas /
analyzed: de lta bu yang lo dang zla ba rnams kyis spyad pas /
translated: Even such practice, practiced for years and months,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: will not perfect the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du spyad cing btang na /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du spyad cing btang na /
translated: But if one practices and gives for three measureless kalpas,

original: gdod pa sod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs shing mthar phyin par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: gdod pa sod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs shing mthar phyin par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Because they complete and perfect the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: bskal pa mang pos mthar phyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bskal pa mang pos mthar phyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: they are called “perfected over many eons.”

original: de 'dra ba'i bar du dka' ba'i las la brtson pa'i bdag nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten pa ma yin gyi byang chub sems dpa' la yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bar du dka' ba'i las la brtson pa'i bdag nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten pa ma yin gyi byang chub sems dpa' la yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are not śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, or worldly beings who strive at difficult practices for such a long time.

original: de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dka' ba'i las la spyad cing zhugs kyang rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' rnams la zhum par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dka' ba'i las la spyad cing zhugs kyang rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' rnams la zhum par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, although they engage in and practice difficult actions with the characteristics of body, speech, and mind, the Victor’s heirs, the bodhisattvas, are not discouraged.

original: brtson 'grus zhan par mi 'gyur zhing skyo bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus zhan par mi 'gyur zhing skyo bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they do not become weak in their diligence and do not become weary.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dus ring por spyad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus ring por spyad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they practice for a long time.

original: theg pa @3a * //
analyzed: theg pa @3a * //
translated: The Great

original: chen po la dus ring por goms par byas na bdag nyid theg pa chen po'i rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chen po la dus ring por goms par byas na bdag nyid theg pa chen po'i rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and by cultivating the Great Vehicle for a long time, one becomes by nature a Great Vehicle person.

original: mdo gzhan dag las kyang dge ba'i chos rnams la sngon goms par byas pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las kyang dge ba'i chos rnams la sngon goms par byas pa'i rgyus /
translated: In other scriptures, it is said that by the cause of having previously cultivated virtuous dharmas,

original: de dang 'dra ba'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: one will actualize a corresponding maturation.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par smin pa grub pas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par smin pa grub pas /
translated: And by actualizing such a maturation,

original: gang gi phyir ma brtags par yang de spyad pa la dag par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma brtags par yang de spyad pa la dag par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: one will be purified by practicing it, even without analysis.

original: de ltar bskal pa mang por theg pa chen po la spyad na theg pa chen po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba rnams ni /
analyzed: de ltar bskal pa mang por theg pa chen po la spyad na theg pa chen po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba rnams ni /
translated: Thus, if one practices the Great Vehicle for many eons, one becomes a Great Vehicle person.

original: rmi lam na yang de la spyod par rmis te /
analyzed: rmi lam na yang de la spyod par rmis te /
translated: Even in dreams, one dreams of practicing it.

original: de bas na theg pa chen po la skyo bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dis ni theg pa chen po la skyo ba las bslang bar bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na theg pa chen po la skyo bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dis ni theg pa chen po la skyo ba las bslang bar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, one does not become weary of the Great Vehicle. Thus, this shows how to rise up from weariness with the Great Vehicle.

original: ji ltar dug dang mtshon dang dgra dang gnam lcags dag / bdag la phan phyir rang gi gnam las bzlog pa bzhin //🔽de bzhin las rnam gsum yang rgyal ba'i sras dag gis //
analyzed: ji ltar dug dang mtshon dang dgra dang gnam lcags dag / bdag la phan phyir rang gi gnam las bzlog pa bzhin // de bzhin las rnam gsum yang rgyal ba'i sras dag gis //
translated: Just as poison, weapons, enemies, and lightning are turned away from those who wish to benefit themselves,

original: theg pa ngan pa rnam pa gnyis las bzlog par bya //
analyzed: theg pa ngan pa rnam pa gnyis las bzlog par bya //
translated: so the three actions are turned away from the two lower vehicles by the victors’ spiritual heirs.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here is how it is.

original: dper na skyes bu la la zhig bdag la phan par 'dod pa dag gi lus dang / sems la mi gnod par bya ba dang / srog gi bar chad du mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /🔽lus dang sems la gnod par 'gyur ba'i dngos po /🔽dug dang mtshon dang dgra dang gnam lcags dag la bdag gi gnam las bzlog cing skyo par byed de /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu la la zhig bdag la phan par 'dod pa dag gi lus dang / sems la mi gnod par bya ba dang / srog gi bar chad du mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir / lus dang sems la gnod par 'gyur ba'i dngos po / dug dang mtshon dang dgra dang gnam lcags dag la bdag gi gnam las bzlog cing skyo par byed de /
translated: Some people who wish to benefit themselves turn away from under the sky the things that harm the body and mind and do not become obstacles to life—🔽things such as poison, weapons, enemies, and lightning—

original: dug mi za mtshon gyis mi 'debs dgra dang gnam lcags la sogs pa byung na zlog par byed do //
analyzed: dug mi za mtshon gyis mi 'debs dgra dang gnam lcags la sogs pa byung na zlog par byed do //
translated: and they avoid them, not eating the poison, not wielding the weapons, not engaging with the enemies, and so on.

original: de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' yang theg pa ngan pa ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' yang theg pa ngan pa ste /
translated: In the same way, bodhisattvas turn away from the two lower vehicles,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis kyi spyod pa la lus dang ngag dang yid gsum mi 'jug cing las gsum gyi sgo nas dge ba spyad pa theg pa gnyis su sngo bar mi byed do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis kyi spyod pa la lus dang ngag dang yid gsum mi 'jug cing las gsum gyi sgo nas dge ba spyad pa theg pa gnyis su sngo bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not engage in the practices of the two vehicles, the Hearers’ Vehicle and the Solitary Realizers’ Vehicle, with his body, speech, and mind, and he does not dedicate the virtue he has practiced through the three doors to the two vehicles.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhi ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhi ba ste /
translated: This is the peace of the Bodhisattva.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa btang nas /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa btang nas /
translated: Having given up the Bodhisattva practice,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la brten pa dang / lus la sogs pa'i sgo nas dge ba spyad pa rnams theg pa ngan par bsngo ba ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la brten pa dang / lus la sogs pa'i sgo nas dge ba spyad pa rnams theg pa ngan par bsngo ba ste /
translated: he dedicates the virtue he has practiced through his body and so forth to the two lower vehicles.

original: de ltar bsngos na theg pa chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rtsa ba nas chad cing med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar bsngos na theg pa chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rtsa ba nas chad cing med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If he dedicates in that way, the roots of virtue of the Great Vehicle will be cut off and will not exist.

original: theg pa chung ngur bsngo ba ni dug dang mtshon la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rig nas der sngo bar mi byed do /
analyzed: theg pa chung ngur bsngo ba ni dug dang mtshon la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rig nas der sngo bar mi byed do /
translated: Knowing that dedicating to the lower vehicles is like poison, weapons, and so forth, he does not dedicate to those.

original: 'dis ni theg pa gzhan du ltung ba las bslang ba'i thabs bstan to /
analyzed: 'dis ni theg pa gzhan du ltung ba las bslang ba'i thabs bstan to /
translated: This shows the method of lifting up from falling into the other vehicles.

original: @3b tshigs su bcad pa de gnyis kyis ldang pa'i thabs bstan to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @3b tshigs su bcad pa de gnyis kyis ldang pa'i thabs bstan to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two verses teach the method of rising.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa dang / gsum pas ni ldang ba'i thabs bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa dang / gsum pas ni ldang ba'i thabs bstan te /
translated: The second and third verses teach the method of rising.

original: de la yang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ni theg pa chen po las skyo ba las bslang ba'i thabs bstan /
analyzed: de la yang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ni theg pa chen po las skyo ba las bslang ba'i thabs bstan /
translated: Therein, the second verse teaches the method of rising from weariness with the Great Vehicle.

original: gsum pas ni theg pa gzhan du ltung ba las bslang ba'i thabs bstan te rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsum pas ni theg pa gzhan du ltung ba las bslang ba'i thabs bstan te rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The third verse teaches the method of rising from falling into other vehicles.

original: dug la sogs pa dang 'dra ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dug la sogs pa dang 'dra ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The analogy of poison, etc.

original: dper na dug dang mtshon la sogs pas sems can dang sems can ma yin pa dag ma rung zhing 'chi bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na dug dang mtshon la sogs pas sems can dang sems can ma yin pa dag ma rung zhing 'chi bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as poison, weapons, etc., render sentient and insentient things useless and kill them,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi las theg pa ngan par bsngos pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi las theg pa ngan par bsngos pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: so also the three actions of body, speech, and mind dedicated to the Individual Vehicle are like that.

original: theg pa ngan par bsngos pas theg pa ngan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyer zad kyi /
analyzed: theg pa ngan par bsngos pas theg pa ngan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyer zad kyi /
translated: Because they are dedicated to the Individual Vehicle, they produce only the roots of virtue of the Individual Vehicle.

original: byang chub chen po 'thob pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub chen po 'thob pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The roots of virtue for attaining great enlightenment are severed.

original: theg pa chen po la dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa dang / ma skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'jig pa dang / sangs rgyas pa phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'i bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa dang / ma skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'jig pa dang / sangs rgyas pa phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'i bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the roots of virtue for the Great Vehicle are severed, roots of virtue that have not arisen do not arise, roots of virtue that have arisen are destroyed, and the attainment of the perfection of Buddhahood is obstructed.

original: theg pa ngan par bsngos pa'i las rnams ni dug dang mtshon cha dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: theg pa ngan par bsngos pa'i las rnams ni dug dang mtshon cha dang 'dra ste /
translated: Karma dedicated to the lower vehicles is like poison and weapons.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod do zhes bshad pa de ji ltar gcod pa bshad de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod do zhes bshad pa de ji ltar gcod pa bshad de /
translated: It is explained that it severs the roots of virtue. How is it severed?

original: dper na mtshon chas shing gi rtsa ba bcad na lo ma dang / sdong bu dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu rnams mi skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mtshon chas shing gi rtsa ba bcad na lo ma dang / sdong bu dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu rnams mi skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, if the roots of a tree are cut with a weapon, leaves, branches, flowers, and fruits do not grow.

original: lus la sogs pa'i sgo nas dge ba spyad pa theg pa ngan pa gnyis su bsngos na /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i sgo nas dge ba spyad pa theg pa ngan pa gnyis su bsngos na /
translated: In the same way, if virtue practiced through the body and so forth is dedicated to the two lower vehicles,

original: byang chub chen po'i rtsa ba byang chub kyi sems gcod pa dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa ba dang myu gu bcad na pha rol tu phyin pa 'dab ma dang 'dra ba dang / sa bcu'i sdong bu dang 'dra ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun me tog dang 'dra ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i rtsa ba byang chub kyi sems gcod pa dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa ba dang myu gu bcad na pha rol tu phyin pa 'dab ma dang 'dra ba dang / sa bcu'i sdong bu dang 'dra ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun me tog dang 'dra ba dang /
translated: The root of great enlightenment is the Thought of Enlightenment, and if the root and sprout of the Thought of Enlightenment are cut, the perfections, which are like the leaves, and the ten grounds, which are like the trunk, and the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, which are like the flowers,

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa byang chub chen po 'bras bu dang 'dra ba mi skye bas na mtshon dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa byang chub chen po 'bras bu dang 'dra ba mi skye bas na mtshon dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: and the great enlightenment endowed with the qualities of powers, fearlessnesses, and so on, which is like the fruit, will not be produced. Therefore, it should be known as like a weapon.

original: dper na dug sa phyogs gang du phog pa der lo tog ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na dug sa phyogs gang du phog pa der lo tog ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, in whatever place a poisonous plant is, crops that have not yet grown will not grow.

original: dge ba'i las theg pa ngan pa gnyis su bsngos na theg pa chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma skyes pa rnams mi skye bas na dug dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i las theg pa ngan pa gnyis su bsngos na theg pa chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma skyes pa rnams mi skye bas na dug dang 'dra'o //
translated: In the same way, if virtuous karma is dedicated to the two lower vehicles, the roots of virtue of the Great Vehicle will not grow, and so it is like a poison.

original: dper na gnam lcags kyis 'bru dang lo tog rnams skyes pa 'jig cing med par byed pa bzhin du las rnam pa gsum gyis dge ba @4a * //
analyzed: dper na gnam lcags kyis 'bru dang lo tog rnams skyes pa 'jig cing med par byed pa bzhin du las rnam pa gsum gyis dge ba @4a * //
translated: For example, just as hail destroys and annihilates crops and harvests, the three types of karma destroy and annihilate virtue.🔽

original: spyad pa theg pa ngan par bsngos na theg pa chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes pa'i 'bru rnams 'jig cing med par 'gyur bas gnam lcags dang 'dra'o //🔽dper na dgras longs spyod dang dge ba sna tshogs kyi bgegs dang bar chad byed pa de bzhin du las gsum gyi sgo nas dge ba spyad pa la theg pa ngan par bsngos na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis phun sum tshogs pa'i bde ba stobs dang mi
analyzed: spyad pa theg pa ngan par bsngos na theg pa chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes pa'i 'bru rnams 'jig cing med par 'gyur bas gnam lcags dang 'dra'o // dper na dgras longs spyod dang dge ba sna tshogs kyi bgegs dang bar chad byed pa de bzhin du las gsum gyi sgo nas dge ba spyad pa la theg pa ngan par bsngos na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis phun sum tshogs pa'i bde ba stobs dang mi
translated: Just as hail destroys and annihilates the seeds and crops, in the same way, the three kinds of action destroy and annihilate the seeds of the wholesome which have been planted in the Great Vehicle, if one dedicates the practice of the wholesome to the Lesser Vehicle.🔽Thus, it is like hail.

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thob pa la sogs pa la bgegs su 'gyur bas na dgra dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thob pa la sogs pa la bgegs su 'gyur bas na dgra dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as enemies create obstacles to the enjoyment of various kinds of wealth and virtue, in the same way, the three kinds of action create obstacles to the attainment of the qualities of the Lord Buddha, such as the perfections, the powers, the fearlessnesses, etc., if one dedicates the practice of the wholesome to the Lesser Vehicle, when it has been planted in the Great Vehicle.🔽Thus, it is like an enemy.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas ni las gsum rnam par dag pa'i thabs bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas ni las gsum rnam par dag pa'i thabs bstan te /
translated: The fourth verse teaches the means of purification of the three kinds of action.

original: de'i phyir byed pa dang las dang las kyi bya ba gsum du rtog brtag tu dmigs pa med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa dang las dang las kyi bya ba gsum du rtog brtag tu dmigs pa med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the three, the agent, the object, and the action, are not imagined to exist.

original: byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid de /
analyzed: byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid de /
translated: The agent is the bodhisattva himself.

original: de yang yod pa'i rtog pa'i dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: de yang yod pa'i rtog pa'i dmigs pa med de /
translated: He also does not imagine the object of the conception of existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang zag la bdag med par rtog pas yod par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par rtog pas yod par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because he conceives the selflessness of the person, he does not conceive the existence of the person.

original: las ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos pha rol tu phyin pa drug ste /
analyzed: las ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos pha rol tu phyin pa drug ste /
translated: The object is the phenomena to be accomplished, the six perfections.

original: de la yang yod par rtog pa'i dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: de la yang yod par rtog pa'i dmigs pa med do //
translated: He also does not imagine the object of the conception of existence in them.

original: las kyi bya ba ni brtson 'grus gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed de de la yang yod par rtog pa'i dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: las kyi bya ba ni brtson 'grus gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed de de la yang yod par rtog pa'i dmigs pa med de /
translated: The action is the effort by which he accomplishes the perfections. He also does not imagine the object of the conception of existence in that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos la bdag med par rtog pas na de dag la yod par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par rtog pas na de dag la yod par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because he conceives the selflessness of phenomena, he does not conceive the existence of those.

original: de bas de yi las 'di rnam dag pha rol du //
analyzed: de bas de yi las 'di rnam dag pha rol du //
translated: Therefore, this action of his is pure, and he is called a true bodhisattva.

original: 'gro bar 'gyur ba mtha' yas thabs ni gzung ba'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur ba mtha' yas thabs ni gzung ba'i phyir // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The means to attain the infinite goals of beings is the practice of the transcendences.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' byed pa dang / las dang / las kyi bya ba gsum la mi rtog cing mi dmigs pa de ni ;
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' byed pa dang / las dang / las kyi bya ba gsum la mi rtog cing mi dmigs pa de ni ;
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva does not conceptualize or objectify the three kinds of action, action, action as performance, and action as deed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i las rnam gsum rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i las rnam gsum rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: This is the bodhisattva's purification of the three kinds of action.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi thabs kyis zin pa'i phyir las rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi thabs kyis zin pa'i phyir las rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it is embraced by the means of nonconceptual intuition, it is called the purification of action.

original: las des ni yon tan mtha' yas pa'i pha rol du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: las des ni yon tan mtha' yas pa'i pha rol du 'gro ba ste /
translated: By that action, one goes to the far shore of infinite excellences.

original: 'khor ba'i mthar yang ma zad pa'i mtshan nyid sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mthar yang ma zad pa'i mtshan nyid sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And one becomes a buddha, with the characteristic of inexhaustibility even at the end of cyclic existence.

original: thabs dang ldan pa'i las kyi skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: thabs dang ldan pa'i las kyi skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the chapter on the practice of means.

original: // / pha rol tu phyin pa dbye ba bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / pha rol tu phyin pa dbye ba bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The chapter on the transcendences.

original: thabs dang ldan pa'i las kyi skabs bshad pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: thabs dang ldan pa'i las kyi skabs bshad pa'i rjes la /
translated: The section on karma endowed with the method is explained after that.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs bshad pa'i 'brel ba @4b ci yod ce na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs bshad pa'i 'brel ba @4b ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the section on the deeds endowed with means and the section on the perfections?

original: gong du bslab pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gong du bslab pa gnyis te /
translated: Previously it was said that there are two trainings:🔽the general and the specific.

original: spyi dang khyad par ro zhes smos pa las bslab pa'i spyi ni thabs dang ldan pa'i las kyi skabs su bshad de /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par ro zhes smos pa las bslab pa'i spyi ni thabs dang ldan pa'i las kyi skabs su bshad de /
translated: The general training was explained in the section on the deeds endowed with means,

original: dri ni dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad la khyab pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: dri ni dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad la khyab pa yin par bstan to //
translated: and it was taught that the perfume of virtue pervades all the formations of virtuous deeds.

original: da ni khyad par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni khyad par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the specific training will be explained.

original: de bas na de bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it will be explained.

original: bslab pa'i khyad par ni bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshogs bsags pa la phan par byed de de ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis byed do //
analyzed: bslab pa'i khyad par ni bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshogs bsags pa la phan par byed de de ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis byed do //
translated: The specific training benefits the accumulation of the collections of the qualities of a buddha for oneself, and that is accomplished by the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni bdag gi rgyud kyi dge ba kun la khyab pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni bdag gi rgyud kyi dge ba kun la khyab pa ste /
translated: The perfections pervade all the virtues in one's continuum.

original: de ni phyis 'chad do //
analyzed: de ni phyis 'chad do //
translated: That will be explained later.

original: de las grangs dang / de bsgrubs na bdag nyid yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las grangs dang / de bsgrubs na bdag nyid yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, the number, and if that is accomplished, one is completely liberated.

original: bdag grol na gzhan yang grol yang nus te /
analyzed: bdag grol na gzhan yang grol yang nus te /
translated: If one is liberated, one is also able to liberate others.

original: de bas na bdag la phan par bya ba'i phyir ni sngar pha rol tu phyin pa bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na bdag la phan par bya ba'i phyir ni sngar pha rol tu phyin pa bshad do //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of benefiting oneself, the perfections are explained first.

original: de nas gzhan la phan par gzhag pa'i phyir ni /
analyzed: de nas gzhan la phan par gzhag pa'i phyir ni /
translated: Then, for the sake of establishing the benefit of others,

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bsgrub ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bsgrub ste /
translated: the means of gathering are accomplished.

original: de ni phyis 'chad do //
analyzed: de ni phyis 'chad do //
translated: That will be explained later.

original: de la grangs dang de'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bshad do //
analyzed: de la grangs dang de'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bshad do //
translated: There, one verse explains the meaning of the perfections, beginning with number and definition.

original: longs spyod dang ni bdag lus zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: longs spyod dang ni bdag lus zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbye ba bstan to //
translated: Enjoyment and one's own body and so on explain the divisions of the perfections.

original: grangs dang de yi mtshan nyid go rims dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grangs dang de yi mtshan nyid go rims dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Number, definition, order,

original: spyi don rnam pa bcus pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad de de ni grangs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi don rnam pa bcus pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad de de ni grangs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the perfections are explained in ten general topics, which are the number and so on.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du grangs nges kyi //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du grangs nges kyi //
translated: The six perfections are definitely a fixed number.

original: de las mang du yang mi rung nyung du yang mi rung bar bstan pa ni grangs kyi don gyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de las mang du yang mi rung nyung du yang mi rung bar bstan pa ni grangs kyi don gyis bshad pa'o //
translated: It is shown that it is not right to have more than that, nor less. This is the explanation by way of the meaning of number.

original: sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa nas /
translated: The explanation of the characteristics of generosity,

original: shes rab kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa bstan pa ni mtshan nyid kyi don to zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa bstan pa ni mtshan nyid kyi don to zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: up to the explanation of the characteristics of wisdom is the explanation by way of the meaning of characteristics.

original: dang por ci'i phyir sbyin pa de'i 'og tu ci'i phyir tshul khrims bshad ces pa'i don bstan pa ni go rims kyi don gyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dang por ci'i phyir sbyin pa de'i 'og tu ci'i phyir tshul khrims bshad ces pa'i don bstan pa ni go rims kyi don gyis bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the meaning of sequence is the teaching of why generosity is first, and why morality is taught after that.

original: nges pa'i tshig dang goms dang yon tan dang / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig dang goms dang yon tan dang / zhes bya ba la /
translated: The explanation by way of the meaning of the etymologies is

original: ci'i phyir sbyin pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyin pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the teaching of why it is called generosity,

original: ci'i phyir shes rab ces bya ba zhes bstan pa ni nges pa'i tshig gi don gyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes rab ces bya ba zhes bstan pa ni nges pa'i tshig gi don gyis bshad pa'o //
translated: up to the teaching of why it is called wisdom.

original: sbyin pa la ci'i phyir bsgom pa nas shes rab la ji ltar bsgom pa bstan pa ni goms pa'i don gyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la ci'i phyir bsgom pa nas shes rab la ji ltar bsgom pa bstan pa ni goms pa'i don gyis bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the meaning of cultivation from the cultivation of generosity up to the cultivation of wisdom is the explanation by the meaning of cultivation.

original: sbyin pa la yon tan ci yod pa nas shes rab la yon tan ci yod ba bstan pa ni nges pa'i tshig gi don gyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la yon tan ci yod pa nas shes rab la yon tan ci yod ba bstan pa ni nges pa'i tshig gi don gyis bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the qualities of generosity up to the qualities of wisdom is the explanation by the meaning of the definition.

original: de yi dbye ba bsdu dang mi mthun phyogs //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽sbyin pa la phye na du yod pa @5a * //
analyzed: de yi dbye ba bsdu dang mi mthun phyogs // zhes bya ba la / sbyin pa la phye na du yod pa @5a * //
translated: Their divisions, inclusion, and discordances.

original: nas shes rab la phyin du yod pa bstan pa ni de'i dbye bas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: nas shes rab la phyin du yod pa bstan pa ni de'i dbye bas bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the divisions from the divisions of generosity up to the divisions of wisdom is the explanation by the divisions.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsdus na drug las kyang bsdus na 'di tsam zhig ston to zhes bstan pa ni bsdu bas bshad pa'o //🔽sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa bstan pa nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsdus na drug las kyang bsdus na 'di tsam zhig ston to zhes bstan pa ni bsdu bas bshad pa'o // sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa bstan pa nas /
translated: The explanation of the inclusion from the inclusion of the six perfections up to the inclusion of wisdom is the explanation by the inclusion.

original: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa bstan pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa bstan pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the discordances from the explanation of the discordances of generosity up to the explanation of the discordances of wisdom is the explanation by the discordances.

original: yon tan phan tshun nges par shes par bya //
analyzed: yon tan phan tshun nges par shes par bya //
translated: The qualities are mutually determined.

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽sbyin pa'i nang du yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'dus pa nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / sbyin pa'i nang du yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'dus pa nas /
translated: In the verse,🔽it is shown that the six perfections are included in each of the perfections, from generosity to wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi nang du yang sbyin pa la sogs pa drug 'dus par bstan pa ni yon tan phan tshun nges par bshad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi nang du yang sbyin pa la sogs pa drug 'dus par bstan pa ni yon tan phan tshun nges par bshad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called the explanation of the mutual determination of the qualities.

original: grangs rnam par dbye ba'i tshig su bcad pa rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grangs rnam par dbye ba'i tshig su bcad pa rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are six verses on the analysis of the number.

original: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i grags ni drug nyid du bshad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i grags ni drug nyid du bshad de /
translated: The number of perfections is explained as just six,

original: bdun la sogs par mang du yang mi bshad /
analyzed: bdun la sogs par mang du yang mi bshad /
translated: not more, such as seven,

original: lnga la sogs par nyung du yang mi bshad par ci'i phyir grangs drug tu bshad ce na /
analyzed: lnga la sogs par nyung du yang mi bshad par ci'i phyir grangs drug tu bshad ce na /
translated: nor less, such as five.

original: grangs nges par bshad pa ni tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan to zhes bya pa'i don to //
analyzed: grangs nges par bshad pa ni tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan to zhes bya pa'i don to //
translated: The explanation of the determination of the number is given in six verses.

original: dang po ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dang po ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first is

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i grangs nges pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan to zhes glengs pa las tshigs su bcad pa dang po ji bstan to //🔽mngon par 'byung pa'i rgyu dang / nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba dang / bya ba dag la phyin ci log med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i grangs nges pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan to zhes glengs pa las tshigs su bcad pa dang po ji bstan to // mngon par 'byung pa'i rgyu dang / nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba dang / bya ba dag la phyin ci log med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The definite number of the perfections is shown by six verses.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du gzhag go //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du gzhag go //
translated: The six perfections are established from the point of view of the cause of renunciation, of non-subjection to the addictions, and of non-error in action.

original: de las grangs mang yang mi mnang nyung yang mi nyung ngo zhes bya pa'i don to //🔽longs spyod dang ni bdag lus phun sum tshogs //🔽g-yog 'khor phun sum tshogs pa mngon par 'byung //
analyzed: de las grangs mang yang mi mnang nyung yang mi nyung ngo zhes bya pa'i don to // longs spyod dang ni bdag lus phun sum tshogs // g-yog 'khor phun sum tshogs pa mngon par 'byung //
translated: The meaning is that there is no more than six perfections, and no less.🔽Renunciation, the perfection of giving, is the cause of the perfection of the life of the bodhisattva.🔽The perfection of morality is the cause of the perfection of retinue.

original: zhes bya ba la mngon par 'byung ba ni 'khor ba'i longs spyod dang pa de ba la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mngon par 'byung ba ni 'khor ba'i longs spyod dang pa de ba la bya ste /
translated: Renunciation is the renunciation of the enjoyments of cyclic life.

original: de'i rgyu ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang brtson 'grus te bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang brtson 'grus te bzhi'o //
translated: The cause of that is the four perfections of giving, morality, patience, and exertion.

original: ji ltar rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are they the cause?

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag dang gdol ba la sogs pa yo byad kyis phongs pa rnams la /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dang gdol ba la sogs pa yo byad kyis phongs pa rnams la /
translated: To brahmins, householders, outcastes, and so on who are in need of material goods,

original: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad byin pas longs spyod chen por 'gyur te /
analyzed: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad byin pas longs spyod chen por 'gyur te /
translated: they give food, clothing, and so on. As a result, they will have great wealth

original: gter dang 'bru la sogs pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gter dang 'bru la sogs pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will be endowed with abundant treasures, grain, and so on.

original: srog gcod pa spangs pa la sogs pa tshul khrims bsrung bas ni bdag gi lus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spangs pa la sogs pa tshul khrims bsrung bas ni bdag gi lus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
translated: By observing moral discipline, such as by refraining from killing, they will have a perfect body.

original: @5b ngan song gsum du mi skye'i lha dang mi'i nang du skyes nas lha dang mi'i lus 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @5b ngan song gsum du mi skye'i lha dang mi'i nang du skyes nas lha dang mi'i lus 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They will not be reborn in the three lower realms, but will be born among gods and humans and will obtain the bodies of gods and humans.

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang zhe sdang mi ldang zhing slar gnod par ma byas pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni g-yog phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang zhe sdang mi ldang zhing slar gnod par ma byas pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni g-yog phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
translated: By means of the perfection of patience, which is not to be angry or to retaliate even when others harm them, they will have a perfect retinue.

original: tshe 'dir sems can la gnod pa ma byas te ;
analyzed: tshe 'dir sems can la gnod pa ma byas te ;
translated: In this life, they do not harm sentient beings,

original: dga' bar byas pas /
analyzed: dga' bar byas pas /
translated: but make them happy.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du skye bo mang po'i snying du sdug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du skye bo mang po'i snying du sdug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: In other lives, he will be dear to many people,

original: skye bo mang po de'i thad du 'du bar 'gyur bas 'khor phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bo mang po de'i thad du 'du bar 'gyur bas 'khor phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and many people will gather around him. Thus, he will have an excellent retinue.

original: dge ba la sems spro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyad pas ni rtsom pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba la sems spro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyad pas ni rtsom pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
translated: By practicing the perfection of effort, which has the nature of delighting in virtue, he will have excellent undertakings,

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa rnams dge ba'i las bya ba dang / zhing dang tshong la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi bya ba gang dang gang brtsams pa de dang de dag thams cad mthar phyin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa rnams dge ba'i las bya ba dang / zhing dang tshong la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi bya ba gang dang gang brtsams pa de dang de dag thams cad mthar phyin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who have effort will complete all the virtuous actions they have begun, as well as all the worldly activities they have begun, such as farming and commerce.

original: nyon mongs dbang du mi 'gro dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs dbang du mi 'gro dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is not carried away by defilements.

original: lnga pa bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: lnga pa bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro bar byed de /
translated: By means of the perfection of concentration, he is not carried away by defilements.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsam gtan gyi sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa byung ba rnams 'jil zhing gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsam gtan gyi sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa byung ba rnams 'jil zhing gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the afflictions that arise in the mind-stream of the mind of concentration, which has the characteristic of one-pointedness of mind, are destroyed and harmed.

original: bya ba dag la rtag tu log pa med //
analyzed: bya ba dag la rtag tu log pa med //
translated: There is never a reversal in regard to what should be done.

original: ces bya ba la drug pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la drug pa ste /
translated: The sixth is stated:🔽By means of the perfection of wisdom, there is never a reversal in regard to what should be done.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni bya ba dag la rtag tu phyin ci log med de zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba ste rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni bya ba dag la rtag tu phyin ci log med de zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba ste rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: What should be done is twofold: that which should be eliminated and that which should be adopted.

original: de la spang bar bya ba la yang shes rab kyis spang bar bya bar shes nas de la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de la spang bar bya ba la yang shes rab kyis spang bar bya bar shes nas de la mi 'jug go //
translated: With regard to that, having understood that that which should be eliminated should be eliminated by means of wisdom, one does not engage in it.

original: blang bar bya ba la yang shes rab kyis blang bar bya bar shes nas len par byed de /
analyzed: blang bar bya ba la yang shes rab kyis blang bar bya bar shes nas len par byed de /
translated: Having understood that that which should be adopted should be adopted by means of wisdom, one adopts it.

original: de bas na bya ba la phyin ci log med do //
analyzed: de bas na bya ba la phyin ci log med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no reversal in regard to what should be done.

original: yang na bya ba ni rnam par bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang na bya ba ni rnam par bzhi ste /
translated: Or, what should be done is fourfold:

original: shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba dang / mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba dang / mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: that which should be known, that which should be eliminated, that which should be cultivated, and that which should be realized.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni shes par bya ba yin par yongs su shes te /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni shes par bya ba yin par yongs su shes te /
translated: The truth of suffering is to be known, and it is fully known.

original: kun 'byung ni spang bar bya ba yin par shes /
analyzed: kun 'byung ni spang bar bya ba yin par shes /
translated: The origin is to be abandoned, and it is known.

original: lam ni bsgom par bya ba yin par shes /
analyzed: lam ni bsgom par bya ba yin par shes /
translated: The path is to be practiced, and it is known.

original: 'gog pa ni mngon du bya ba yin par shes pas na bya ba la phyin ci log med pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mngon du bya ba yin par shes pas na bya ba la phyin ci log med pa zhes bya'o /
translated: Cessation is to be manifested, and it is known. Thus, it is said that there is no error in action.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ngag gis ni mngon bar 'byung ba rnams pa bzhi sta zhes bya ba la /🔽sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus bzhi ni longs spyod chen po la sogs pa @6a * //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ngag gis ni mngon bar 'byung ba rnams pa bzhi sta zhes bya ba la / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus bzhi ni longs spyod chen po la sogs pa @6a * //
translated: The four perfections of speech are the four kinds of manifestation.🔽Generosity, morality, patience, and effort are the causes of the four kinds of wealth in cyclic existence,

original: 'khor ba'i 'byor ba rnam pa bzhi'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'byor ba rnam pa bzhi'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: such as great wealth, etc.

original: rtsom pa'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsom pa'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: From the point of view of undertaking,

original: 'di ltar mngon par 'byung ba la rtsom pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa la rtsom pa dang / bya ba ma nor ba la rtsom pa'i dbang du byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par 'byung ba la rtsom pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa la rtsom pa dang / bya ba ma nor ba la rtsom pa'i dbang du byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du gzhag ste /
translated: Thus, the six perfections are established in terms of the undertaking of going forth, the undertaking of non-affliction, and the undertaking of non-error in action.

original: mi mang mi nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi mang mi nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are neither more nor less.

original: de la sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus bzhis ni mngon par 'byung ba la rtsom mo //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus bzhis ni mngon par 'byung ba la rtsom mo //
translated: Among them, the four perfections of giving, morality, patience, and effort are the undertaking of going forth.

original: lnga pa bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: lnga pa bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa rtsom mo //
translated: The fifth perfection of meditative concentration is the undertaking of non-affliction.🔽The sixth perfection of wisdom is the undertaking of non-error in action.

original: drug pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni bya ba la nor pa med par rtsom mo //
analyzed: drug pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni bya ba la nor pa med par rtsom mo //
translated: The verse says,

original: sems can don la rab brtson pa //
analyzed: sems can don la rab brtson pa //
translated: The one who is diligent in benefiting sentient beings

original: gtong dang mi gtong bzod pas byed //
analyzed: gtong dang mi gtong bzod pas byed //
translated: accomplishes it through giving, non-giving, and patience.

original: ces bya ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ni bdag gi don byed pa dang gzhan gyi don byed pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ni bdag gi don byed pa dang gzhan gyi don byed pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In the second verse, in terms of accomplishing one's own purpose and accomplishing others' purposes,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du bshad de mi mang mi nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du bshad de mi mang mi nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The six perfections themselves are explained, not more and not less.

original: de la sems can gyi don la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: de la sems can gyi don la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva who is intent on the welfare of sentient beings

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang gsum gyis ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang gsum gyis ni /
translated: with the three perfections of generosity, morality, and patience

original: gzhan gyi don byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don byed de /
translated: acts for the welfare of others.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sbyin pas ni bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa gtong bas don byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pas ni bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa gtong bas don byed do //
translated: With generosity, he acts for their welfare by giving away food, clothing, and so forth.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni gzhan gyi srog mi gcod /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni gzhan gyi srog mi gcod /
translated: With morality, he acts for their welfare by not taking the life of others,

original: nor ma byin par mi len /
analyzed: nor ma byin par mi len /
translated: not taking their wealth,

original: chung ma la mi tshangs par mi spyod /
analyzed: chung ma la mi tshangs par mi spyod /
translated: not engaging in sexual misconduct with their wives,

original: gnod pa mi byed pas don byed do //
analyzed: gnod pa mi byed pas don byed do //
translated: and not harming them.

original: bzod pas ni bdag gi srog dang / nor dang chung ma la gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang lan mi ldon te bzod pa byas pas don byed do //
analyzed: bzod pas ni bdag gi srog dang / nor dang chung ma la gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang lan mi ldon te bzod pa byas pas don byed do //
translated: With patience, he acts for their welfare by not retaliating when others harm his life, wealth, or wife, but by being patient.

original: bzhi dang bcas nas grol ba yis //
analyzed: bzhi dang bcas nas grol ba yis //
translated: With the four, he is liberated,

original: rnam pa kun tu bdag don spyod //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu bdag don spyod //
translated: and always acts for his own welfare.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Therein,

original: brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab gsum gyis ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab gsum gyis ni /
translated: The perfections of effort, meditation, and wisdom

original: rnam pa thams cad du bdag gi don byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bdag gi don byed de /
translated: are for the sake of one's own goal in every way.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gzhi dang bcas pa'i sems gnas pas sems grol bar byas pa'i phyir bdag gi don byed do //
analyzed: gzhi dang bcas pa'i sems gnas pas sems grol bar byas pa'i phyir bdag gi don byed do //
translated: One accomplishes one's own goal by means of the liberation of mind, which is based on the stability of mind.

original: de la gzhi ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzhi ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the perfection of effort is the basis.

original: gnas ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is the stability.

original: grol ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: grol ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the liberation.

original: de'i rim pa yang brtson 'grus brtsams na bsam gtan thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rim pa yang brtson 'grus brtsams na bsam gtan thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The order of these is as follows: When one has begun effort, one attains meditation.

original: bsam gtan gyis sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: Through meditation, one stabilizes the mind that is not yet stabilized.

original: sems mnyam par bzhag na shes rab @6b skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag na shes rab @6b skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind is stabilized, wisdom arises.

original: shes rab kyis ni nyon mongs pa las sems grol bar byed de //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni nyon mongs pa las sems grol bar byed de //
translated: Through wisdom, one liberates the mind from the afflictions.

translated: By morality, one does not harm the life, property, or spouses of others.

analyzed: gtses kyang bzod pas don byed do //
translated: By patience, one does the work of benefitting others even when one is harmed by others, even when one is greatly harmed.

translated: By effort, one does the work of benefitting others without getting discouraged in helping sentient beings with their work.

translated: By concentration, one does the work of benefitting others by performing miracles such as blazing with fire, flying through the sky, and so on, thereby pleasing sentient beings and arousing their faith.

translated: By wisdom, one does the work of benefitting others by explaining the individual and general characteristics of phenomena without error and thereby resolving sentient beings' doubts.
