analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis gzhan gyi don byas pa de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i bdag gi don te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva's own aim is precisely the work of benefitting others through the six perfections.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar gzhan gyi don byas pa las bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi don byas pa las bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in that way, through having performed the aims of others, one attains unsurpassed enlightenment for oneself.

original: de ltar rang dang gzhan gyi don rdzogs pa'i dbang du byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar rang dang gzhan gyi don rdzogs pa'i dbang du byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du bshad de /
translated: Thus, in terms of the complete aims of self and other, the perfections are explained as being six in number.

original: mi mang mi nyung bar sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽longs spyod dag la mi dga' zhing //
analyzed: mi mang mi nyung bar sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i don to // longs spyod dag la mi dga' zhing //
translated: The meaning is that they are applied neither more nor less.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcas pa bzhi pas ni theg pa chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ma lus pa bsdu ba'i dbang du byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du bshad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcas pa bzhi pas ni theg pa chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ma lus pa bsdu ba'i dbang du byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du bshad de /
translated: The fourth verse beginning with “Not delighting in enjoyments” explains the perfections as being six in number in terms of subsuming the entire bodhisattva conduct of the Mahayana.

original: mi mang mi nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi mang mi nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are applied neither more nor less.

original: de la longs spyod kyi sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la bya'o //
analyzed: de la longs spyod kyi sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la bya'o //
translated: In this context, “enjoyments” refers to the five sense objects such as form.

original: de la longs spyod la mi dga' ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de la longs spyod la mi dga' ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Not delighting in enjoyments is the perfection of generosity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: @7a * // sbyin pa la gnas dang longs spyod la mi lta ste /
analyzed: @7a * // sbyin pa la gnas dang longs spyod la mi lta ste /
translated: The bodhisattva does not look to wealth and possessions while practicing generosity.

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po gang la yang mi gtang du mi rung ba'i chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po gang la yang mi gtang du mi rung ba'i chags pa med pa'o //
translated: He is not attached to anything, whether external or internal, that he should not give up.

original: shin tu gtsor byed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu gtsor byed ces bya ba la /
translated: He is the one who is most concerned.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gtsor byed pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gtsor byed pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva’s most important concern is the perfection of morality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab tshig la nyes byas phra mo rdul tsam la yang bag byed cing bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab tshig la nyes byas phra mo rdul tsam la yang bag byed cing bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is concerned with the acceptance of morality and with the protection of the precepts of the bodhisattva vow, even with regard to the slightest fault.

original: gnyis mi skyo zhing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis mi skyo zhing zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is not discouraged by the two.

original: gnyis kyi sgras ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis kyi sgras ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la bya ste /
translated: The word “two” refers to sentient beings and nonsentient beings.

original: de gnyis kyis mi skyo ba ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ; brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis mi skyo ba ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ; brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: He is not discouraged by either of them. This is the perfection of patience and the perfection of effort.

original: de la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni sems can gyis mi skyo ste /
analyzed: de la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni sems can gyis mi skyo ste /
translated: By the perfection of patience, one is not discouraged by sentient beings.

original: sbrang bu dang sha sbrang dang mi la sogs pa gnod par byas kyang bzod pa la gnas pa rnams slar gnod pa mi byed cing /
analyzed: sbrang bu dang sha sbrang dang mi la sogs pa gnod par byas kyang bzod pa la gnas pa rnams slar gnod pa mi byed cing /
translated: Even though one is harmed by flies, mosquitoes, humans, and non-humans, those who abide in patience do not retaliate,

original: sems can mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not abandon sentient beings.

original: sems can ma yin pas mi skyo ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can ma yin pas mi skyo ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: By the perfection of effort, one is not discouraged by non-sentient beings.

original: brtson 'grus kyis nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la zhugs pa na /
translated: When one engages in virtue such as listening and reflection through effort,

original: rlung dang tsha ba dang char pa dang grang ba dang bkres pa la sogs pa'i phyi'i sdug bsngal 'byung yang dge ba la brtson 'grus mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung dang tsha ba dang char pa dang grang ba dang bkres pa la sogs pa'i phyi'i sdug bsngal 'byung yang dge ba la brtson 'grus mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: even if external suffering such as wind, heat, rain, cold, hunger, and so on arise, one does not abandon effort in virtue.

original: yang na gnyis kyi sgras ni /
analyzed: yang na gnyis kyi sgras ni /
translated: Or, the term “two”

original: ye shes kyi tshogs dang bsod nams kyi tshogs la bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs dang bsod nams kyi tshogs la bya ste /
translated: refers to the accumulation of wisdom and the accumulation of merit.

original: de la mi skyo ba ni bzod pa dang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi skyo ba ni bzod pa dang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: With regard to those, not being discouraged is the perfection of patience and the perfection of effort.

original: de la bzod pas ni /
analyzed: de la bzod pas ni /
translated: By means of patience,

original: ye shes kyi tshogs la mi skyo'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs la mi skyo'o //
translated: one does not become weary of the accumulation of wisdom.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gnod pa nyams su len pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa gsum las /
analyzed: gnod pa nyams su len pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa gsum las /
translated: There are three kinds of patience: patience in accepting injury, patience in withstanding suffering, and patience in investigating the Dharma.

original: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pas /
analyzed: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pas /
translated: By means of the patience in investigating the Dharma,

original: chos thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par bzod de /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par bzod de /
translated: one accepts that all dharmas are impermanent, painful, empty, and without self.

original: de bas na bzod pas ni ye shes kyi tshogs la mi skyo'o //
analyzed: de bas na bzod pas ni ye shes kyi tshogs la mi skyo'o //
translated: Therefore, by means of patience, one does not become weary of the accumulation of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs la mi skyo ba ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs la mi skyo ba ste /
translated: By means of effort, one does not become weary of the accumulation of merit.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa na brtson 'grus mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa na brtson 'grus mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not abandon effort in accumulating the merit of giving, morality, etc.

original: rnam par mi rtog rnal 'byor te //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog rnal 'byor te //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: The yoga of non-discrimination.

original: tha ma'i bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis kyis ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgrub ste /
analyzed: tha ma'i bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis kyis ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgrub ste /
translated: The last two perfections, concentration and wisdom, accomplish the concentration of nonconceptualization.

original: @7b ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @7b ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de gnyis kyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong du zung du 'brel ba'i bsam gtan bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong du zung du 'brel ba'i bsam gtan bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they cultivate the concentration of the union of serenity and insight.

original: de la bsam gtan ni zhi gnas so //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan ni zhi gnas so //
translated: Therein, concentration is serenity.

original: shes rab ni lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab ni lhag mthong ngo //
translated: Wisdom is insight.

original: 'dis ni ma lus theg pa mchog ces bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dis ni ma lus theg pa mchog ces bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the unexcelled vehicle.

original: theg pa mchog ni theg pa chen po la bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa mchog ni theg pa chen po la bya ste /
translated: The unexcelled vehicle is the Great Vehicle.

original: longs spyod la mi dga' ba dang / bslab pa la gtsor byed pa gnyis kyis mi skyo ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa la rnal 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod la mi dga' ba dang / bslab pa la gtsor byed pa gnyis kyis mi skyo ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa la rnal 'byor pa ste /
translated: The two, not delighting in enjoyments and making training principal, are the practice of the bodhisattva.

original: theg pa chen po'i don ni 'di tsam du zad de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don ni 'di tsam du zad de /
translated: The meaning of the Great Vehicle is just this;

original: de las lhag pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las lhag pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: there is no meaning beyond this.

original: bzod pa dang brtson 'grus gnyis kyis ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽bzod pas mi dang sbrang bu la sogs pa /
analyzed: bzod pa dang brtson 'grus gnyis kyis ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / bzod pas mi dang sbrang bu la sogs pa /
translated: By means of the two perfections of patience and effort, one endures the harm of sentient beings and non-sentient entities, etc.

original: sems can gyis gnod par byas pa dang tsha ba dang rlung la sogs pa sems can ma yin pas gnod par byas pa'i sdug bsngal bzod do //
analyzed: sems can gyis gnod par byas pa dang tsha ba dang rlung la sogs pa sems can ma yin pas gnod par byas pa'i sdug bsngal bzod do //
translated: By means of patience, one endures the suffering caused by harm from sentient beings, such as humans and insects, and the suffering caused by harm from non-sentient entities, such as heat and cold.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la mi skyo ba ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la mi skyo ba ste /
translated: By means of effort, one does not become weary of the virtues such as listening and reflection.

original: brtson 'grus kyis dge ba la sbyor ba'i las mi gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽yul rnams la ni ma chags lam //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis dge ba la sbyor ba'i las mi gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro // yul rnams la ni ma chags lam //
translated: Because effort causes one to not abandon the activity of applying oneself to virtue.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa lnga pas ni /🔽lam thams cad bsdus pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa lnga pas ni / lam thams cad bsdus pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The five verses beginning with “The path is the absence of attachment to objects”

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du bshad de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du bshad de /
translated: explain the six perfections in terms of subsuming all the paths.

original: mi mang mi nyung ngo //
analyzed: mi mang mi nyung ngo //
translated: There are not more than six perfections, nor fewer.

original: de la yul gyi sgras ni 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la bya ste /
analyzed: de la yul gyi sgras ni 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la bya ste /
translated: Here, the term “objects” refers to the five sense objects.

original: de la ma chags pa'i lam ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma chags pa'i lam ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The path of nonattachment to objects is the perfection of generosity.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sbyin pa la gnas pas ni rtag tu phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong ba la goms pas yul thams cad gtong bar byed kyi /
analyzed: sbyin pa la gnas pas ni rtag tu phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong ba la goms pas yul thams cad gtong bar byed kyi /
translated: One who abides in generosity always practices giving external and internal things, and thus gives up all objects.

original: yul la chags par mi byed pas na yul la ma chags pa'i lam du 'gyur ro //🔽de thob g-yeng ba bsdoms pa gzhan //
analyzed: yul la chags par mi byed pas na yul la ma chags pa'i lam du 'gyur ro // de thob g-yeng ba bsdoms pa gzhan //
translated: Since one does not become attached to objects, it is the path of nonattachment to objects.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other, which is the path of restraint of distraction upon attaining that.

original: gzhan gyi sgras ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgras ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bya ste /
translated: The word “other” refers to the perfection of morality.

original: de thob pa g-yeng ba bsdom pa'i lam ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de thob pa g-yeng ba bsdom pa'i lam ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The path of restraint of distraction upon attaining that is the perfection of morality.

original: de la de'i sgras ni 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la de'i sgras ni 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la bya ba ste /
translated: The word “that” refers to the five sense objects.

original: g-yeng ba ni 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan thob par bya ba'i phyir bya ba mang po la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yeng ba ni 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan thob par bya ba'i phyir bya ba mang po la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Distraction is the engagement in many activities in order to obtain the five sense objects.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni de sngom ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni de sngom ste /
translated: Morality restrains that.

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi las kyis g-yeng ba'i bya ba mang po la mi 'jug pas so //🔽sems can mi gtong zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi las kyis g-yeng ba'i bya ba mang po la mi 'jug pas so // sems can mi gtong zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because he does not engage in the many activities of worldly work that are distractions, in order to obtain the five sense-qualities.🔽Not abandoning sentient beings means

original: sems can mi gtong @8a * //
analyzed: sems can mi gtong @8a * //
translated: not abandoning sentient beings.

original: ba'i lam ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /🔽bzod pa la gnas nas sems can gyis brdeg par bya ba dang / bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa byas shing sdug bsngal bskyed kyang /
analyzed: ba'i lam ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste / bzod pa la gnas nas sems can gyis brdeg par bya ba dang / bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa byas shing sdug bsngal bskyed kyang /
translated: The path of not abandoning sentient beings is the perfection of patience,🔽because, abiding in patience, he does not abandon sentient beings even though they inflict harm on him, such as beating and binding, and cause him to suffer.

original: sems can mi gtong zhing sdug bsngal gyis mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can mi gtong zhing sdug bsngal gyis mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And he is not discouraged by suffering.

original: 'phel ba dang / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phel ba dang / zhes bya ba la /
translated: Increasing means

original: dge ba 'phel ba'i lam ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba 'phel ba'i lam ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: the path of increasing virtue is the perfection of vigor,

original: brtson 'grus la gnas na dge ba'i chos chu bo'i rgyun bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus la gnas na dge ba'i chos chu bo'i rgyun bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, abiding in vigor, virtue increases uninterruptedly like the current of a river.

original: sgrib pa rnam sbyong ba gzhan yin no //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam sbyong ba gzhan yin no //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other is the purification of obscurations.

original: gzhan gyi sgras ni bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis la bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgras ni bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis la bya ste /
translated: The other two perfections are the perfection of meditation and the perfection of wisdom.

original: sgrib pa sbyong ba'i lam ni bsam gtan dang shes rab gnyis te /
analyzed: sgrib pa sbyong ba'i lam ni bsam gtan dang shes rab gnyis te /
translated: The path of purification is the two perfections of meditation and wisdom.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa sbyong bar byed //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa sbyong bar byed //
translated: Meditation purifies the obscurations of the afflictions.

original: shes rab kyis ni shes bya'i sgrib pa sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni shes bya'i sgrib pa sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Wisdom purifies the obscurations to omniscience.

original: yang na bsam gtan dang shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa 'jil bar byed //
analyzed: yang na bsam gtan dang shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa 'jil bar byed //
translated: Or, meditation and wisdom eliminate the afflictive and the cognitive obscurations.

original: shes rab kyis ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rtsa ba nas 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rtsa ba nas 'byin par byed do //
translated: Wisdom eradicates the afflictive and cognitive obscurations from the root.

original: lam gyi sgras ni thabs la bya ste /
analyzed: lam gyi sgras ni thabs la bya ste /
translated: The word path refers to the means.

original: yul la ma chags pa'i thabs zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yul la ma chags pa'i thabs zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The means of not being attached to objects, and so on, up to

original: sgrib pa sbyong ba'i thabs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽bslab pa gsum gyi dbang byas te //
analyzed: sgrib pa sbyong ba'i thabs zhes bya bar sbyar ro // bslab pa gsum gyi dbang byas te //
translated: the means of purifying obscurations.🔽The Victor taught the six perfections

original: pha rol phyin drug rgyal bas gsungs //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pha rol phyin drug rgyal bas gsungs //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: in terms of the three trainings.

original: tshigs su bcad pa drug pas lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i dbang du byas nas rgyal ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du bshad de mi mang mi nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽thog ma gsum zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa drug pas lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i dbang du byas nas rgyal ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid du bshad de mi mang mi nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to // thog ma gsum zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sixth verse explains that the Victor, the Bhagavat Buddha, explained the six perfections alone, not more and not less, in terms of the training in the higher morality, the training in the higher mind, and the training in the higher wisdom.

original: thog ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thog ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The first three are called the training in the higher morality.

original: thog ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: thog ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the first three perfections?

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa'o //
translated: They are the perfections of giving, morality, and patience.

original: rnam gnyis tha ma gnyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam gnyis tha ma gnyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: The next two are the last two.

original: rnam gnyis ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ste /
analyzed: rnam gnyis ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ste /
translated: The next two are the training in the higher mind and the training in the higher wisdom.

original: de gnyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa tha ma gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de gnyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa tha ma gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: These two are indicated by the last two perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa tha ma gnyis ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa tha ma gnyis ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The last two perfections are the perfection of meditation and the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni @8b lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni @8b lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Among them, the perfection of meditation is called the training in higher mind.

original: bsam gtan gyis sems pa dang nye bar gnas pa la sogs pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis sems pa dang nye bar gnas pa la sogs pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes the mind to be concentrated, to be well established, and so forth.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is called the training in higher wisdom.

original: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ni dang po'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ni dang po'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum zhes bya ba las /
translated: Among them, the training in higher morality is the first three perfections.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang gsum ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab par gtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang gsum ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab par gtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that generosity, morality, and patience belong to the training in higher morality.

original: smras pa tshul khrims la ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa zhes byar rung na /
analyzed: smras pa tshul khrims la ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa zhes byar rung na /
translated: It is said: “Morality is suitable to be called the training in higher morality.

original: sbyin pa dang bzod pa gnyis ji ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab par bsdu zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang bzod pa gnyis ji ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab par bsdu zhe na /
translated: How are the two, generosity and patience, included in the higher training in virtue?

original: de'i phyir tshogs dang bcas pa dang 'khor du bcas pa gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs dang bcas pa dang 'khor du bcas pa gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore it says, “because it takes the collection and retinue as its object.”

original: tshul khrims kyi tshogs dang bcas pa dang / tshul khrims kyi 'khor dang bcas pa gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi tshogs dang bcas pa dang / tshul khrims kyi 'khor dang bcas pa gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it takes the collection of virtue and the retinue of virtue as its object.

original: sbyin pa dang bzod pa gnyis kyang lhag par tshul khrims su gtogs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang bzod pa gnyis kyang lhag par tshul khrims su gtogs so //
translated: The two, generosity and patience, are included in the higher training in virtue.

original: de la tshogs zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang gzhi la bya ste /
analyzed: de la tshogs zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang gzhi la bya ste /
translated: Here, “collection” refers to cause and basis.

original: tshul khrims kyi gzhi dang rgyu ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽tshul khrims kyi 'khor dang grogs ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi gzhi dang rgyu ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // tshul khrims kyi 'khor dang grogs ni /
translated: The perfection of generosity is the basis and cause of virtue.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience is the retinue and companion of virtue.

original: sbyin pa ji ltar tshul khrims kyi rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa ji ltar tshul khrims kyi rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does generosity become the cause of virtue?

original: de'i phyir sbyin pa ni longs spyod la mi lta bas tshul khrims yang dag par len te zhes smos te sbyin pa la gnas na bu smad dang nor rdzas la sogs pa'i longs spyod la mi lta zhing mi chags te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin pa ni longs spyod la mi lta bas tshul khrims yang dag par len te zhes smos te sbyin pa la gnas na bu smad dang nor rdzas la sogs pa'i longs spyod la mi lta zhing mi chags te /
translated: If one is established in generosity, one does not look to wealth, such as children, spouse, and possessions, and one is not attached to them.

original: longs spyod la ma chags na tshul khrims len par byed de /
analyzed: longs spyod la ma chags na tshul khrims len par byed de /
translated: If one is not attached to wealth, one takes up morality.

original: de bas na tshul khrims kyi rgyu dang tshogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na tshul khrims kyi rgyu dang tshogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, morality is the cause and the retinue of generosity.

original: bzod pa ji ltar 'khor du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bzod pa ji ltar 'khor du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is morality the retinue of patience?

original: de'i phyir / yang dag par blangs par bzod pas gshe ba las slar mi gshe ba la sogs pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / yang dag par blangs par bzod pas gshe ba las slar mi gshe ba la sogs pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Patience is the basis for taking up morality, since one does not retaliate when struck by others.”🔽Patience exists for those who have taken up morality, and through the method of not retaliating when struck and not striking in return, and so on, patience protects morality.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa rnams la bzod pa yod pa dang / gshe ba la slar mi gshe ba dang / brdeg pa la slar mi brdeg pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bzod pas tshul khrims srung bar byed pas na tshul khrims kyi 'khor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa rnams la bzod pa yod pa dang / gshe ba la slar mi gshe ba dang / brdeg pa la slar mi brdeg pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bzod pas tshul khrims srung bar byed pas na tshul khrims kyi 'khor du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, patience is the retinue of morality.

original: mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa drug ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa drug ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Six verses on the analysis of the characteristics.

original: gangs dbye ba tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan nas /
analyzed: gangs dbye ba tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the analysis of the transcendences in six verses,

original: da ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan nyid dbye ba tshigs su bcad pa drug gis ston te /
analyzed: da ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan nyid dbye ba tshigs su bcad pa drug gis ston te /
translated: now, the analysis of the characteristics of the six transcendences is taught in six verses.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug re re'i mtshan nyid tshigs su bcad pa re res bstan te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug re re'i mtshan nyid tshigs su bcad pa re res bstan te /
translated: The characteristics of each of the six transcendences are taught in a single verse each.

original: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa drug yod pas tshigs bcad kyang drug tu 'gyur @9a * //
analyzed: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa drug yod pas tshigs bcad kyang drug tu 'gyur @9a * //
translated: Thus, since there are six transcendences, there are six verses.

original: ro ; / de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi sta /
analyzed: ro ; / de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi sta /
translated: The characteristics of the transcendence of generosity are fourfold:

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sems can rnams par smin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sems can rnams par smin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of the abandonment of its resistant tendency, the characteristic of its appropriation by the intuition of nondiscriminative awareness, the characteristic of its fulfillment of all wishes, and the characteristic of its evolutionary development of living beings.

original: sbyin pa'i mi mthun phyogs spangs dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i mi mthun phyogs spangs dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse on the avoidance of the resistances to giving:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna ste /
translated: The resistances to the bodhisattva's giving are stinginess,

original: de thams cad nas thams cad du spangs pas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //🔽rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan//
analyzed: de thams cad nas thams cad du spangs pas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o // rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan//
translated: and the avoidance of these is the characteristic of the avoidance of resistances.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is endowed with nonconceptual intuition.

original: byang chub sems dpas gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud pas /
translated: The bodhisattva, by understanding the selflessness of persons and things,

original: gtong ba po dang / rdzas dang / len pa po mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gtong ba po dang / rdzas dang / len pa po mi dmigs te /
translated: does not perceive a giver, a gift, or a receiver.

original: de bas na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be endowed with nonconceptual intuition.

original: de la gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pas ni gtong ba po mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de la gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pas ni gtong ba po mi dmigs so //
translated: Therein, by understanding the selflessness of persons, one does not perceive a giver;

original: chos la bdag med par khong du chud pas ni rdzas dang len pa po mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par khong du chud pas ni rdzas dang len pa po mi dmigs so //
translated: by understanding the selflessness of things, one does not perceive a gift or a receiver.

original: 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed //🔽ces bya ba la /
translated: It fulfills all wishes.

original: bram ze dang tshong pa dang gdol ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: bram ze dang tshong pa dang gdol ba la sogs pa /
translated: He gives to Brahmins, merchants, outcastes, etc.

original: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa gang 'dod pa bsam pa bzhin du de dang de dag gtong bar byed de /
analyzed: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa gang 'dod pa bsam pa bzhin du de dang de dag gtong bar byed de /
translated: whatever they want, such as food, clothing, etc.

original: de bas na 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽sems can rnam par smin byed gsum //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid do // sems can rnam par smin byed gsum //
translated: Therefore, it is characterized by the fulfillment of all wishes.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Three kinds of maturation of sentient beings.

original: de ltar sbyin pas bsdus nas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po la 'jog par byed de //
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pas bsdus nas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po la 'jog par byed de //
translated: Having attracted them by means of generosity, he establishes them in the Disciple, the Rhinoceros-like, and the Bodhisattva ways.

original: da bas na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: da bas na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is characterized by the maturation of sentient beings.

original: mi mthun phyogs spangs tshul khrims dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs spangs tshul khrims dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Morality is the avoidance of the resistances.

original: tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa tshul khrims ngan pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa tshul khrims ngan pa ste /
translated: Bad morality is the resistances to morality, such as taking life, etc.

original: de thams cad nas thams cad du spangs pas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de thams cad nas thams cad du spangs pas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is the complete avoidance of all of these, it is called the characteristic of the avoidance of resistances.

original: rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
translated: And endowed with nonconceptual gnosis.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud pas /🔽skyes bu dang / tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims sgrub par byed pa gsum mi dmigs pas ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud pas / skyes bu dang / tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims sgrub par byed pa gsum mi dmigs pas ni /
translated: He is endowed with non-conceptual intuition.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: He is endowed with the characteristic of non-conceptual intuition, because he does not objectify the three—the person, the Dharma, and the selflessness of persons and things.

original: 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs byed //🔽ces bya ba la /🔽sems can 'di dag 'di snyam du sems te /🔽@9b ae ma'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs byed // ces bya ba la / sems can 'di dag 'di snyam du sems te / @9b ae ma'o //
translated: He fulfills all wishes.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid gsum gyis bdag cag gi lus dang / longs spyod dang / chung ma la sogs pa la gnod pa ma byas na legs so snyam sems pa las byang chub sems dpas de snyam du gnod pa mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid gsum gyis bdag cag gi lus dang / longs spyod dang / chung ma la sogs pa la gnod pa ma byas na legs so snyam sems pa las byang chub sems dpas de snyam du gnod pa mi byed de /
translated: Sentient beings think, “Oh, if only the Bodhisattva would not harm our bodies, possessions, wives, and so on, with his body, speech, and mind!”

original: de bas na 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The Bodhisattva does not harm them in that way, and so he has the characteristic of fulfilling all wishes.

original: sems can yongs su smin byed gsum //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin byed gsum //
translated: He has three ways of bringing beings to maturity.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: tshul khrims kyis bsdus nas sems can theg pa gsum la 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis bsdus nas sems can theg pa gsum la 'jog par byed de /
translated: having gathered them with morality, he establishes sentient beings in the three vehicles.

original: de bas na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it has the characteristic of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: mi mthun phyogs spangs bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs spangs bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba la //
translated: Patience is the relinquishing of the resistant tendency.

original: bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni zhe sdang ste de med pas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni zhe sdang ste de med pas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The resistant tendency to patience is hostility. Since that is absent, it has the characteristic of relinquishing the resistant tendency.

original: rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
translated: It is endowed with nonconceptual intuition.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud pas na /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud pas na /
translated: since it is the realization of the selflessness of persons and things,

original: skyes bu dang / bzod pa dang / sgrub pa gsum mi dmigs pas na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: skyes bu dang / bzod pa dang / sgrub pa gsum mi dmigs pas na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: it is endowed with the characteristic of nonconceptual intuition, since the three, person, patience, and practice, are not perceived.

original: 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed //
translated: It fulfills all wishes.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gal te gzhan dag gi lus la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' la gnod par byed de /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag gi lus la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' la gnod par byed de /
translated: if others harm the bodhisattva with their bodies, etc.,

original: gnod par byas nas sems can 'di snyam du /
analyzed: gnod par byas nas sems can 'di snyam du /
translated: Having been harmed, those sentient beings think,🔽“Oh, it would be good if this Bodhisattva would not harm us and would be patient.”

original: ae ma'o // byang chub sems dpa' 'dis bdag cag la gnod par mi byed cing bzod kyang ci ma rung snyam du sems pa las sems can gyi bsam pa bzhin du sems can la gnod pa mi byed cing nyes pa bzod par byed pas na 'dod pa thams cad yongs su
analyzed: ae ma'o // byang chub sems dpa' 'dis bdag cag la gnod par mi byed cing bzod kyang ci ma rung snyam du sems pa las sems can gyi bsam pa bzhin du sems can la gnod pa mi byed cing nyes pa bzod par byed pas na 'dod pa thams cad yongs su
translated: But because he does not harm sentient beings and forgives their faults as they wish, he fulfills all their desires.

original: rdzogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rdzogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of fulfilling all desires.🔽The third verse on the topic of patience says,🔽Patience is the basis of the highest forbearance,

original: sems can rnam par smin pa byed gsum //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnam par smin pa byed gsum // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the basis of the maturation of sentient beings.🔽Patience is the basis of the highest forbearance, because it is the basis of the highest forbearance.

original: bzod pas bsdus nas theg pa gsum du bkod pas na /
analyzed: bzod pas bsdus nas theg pa gsum du bkod pas na /
translated: It is the basis of the maturation of sentient beings, because it is the basis of the maturation of sentient beings in the three vehicles, having attracted them by patience.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽mi mthun phyogs spangs brtson 'grus dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do // mi mthun phyogs spangs brtson 'grus dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the characteristic of the maturation of sentient beings.🔽The first verse on the topic of effort says,🔽Effort is the best of all things🔽for one who has the aspiration for enlightenment.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni le lo ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni le lo ste /
translated: Effort is the best of all things for one who has the aspiration for enlightenment.

original: de med pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de med pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the highest value.🔽The second verse on the topic of effort says,

original: rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
translated: Effort is the basis of the non-loss of the spirit of enlightenment,🔽and the basis of the maturation of sentient beings.🔽Effort is the basis of the non-loss of the spirit of enlightenment, because it is the basis of the non-loss of the spirit of enlightenment.🔽It is the basis of the maturation of sentient beings, because it is the basis of the maturation of sentient beings in the three vehicles, having attracted them by effort.🔽This is the characteristic of the maturation of sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The third verse on the topic of effort says,🔽Effort is the basis of the highest forbearance,🔽and the basis of the maturation of sentient beings.🔽Effort is the basis of the highest forbearance, because it is the basis of the highest forbearance.🔽It is the basis of the maturation of sentient beings, because it is the basis of the maturation of sentient beings in the three vehicles, having attracted them by effort.🔽This is the characteristic of the maturation of sentient beings.🔽The first verse on the topic of meditation says,🔽Meditation is the best of all things🔽for one who has the aspiration for enlightenment.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pas na /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pas na /
translated: Because they have realized the no self of phenomena and of persons.🔽

original: skyes bu dang / brtson 'grus dang / sgrub pa gsum mi dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: skyes bu dang / brtson 'grus dang / sgrub pa gsum mi dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It has the characteristic of being endowed with nonconceptual intuition, because it is the realization of the selflessness of persons and things, and because it is the nonapprehension of the three: person, striving, and achievement.

original: 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs dang // zhes bya ba la /🔽brtson 'grus kyis @10a * //🔽sems can gyi las su bya ba gang dang gang yod pa'i grogs byed pas na 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs dang // zhes bya ba la / brtson 'grus kyis @10a * // sems can gyi las su bya ba gang dang gang yod pa'i grogs byed pas na 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It has the characteristic of fulfilling all wishes,🔽because through striving one helps with whatever needs to be done for sentient beings.

original: sems can yongs su smin byed gsum //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin byed gsum // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It has the characteristic of bringing sentient beings to full maturity,

translated: One cannot bear abuse and beating by the wicked through the manner of the wicked, but one can bear it through the manner of the virtuous, by not abusing in return and not beating in return.

original: bzod pa'i 'og tu brtson 'grus bshad do ;
analyzed: bzod pa'i 'og tu brtson 'grus bshad do ;
translated: Striving is the result of patience, so striving is explained after patience.

original: / dge ba la rgyun du brtson 'grus brtsams na /

original: brtson 'grus rgyu yin la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rgyu yin la /

original: bsam gtan ni rgyu yin la shes rab ni 'bras bu yin pas /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni rgyu yin la shes rab ni 'bras bu yin pas /

original: bsam gtan gyi 'og tu shes rab bshad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi 'og tu shes rab bshad do //
translated: Therefore, wisdom is explained after concentration.

original: de'i phyir go rims de ltar bkod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir go rims de ltar bkod do //
translated: Therefore, they are arranged in that order.

original: rgyu gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: tha ma dang ni dam pa'i gnas // zhes bya ba smos te / gang tha ma'i gnas su gyur pa ni sngar bshad la /

original: gang dam pa'i gnas su gyur pa ni phyis bshad de /
analyzed: gang dam pa'i gnas su gyur pa ni phyis bshad de /
translated: and the highest abodes will be explained later.

original: sbyin pa tha mar byung bas na sngar bshad la /
analyzed: sbyin pa tha mar byung bas na sngar bshad la /
translated: Since generosity occurs at the end, it was explained earlier.

original: tshul khrims dam par gyur pas na phyes bshad pa nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims dam par gyur pas na phyes bshad pa nas /
translated: Since morality is the best, it is explained later.

original: bsam gtan tha mar gyur pas na sngar bshad la /
analyzed: bsam gtan tha mar gyur pas na sngar bshad la /
translated: Since concentration is the last, it is explained earlier.

original: shes rab dam par gyur pas na phyis bshad de /
analyzed: shes rab dam par gyur pas na phyis bshad de /
translated: Since wisdom is the best, it is explained later.

analyzed: de'i phyir yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi go rims de ltar gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the order of the six perfections is established in that way.

original: ji ltar snga ma tha ma la phyi ma dam pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar snga ma tha ma la phyi ma dam pa zhe na /
translated: How is the latter best in relation to the former?

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa gtong zhing byed kyang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyus srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las byed pas na nyon mongs pa dang 'dres pa'i phyir tha ma'o //🔽tshul khrims ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum bsdams te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa gtong zhing byed kyang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyus srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las byed pas na nyon mongs pa dang 'dres pa'i phyir tha ma'o // tshul khrims ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum bsdams te /
translated: Thus, though one gives and acts, one commits actions such as killing due to the cause of attachment and aversion, etc. Therefore, since it is mixed with afflictions, it is the worst.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las mi 'byung bas dam pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las mi 'byung bas dam pa'i gnas so //
translated: Morality is the best state, since one restrains body, speech and mind and actions such as killing do not occur.

original: tshul khrims kyis gzhan gyi srog dang nor la gnod pa mi byed pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis gzhan gyi srog dang nor la gnod pa mi byed pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Morality merely prevents harm to the life and wealth of others.

original: bdag la gzhan gyis srog dang nor la gnod par byas kyang bzod par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: bdag la gzhan gyis srog dang nor la gnod par byas kyang bzod par mi nus kyi /
translated: Even though others harm my life and wealth, I am unable to bear it.

original: bzod pas ni bdag gi srog dang nor la gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang bzod de /
analyzed: bzod pas ni bdag gi srog dang nor la gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang bzod de /
translated: But through patience, even though others harm my life and wealth, I bear it.

original: gnod par mi byed pas tshul khrims las nyon mongs pa chung ste /
analyzed: gnod par mi byed pas tshul khrims las nyon mongs pa chung ste /
translated: Since I do not harm others, my morality is less afflicted than theirs.

original: dam par gyur pas na de'i 'og tu bzod pa bshad do //
analyzed: dam par gyur pas na de'i 'og tu bzod pa bshad do //
translated: Since it is superior, patience is explained after morality.

original: bzod pa'i dus na yang gzhan la gnod pa mi byed pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: bzod pa'i dus na yang gzhan la gnod pa mi byed pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Even when I am patient, I merely do not harm others.

original: dge ba'i chos la rgyun du 'jug pa med par zad kyi /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la rgyun du 'jug pa med par zad kyi /
translated: I do not continuously engage in virtuous dharmas.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni dge ba la rgyun du bsgom pa bzod pa pas dam par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni dge ba la rgyun du bsgom pa bzod pa pas dam par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: But through effort, I continuously cultivate virtue. Since it is superior to patience,

original: de'i 'og tu brtson 'grus bshad do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu brtson 'grus bshad do //
translated: effort is explained after patience.

original: brtson 'grus kyi dus na dge ba la rgyun du bsgrub pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dus na dge ba la rgyun du bsgrub pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Even when I am diligent, I merely continuously practice virtue.

original: nyon mongs pa 'jil bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'jil bar mi byed kyi /
translated: I do not destroy the afflictions.

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa 'jil bar byed pas na brtson 'grus pas dam par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa 'jil bar byed pas na brtson 'grus pas dam par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Since concentration conquers afflictions, it is supreme among the virtues.

original: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan bshad do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan bshad do //
translated: Therefore concentration is explained after effort.

original: bsam gtan gyis nyon mongs pa 'di las @11b bar byed pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis nyon mongs pa 'di las @11b bar byed pa tsam du zad de /

original: nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas mi 'byin gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas mi 'byin gyi /
translated: but it does not eradicate them from the root.

original: shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas 'byin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas 'byin te /
translated: Wisdom eradicates afflictions from the root.

original: bsam gtan pas dam par gyur pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu shes rab bshad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan pas dam par gyur pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu shes rab bshad do //
translated: Since wisdom is supreme among the virtues, it is explained after concentration.

original: rgyu gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The third reason is stated:

original: chen po dang ni phra ba'i phyir //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: chen po dang ni phra ba'i phyir // zhes smos te /
translated: Because they are coarse and subtle.

original: gang che zhing rags pa rnams ni sngar bshad la /
analyzed: gang che zhing rags pa rnams ni sngar bshad la /
translated: Whatever is coarse and gross is explained first.

original: gang phra zhing dka' ba rnams ni phyis bshad de /
analyzed: gang phra zhing dka' ba rnams ni phyis bshad de /
translated: Whatever is subtle and difficult is explained later.

original: sbyin pa ni rags shing sbom pas na sngar bshad la /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni rags shing sbom pas na sngar bshad la /
translated: Since generosity is coarse and gross, it is explained first.

original: de bas na tshul khrims phra bas phyis bshad pa nas /
analyzed: de bas na tshul khrims phra bas phyis bshad pa nas /
translated: Since ethics is more subtle, it is explained later.

original: bsam gtan sbom pas sngar bshad de /
analyzed: bsam gtan sbom pas sngar bshad de /
translated: Since concentration is gross, it is explained first.

original: de bas shes rab phra bas na phyis bshad do //
analyzed: de bas shes rab phra bas na phyis bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained later, because it is subtle.

original: sbom pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbom pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of “gross” is

analyzed: 'jug sla zhing spyad sla ba'i don dang / phra ba ni 'jug dka' zhing spyad dka' ba'i don to //
translated: easy to enter and easy to practice, and the meaning of “subtle” is difficult to enter and difficult to practice.

original: de la sbyin pa ni bya sla ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni bya sla ste /
translated: Among them, giving is easy to do.

original: rgyal po dang blon po la sogs pas sbyin pa gtong ba bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyal po dang blon po la sogs pas sbyin pa gtong ba bzhin du /
translated: Like kings, ministers, and so on,

original: gdol ba dang gdol bu la sogs pas kyang sbyin pa gtong bar ni nus kyi /
analyzed: gdol ba dang gdol bu la sogs pas kyang sbyin pa gtong bar ni nus kyi /
translated: even outcastes, their children, and so on can give,

original: tshul khrims bsrung bar mi nus pas na sbyin pa ni bya sla'i /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung bar mi nus pas na sbyin pa ni bya sla'i /
translated: but they cannot keep the precepts, so giving is easy to do.

original: tshul khrims ni bya dka'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni bya dka'o //
translated: But keeping the precepts is difficult to do.

original: tshul khrims kyis gzhan gyi srog dang nor la gnod par mi byed pa tsam du zad pas bya sla'i /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis gzhan gyi srog dang nor la gnod par mi byed pa tsam du zad pas bya sla'i /
translated: Keeping the precepts is easy to do, just not harming the life and wealth of others,

original: bzod pas ni bdag gi srog dang nor la gnod pa byas kyang slar gnod pa mi byed de bzod pa ni bya dka'o //
analyzed: bzod pas ni bdag gi srog dang nor la gnod pa byas kyang slar gnod pa mi byed de bzod pa ni bya dka'o //
translated: but with patience, even when one’s own life and wealth are harmed, one does not harm in return, so patience is difficult to do.

original: bzod pas ni bdag la gnod pa byas pa la lan mi glan zhing bzod par bya ba tsam du zad pas bya sla'i /
analyzed: bzod pas ni bdag la gnod pa byas pa la lan mi glan zhing bzod par bya ba tsam du zad pas bya sla'i /
translated: By means of patience, one merely endures the harm done to oneself without returning it, so it is easy to do.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni de bas kyang lhag par de dge ba la rgyun du bsgrubs pas na bya dka'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni de bas kyang lhag par de dge ba la rgyun du bsgrubs pas na bya dka'o //
translated: But by means of effort, one accomplishes the virtues continuously, so it is difficult to do.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni dge ba la rgyun du 'jug pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni dge ba la rgyun du 'jug pa tsam du zad de /
translated: By means of effort, one merely engages in the virtues continuously.

original: nyon mongs pa mi 'jil bas bya sla'i /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mi 'jil bas bya sla'i /
translated: But since it does not eliminate the afflictions, it is easy to do.

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa 'jil bar byed pas na bya dka'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa 'jil bar byed pas na bya dka'o //
translated: But by means of the trance states, one eliminates the afflictions, so it is difficult to do.

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa 'jil ba tsam du zad pas bya sla'i /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa 'jil ba tsam du zad pas bya sla'i /
translated: But since the trance states merely eliminate the afflictions, they are easy to do.

original: shes rab kyis ni 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams shes par byed pas na bya dka'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams shes par byed pas na bya dka'o //
translated: But by means of wisdom, one understands the Dharma of the noble truths, etc., so it is difficult to do.

original: nges pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la go rims kyi don bshad nas /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la go rims kyi don bshad nas /
translated: The verse on the analysis of the etymologies has been explained.

original: da ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nges pa'i tshig bshad de /
analyzed: da ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nges pa'i tshig bshad de /
translated: Now, the etymologies of the six perfections are explained.

original: ci'i phyir sbyin pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyin pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Why is it called generosity?🔽Why is it called wisdom?

original: ci'i phyir shes rab ces bya ba'i don bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes rab ces bya ba'i don bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the explanation of the meaning of the words.

original: dbul ba 'dor bar byed pa dang zhes @12a * //🔽bya ba la /🔽rgya gar skad du sbyin pa la d'a na zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dbul ba 'dor bar byed pa dang zhes @12a * // bya ba la / rgya gar skad du sbyin pa la d'a na zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It removes poverty.🔽In Sanskrit, generosity is dāna.

original: de'i tshig gi don ni d'a ni dbul ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshig gi don ni d'a ni dbul ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the word is this: dā means poverty.

original: na ni 'dor ba'am med par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: na ni 'dor ba'am med par byed pa'i don to //
translated: Na means to remove or to make nonexistent.

original: bram za dang tshong ba la sogs pa bza' ba dang bgo ba gang dang gang gis phongs pa de dang de byin nas len pa po tshe 'dir phongs pa dang dbul ba med par byas pas dbul ba 'dor bar byed do //
analyzed: bram za dang tshong ba la sogs pa bza' ba dang bgo ba gang dang gang gis phongs pa de dang de byin nas len pa po tshe 'dir phongs pa dang dbul ba med par byas pas dbul ba 'dor bar byed do //
translated: By giving whatever food, clothing, etc. is lacking to brahmins, merchants, etc., the giver removes the poverty and lack of resources of the recipients in this life.

original: gtong pa pos tshe 'dir phyi dang nang gi dngos po btang nas tshe rabs gzhan du cis kyang phongs pa med cing longs spyod phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gtong pa pos tshe 'dir phyi dang nang gi dngos po btang nas tshe rabs gzhan du cis kyang phongs pa med cing longs spyod phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
translated: By giving external and internal things in this life, the giver will have no lack of anything and will have perfect resources in other lives.

original: dbul ba 'dor bar byed pas na sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbul ba 'dor bar byed pas na sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it removes poverty, it is called generosity.

original: bsil ba thob pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsil ba thob pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: One obtains coolness.

original: tshul khrims la rgya gar skad du sh'i la zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims la rgya gar skad du sh'i la zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In Indian language, it is said to be śīla.

original: sh'i ni bsil ba'i don la /
analyzed: sh'i ni bsil ba'i don la /
translated: Śī means cool,

original: la ni thob pa'am len pa'i don to //
analyzed: la ni thob pa'am len pa'i don to //
translated: and la means to obtain or take.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams tshe 'dir yul la chags pa'i don du 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyu lus dang ngag gi sgo nas bya ba sna tshogs kyi sdug bsngal ba'i gdung bar byed pa mi 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / de'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du yang ngan song gi gnas su mi myong zhing /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams tshe 'dir yul la chags pa'i don du 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyu lus dang ngag gi sgo nas bya ba sna tshogs kyi sdug bsngal ba'i gdung bar byed pa mi 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / de'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du yang ngan song gi gnas su mi myong zhing /
translated: Those who possess morality do not obtain the suffering of various actions through body and speech, such as attachment and aversion, for the sake of attachment to objects in this life, and by that cause, they do not experience the miserable realms in other lives.

original: lha dang mi'i bsil ba'i bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / mjug tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba'i bsil ba 'thob par byed pas na tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i bsil ba'i bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / mjug tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba'i bsil ba 'thob par byed pas na tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: They obtain the cool bliss of gods and humans, and finally they obtain the cool bliss of nirvana. Therefore it is called morality.

original: khro ba zad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: khro ba zad ces bya ba la /
translated: Anger is exhausted.

original: bzod pa'i sgra rgya gar skad du ksh'a nti zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i sgra rgya gar skad du ksh'a nti zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The word for patience in Indian language is kṣānti.

original: ksh'a na ni zad pa la bya /
analyzed: ksh'a na ni zad pa la bya /
translated: Kṣānti means “exhaustion.”

original: ti ni byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ti ni byed pa la bya ste /
translated: Ti means “to do.”

original: bzod pa la gnas na bzod pa des bdag gis sems kyi rgyud la yod pa'i zhe sdang zad par byed pas na bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa la gnas na bzod pa des bdag gis sems kyi rgyud la yod pa'i zhe sdang zad par byed pas na bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one abides in patience, one exhausts hatred that exists in the continuum of one’s mind by means of that patience.

original: dam par sbyor ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dam par sbyor ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “ Application to the highest” means

original: brtson 'grus kyi rgya gar skad du b'irya zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi rgya gar skad du b'irya zhes 'byung ste /
translated: the Indian word for effort is vīrya.

original: de la b'i ni dam pa'i don la /
analyzed: de la b'i ni dam pa'i don la /
translated: In that, vī means “highest”

original: rya ni sbyor ba'i don to //
analyzed: rya ni sbyor ba'i don to //
translated: andrya means “application.”

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dam pa la sbyor bas na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dam pa la sbyor bas na /
translated: Because one applies oneself to the highest roots of virtue that transcend the mundane,

original: brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called “effort.”

original: yid 'dzin dang zhes bya ba la /🔽bsam gtan gyi sgra rgya gar skad du dhy'a na zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yid 'dzin dang zhes bya ba la / bsam gtan gyi sgra rgya gar skad du dhy'a na zhes 'byung ste /
translated: “ Mental retention” means🔽the Indian word for concentration is dhyāna.

original: dha la ya btags yod pa ra'i don du drangs na /
analyzed: dha la ya btags yod pa ra'i don du drangs na /
translated: If dhya is taken as a nominal derivative with the meaning of “to go,”

original: 'dzin pa'i don du 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i don du 'gro ste /
translated: it has the meaning of “to hold.”

original: sems phyi rol du mi g-yeng bar nang du 'dzin par byed pas na bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems phyi rol du mi g-yeng bar nang du 'dzin par byed pas na bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it holds the mind inwardly without distraction to external objects, it is called “concentration.”

original: don dam shes pa rnam gsum @12b bshad //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: don dam shes pa rnam gsum @12b bshad // ces bya ba la /
translated: The ultimate is explained as threefold knowledge.

original: shes rab kyi sgra rgya gar skad du pra dzny'a zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi sgra rgya gar skad du pra dzny'a zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Here, the term “wisdom” is prajñā in Sanskrit.

original: de la don dam par ni pa ra m'a ra tha zhes bya bas /
analyzed: de la don dam par ni pa ra m'a ra tha zhes bya bas /
translated: In the ultimate sense, it is paramārtha,

original: pa la ra btags pa /
analyzed: pa la ra btags pa /
translated: where para is affixed to ma,

original: ba'i 'og tu ra bzhag na pa ra m'a ra tha zhes don dam pa'i tshig tu brjod la /
analyzed: ba'i 'og tu ra bzhag na pa ra m'a ra tha zhes don dam pa'i tshig tu brjod la /
translated: and when ra is placed below it, it is expressed as the word paramārtha.

original: dzny'a ni shes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: dzny'a ni shes pa la bya ste /
translated: Jñāna means knowledge.

original: skye 'gag med pa'i don dam pa shes pas na shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: skye 'gag med pa'i don dam pa shes pas na shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is the knowledge of the ultimate truth of non-arising and non-ceasing, it is called wisdom.

original: bsgom pa rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa la /
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa la /
translated: The verse on the classification of meditation.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nges pa'i tshig bshad nas da ni bsgom pa bshad de /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nges pa'i tshig bshad nas da ni bsgom pa bshad de / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bsgom pa nas /
translated: Having explained the etymologies of the six perfections, now meditation is explained.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bsgom pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bsgom pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How is it meditated upon in the perfection of generosity, up to how is it meditated upon in the perfection of wisdom? It is taught in one verse. This is the meaning.

original: bsgom pa dngos la gnas pa dang // yid la byed pa de bzhin bsam //🔽thabs dang dbang yod dag la yang //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa rnam pa lnga ltar bsgom ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa dngos la gnas pa dang // yid la byed pa de bzhin bsam // thabs dang dbang yod dag la yang // zhes bya ba la / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa rnam pa lnga ltar bsgom ste /
translated: Abiding in the meditation, in the mental attention, and in the resolve,

original: lnga ni dngos po la gnas te bsgom pa dang / yid la byed pa la gnas te bsgom pa dang / de bzhin du bsam pa la gnas te bsgom pa dang / thabs la gnas te bsgom pa dang / dbang yod pa la gnas te bsgom pa'o //🔽de la dngos po la gnas te bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi'o//🔽yid la byed pa la gnas te bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi'o //🔽bsam pa la gnas te bsgom pa rnam pa drug go //🔽thabs la gnas te bsgom pa rnam pa gsum mo //🔽dbang yod pa la gnas te bsgom pa rnam pa gsum mo //🔽de dag de bzhin thams cad bshad //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: lnga ni dngos po la gnas te bsgom pa dang / yid la byed pa la gnas te bsgom pa dang / de bzhin du bsam pa la gnas te bsgom pa dang / thabs la gnas te bsgom pa dang / dbang yod pa la gnas te bsgom pa'o //🔽de la dngos po la gnas te bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi'o//🔽yid la byed pa la gnas te bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi'o //🔽bsam pa la gnas te bsgom pa rnam pa drug go //🔽thabs la gnas te bsgom pa rnam pa gsum mo //🔽dbang yod pa la gnas te bsgom pa rnam pa gsum mo //🔽de dag de bzhin thams cad bshad //🔽ces bya ba la /
translated: and also in the means and in the mastery.

original: ji ltar sbyin pa la rnam pa lnga ltar bsgom pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa la rnam pa lnga ltar bsgom pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as generosity is cultivated in five aspects,

original: tshul khrims nas shes rab kyi bar du lhag ma rnams la yang dngos po la gnas te bsgom pa nas dbang yod pa la gnas te bsgom pa'i bar du rnam pa lngar bsgom par bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshul khrims nas shes rab kyi bar du lhag ma rnams la yang dngos po la gnas te bsgom pa nas dbang yod pa la gnas te bsgom pa'i bar du rnam pa lngar bsgom par bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: so too the remaining perfections from ethics to wisdom are cultivated in five aspects, from cultivating them by abiding in the thing to cultivating them by abiding in mastery.

original: de la dngos po la gnas pa rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dngos po la gnas pa rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Abiding in the thing has four types.

original: dngos po la zhes bya ba dang / don zhes bya ba dang / rdzas zhes bya ba dag don gcig ste /
analyzed: dngos po la zhes bya ba dang / don zhes bya ba dang / rdzas zhes bya ba dag don gcig ste /
translated: The thing, the object and the substance have the same meaning.

original: dngos po la rdzas zhes bya bar ci mngon zhen /🔽mdo las rdzas kyi dngos po bdun dang ldan pas bsod nams byed pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo ni bsod nams rtag tu 'phel lo zhes @13a * //
analyzed: dngos po la rdzas zhes bya bar ci mngon zhen / mdo las rdzas kyi dngos po bdun dang ldan pas bsod nams byed pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo ni bsod nams rtag tu 'phel lo zhes @13a * //
translated: Why is substance called a thing?🔽Because a sūtra declares:

original: gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A son of a good family or daughter of a good family who creates merit through possessing the seven substances of merit always increases merit.

original: dngos po la gnas te bsgom pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dngos po la gnas te bsgom pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Cultivation by abiding in the thing has four types.

original: rgyu la gnas pa dang / rnam par smin pa la gnas pa dang / smon lam la gnas pa dang / so sor rtog pa'i stobs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu la gnas pa dang / rnam par smin pa la gnas pa dang / smon lam la gnas pa dang / so sor rtog pa'i stobs la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is based on the cause, based on the evolutionary development of life, based on vows, and based on the power of discernment.

original: rigs kyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rigs kyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Based on the power of the spiritual gene, etc.

original: rgyu la gnas pa ni 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pas sbyin par bya ba'i rigs so zhes bsten cing bsnyen pa med par yang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod pa'i stobs kyis tshe rabs gang dang gang du skyes pa de dag de dag tu gtong🔽ba la dga' ste /
analyzed: rgyu la gnas pa ni 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pas sbyin par bya ba'i rigs so zhes bsten cing bsnyen pa med par yang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod pa'i stobs kyis tshe rabs gang dang gang du skyes pa de dag de dag tu gtong ba la dga' ste /
translated: Based on the cause means that even without being urged by spiritual benefactors, etc., the bodhisattva, by the power of the spiritual gene, in whatever life he is born, is naturally inclined to generosity.

original: 'di ltar 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus nas /
translated: Thus, from beginningless cyclic existence,

original: gnas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa chos nyid kyis thog pa mig la sogs pa skye mched drug gi khyad par 'di lta bu dang ldan te /
analyzed: gnas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa chos nyid kyis thog pa mig la sogs pa skye mched drug gi khyad par 'di lta bu dang ldan te /
translated: having passed from one life to another, by the nature of things, he has this kind of special possession of the six sense-spheres, eye, etc.

original: gang gi phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis ma bstan kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub cing bsgom pa la dga' ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis ma bstan kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub cing bsgom pa la dga' ste /
translated: Because, even without being taught by a spiritual master, they delight in practicing and cultivating the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa ni rgyu la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed pa ni rgyu la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Practicing the perfections is called “abiding in the cause.”

original: gang gi bdag gi lus phun sum tshogs pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi bdag gi lus phun sum tshogs pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “By the power of their perfect bodies” and so on.

original: rnam par smin pa la gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' tshe rabs gzhan dag tu sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' tshe rabs gzhan dag tu sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par bya ste /
translated: Abiding in the result means that in other lives the bodhisattvas become familiar with generosity and the other perfections.

original: de ltar goms par byas pas de'i dbang gis tshe rabs phyi mar sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa byed cing sgrub par dga' ba'i lus mngon par 'grub cing smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar goms par byas pas de'i dbang gis tshe rabs phyi mar sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa byed cing sgrub par dga' ba'i lus mngon par 'grub cing smin par 'gyur te /
translated: By becoming familiar with them in that way, through the power of that, in their later lives they attain and complete the perfections of generosity and so on, and they delight in practicing and cultivating them.

original: de ltar rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis ma brtags ma bsams par yang pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis ma brtags ma bsams par yang pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug ste /
translated: In that way, through the power of their results, they engage in the perfections without having to think about it or consider it.

original: de ni rnam par smin pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //🔽gang sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o // gang sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: That is called “abiding in karmic maturation.”🔽Abiding in former prayers means

original: smon lam la gnas pa ni des sngon gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma bsgrubs te smon lam tsam zhig btab pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: smon lam la gnas pa ni des sngon gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma bsgrubs te smon lam tsam zhig btab pa tsam du zad de /
translated: that one has not previously accomplished the perfections such as generosity, but has merely made prayers.

original: ji ltar smon lam btab ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar smon lam btab ce na /
translated: How does one make prayers?

original: 'di ltar bdag tshe rabs gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang de dag tu nga dang bdag gi rtog pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tshe rabs gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang de dag tu nga dang bdag gi rtog pa dang bral ba /
translated: Thus, in whatever lives I am born, may I be free from the concepts of “I” and “mine.”

original: nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad la mi rten pa /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad la mi rten pa /
translated: May I not rely on any inner or outer things.

original: mos pa yid la byed pa dang / mdo sde gang las pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'byung zhing 'chad pa'i mdo sde 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa la 'di ni de kho na bzhin du ma nor te bden pa yin no zhes mos par byed de /
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pa dang / mdo sde gang las pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'byung zhing 'chad pa'i mdo sde 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa la 'di ni de kho na bzhin du ma nor te bden pa yin no zhes mos par byed de /
translated: Attention to interest is interest in the sutra collection, such as the Cloud of Jewels, from which the six perfections emerge and are explained, thinking, This is just as it is, unmistaken, and true.

original: ji lta ji ltar mos pa de lta de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams brtas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar mos pa de lta de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams brtas par 'gyur te /
translated: And just as there is interest, to that extent the potential for the perfections increases.

original: de ni smos pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni smos pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called attention to what is said.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa brten pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa brten pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Attention to the support of the perfections and so on.

original: ro myang ba yid la byed pa ni sngon bdag gis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyad cing bsgrubs te /
analyzed: ro myang ba yid la byed pa ni sngon bdag gis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyad cing bsgrubs te /
