translated: Attention to savoring is thinking, In the past, I practiced and accomplished the perfections such as generosity.

original: @14a * // sngon bsgrubs pa la 'di ltar bdag gis sngon sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrubs pa ni legs so zhes yon tan du lta zhing sngon byas pa dran nas mngon par dga' ba ni ro myang ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //🔽'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: @14a * // sngon bsgrubs pa la 'di ltar bdag gis sngon sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrubs pa ni legs so zhes yon tan du lta zhing sngon byas pa dran nas mngon par dga' ba ni ro myang ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o // 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: The attention of savoring is as follows: In the past, I practiced the perfections of generosity and so on well, thinking in this way, one views the good qualities, and recalling what one has done, one delights in it. This is called the attention of savoring.

original: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrubs pa rnams la bdag gis byas pa dang 'dra bar dga' zhing yi rang ba ni
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrubs pa rnams la bdag gis byas pa dang 'dra bar dga' zhing yi rang ba ni
translated: The attention of rejoicing is as follows: In all world systems, all sentient beings abide in the ten directions, and whatever generosity and so on they practice, I rejoice in all of it, just as I would in my own actions.

original: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the attention of rejoicing.

original: bdag dang sems can rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The attention of dedication is as follows: All sentient beings, myself and others, whatever generosity and so on we have practiced, we dedicate to the unsurpassed enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa ni ma 'ongs pa nyid la yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bsgrub par dga' zhing /
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa ni ma 'ongs pa nyid la yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bsgrub par dga' zhing /
translated: The conscientious attitude of delight is delight in practicing the six perfections in the present and in the future,🔽and the prayer that wherever beings are born, they may practice the six perfections.

original: sems can rnams kyang gar skyes gar skyes kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub par gyur cig ces smon pa dang ma 'ongs pa na sems can gzhan la yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub par dga' zhing sems can rnams gar skyes gar skyes kyang pha🔽rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub par gyur cig ces smon pa ni mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang gar skyes gar skyes kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub par gyur cig ces smon pa dang ma 'ongs pa na sems can gzhan la yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub par dga' zhing sems can rnams gar skyes gar skyes kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub par gyur cig ces smon pa ni mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The conscientious attitude of delight is delight in practicing the six perfections in the future for other beings and the prayer that wherever beings are born, they may practice the six perfections.

original: bsam pa la gnas te pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: bsam pa la gnas te pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa bsgom pa ni /
translated: The conscientious attitude of remaining in the thought is the cultivation of the six perfections.

original: chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa drug 'grel pa nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa drug 'grel pa nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du blta'o //
translated: The six aspects of the thought of dissatisfaction and so on should be understood according to the commentary.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The thought of dissatisfaction with respect to generosity and so on is the thought of the bodhisattva.

original: bsam pa yid la byed pa la rnam pa drug tu byas pa las /
analyzed: bsam pa yid la byed pa la rnam pa drug tu byas pa las /
translated: Among the six topics of thought,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang sbyar te je 'chad de de la chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa la yang chog mi shes pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang sbyar te je 'chad de de la chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa la yang chog mi shes pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: the thought of dissatisfaction is fourfold:

original: dngos po gtong ba la chog mi shes pa dang / lus gtong ba la chog mi shes pa dang / dus chog mi shes dang / sems can chog mi shes pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dngos po gtong ba la chog mi shes pa dang / lus gtong ba la chog mi shes pa dang / dus chog mi shes dang / sems can chog mi shes pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: dissatisfaction with the object given, dissatisfaction with the gift of the body, dissatisfaction with time, and dissatisfaction with sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig la phan btags shing yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig la phan btags shing yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva, for the sake of helping and maturing a single sentient being,🔽would enter the Avīci hell.

original: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang nas sems @14b can gcig pu de la gtong bar byed de /
analyzed: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang nas sems @14b can gcig pu de la gtong bar byed de /
translated: One might fill as many world systems as there are sand particles in the river Ganges with the seven kinds of precious gems and give them away to each sentient being.

original: de ltar btang nas bdag gis 'di snyed cig byin gyis btang nas /
analyzed: de ltar btang nas bdag gis 'di snyed cig byin gyis btang nas /
translated: And after giving them away, one would not think, “I have given away this much,

original: da ni chog go snyam pa'i bsam pa med de 'dis ni dngos po gtong ba la chog mi shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: da ni chog go snyam pa'i bsam pa med de 'dis ni dngos po gtong ba la chog mi shes pa bstan to //
translated: now I have had enough.” This shows that one is not satisfied with giving things away.🔽As many bodies as there are sand particles in the Ganges,

original: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang mnyam pa'i lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang mnyam pa'i lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: de bzhin du sems can gcig la dus skad cig ma re re la yang gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi lus gtong zhing sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gcig la dus skad cig ma re re la yang gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi lus gtong zhing sbyin par byed de /
translated: In the same way, in each instant of time, one gives away and donates as many bodies as there are sand particles in the Ganges to each sentient being.

original: lus de snyed cig bdag gis sems can gcig la byin pas da ni chog go snyam du sems pa med de /
analyzed: lus de snyed cig bdag gis sems can gcig la byin pas da ni chog go snyam du sems pa med de /
translated: One does not think, “I have given this many bodies to one sentient being, now I have had enough.”

original: 'dis ni lus gtong ba chog mi shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lus gtong ba chog mi shes pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that one is not satisfied with giving away one’s body.

original: de bzhin du gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i bskal par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i bskal par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Likewise, for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges river, and so on.

original: de ltar btang ba de yang lo'am zla ba'i bskal pa 'gar gtong ba ma yin gyi gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i bskal par skad cig yud tsam yang rgyun mi 'chad par gtong ste /
analyzed: de ltar btang ba de yang lo'am zla ba'i bskal pa 'gar gtong ba ma yin gyi gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i bskal par skad cig yud tsam yang rgyun mi 'chad par gtong ste /
translated: Thus, that giving is not for a few eons of months or years, but for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges river, without interruption for even a moment.

original: de ltar gtang yang bdag gis bskal pa 'di snyed cig tu phyi dang nang gi dngos po btang bas da ni chog go snyam pa'i bsam pa med de /
analyzed: de ltar gtang yang bdag gis bskal pa 'di snyed cig tu phyi dang nang gi dngos po btang bas da ni chog go snyam pa'i bsam pa med de /
translated: Even though one gives in that way, one does not think, “I have given external and internal things for so many eons, now I have had enough.”

original: 'dis ni dus chog mi shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dus chog mi shes pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that one is not satisfied with the amount of time.

original: sems can gcig la ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can gcig la ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Just as for one sentient being, and so on.

original: de ltar sems can gcig la gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang ste sbyin pa dang / gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi lus yongs su btang ba dang / de la gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par spyad de sems can de bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bkod de ;
analyzed: de ltar sems can gcig la gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang ste sbyin pa dang / gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi lus yongs su btang ba dang / de la gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par spyad de sems can de bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bkod de ;
translated: In this way, they give to a single being as many world systems as there are grains of sand in the river Ganges, each filled with the seven kinds of precious substances, and they give their bodies as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges.🔽And they do this for as many kalpas as there are grains of sand in the Ganges, establishing that being in unsurpassable enlightenment and bringing him or her to full maturity.

original: yongs su smin par byas pa de bzhin du tshul de dang 'dra bar sems can gnyis pa gsum pa la yang de ltar byas pa nas mthong sems can thams cad la tshul de lta bur smin par byas te /
analyzed: yongs su smin par byas pa de bzhin du tshul de dang 'dra bar sems can gnyis pa gsum pa la yang de ltar byas pa nas mthong sems can thams cad la tshul de lta bur smin par byas te /
translated: And in the same way, they bring the second being to maturity, the third being and so on until all beings are brought to maturity in the same way.

original: sems can zad par byas kyang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag gis gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang ste byin pa dang / gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi lus yongs su btang ba dang /
analyzed: sems can zad par byas kyang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag gis gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang ste byin pa dang / gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi lus yongs su btang ba dang /
translated: Even though sentient beings are exhausted, the bodhisattva does not think, “I have given as gifts as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River filled with the seven precious substances, and I have given as many bodies as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: de yang gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par btang ste /
analyzed: de yang gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par btang ste /
translated: And I have given them for as many eons as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: tshul de lta bus sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sangs rgyas par byas pas @15a * //
analyzed: tshul de lta bus sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sangs rgyas par byas pas @15a * //
translated: And by that method I have caused all sentient beings to attain unsurpassed awakening.

original: da ni chog go snyam du bsam pa med de /
analyzed: da ni chog go snyam du bsam pa med de /
translated: Now I am satisfied.”

original: bsam pa de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa'i chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa'i chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That kind of thought is called the bodhisattva’s insatiable thought.

original: byang chub sems dpas de lta bu sbyin pa gcig nas gcig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyas pa'i bsam pa 'chad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de lta bu sbyin pa gcig nas gcig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyas pa'i bsam pa 'chad de /
translated: The bodhisattva’s thought of abundance is explained in the lines beginning “The bodhisattva gives from one to the other” and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gong ma lta bu'i phyi dang nang gi sbyin pa yang nyin 'ga' tsam ni sbyin par byed nyin 'ga' tsam ni sbyin par mi byed skad cig ma gcig la ni sbyin par mi byed par sems pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gong ma lta bu'i phyi dang nang gi sbyin pa yang nyin 'ga' tsam ni sbyin par byed nyin 'ga' tsam ni sbyin par mi byed skad cig ma gcig la ni sbyin par mi byed par sems pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva does not give external and internal gifts like the above for a few days, not giving for a few days, not giving in a single instant.

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po yang nyi ma re re skad cig ma re re la cung zad kyang mi 'dug par byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du rgyun mi 'chad par gtong bar byed de /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po yang nyi ma re re skad cig ma re re la cung zad kyang mi 'dug par byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du rgyun mi 'chad par gtong bar byed de /
translated: He gives without interruption, not remaining for a single day or a single instant without giving external and internal things until he sits on the seat of enlightenment.

original: de ltar sems pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rgyas pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sems pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rgyas pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thinking like this is called the bodhisattva's expansive thought.

original: sems can rnams de lta bu sbyin pas bsdus nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dga' ba'i bsam pa 'chad de /
analyzed: sems can rnams de lta bu sbyin pas bsdus nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dga' ba'i bsam pa 'chad de /
translated: Having gathered sentient beings like this with generosity, and so on explains the thought of joy.

original: mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams la gong du bshad pa lta bu'i phyi nang gi dngos po tshad med pa sbyin zhing /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams la gong du bshad pa lta bu'i phyi nang gi dngos po tshad med pa sbyin zhing /
translated: He gives immeasurable external and internal things to infinite sentient beings as explained above.

original: dus 'gyangs par btang nas sems can bsdus te yongs su smin par byas par mthong ste /
analyzed: dus 'gyangs par btang nas sems can bsdus te yongs su smin par byas par mthong ste /
translated: He sees that he has delayed in order to gather sentient beings and bring them to full maturity.

original: de ltar mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' nyid bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig smin par byas so zhes byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i bye brag skye ba ltar /
analyzed: de ltar mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' nyid bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig smin par byas so zhes byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i bye brag skye ba ltar /
translated: Seeing this, the bodhisattva generates a specific joy, thinking, “I have brought so many sentient beings to maturity.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas phan btags pa'i sems can dag de tsam du dga' ba'i sems mi skye ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas phan btags pa'i sems can dag de tsam du dga' ba'i sems mi skye ste /
translated: Sentient beings who have been helped by the bodhisattva through the perfections of generosity and so on do not generate a mind of joy to that extent.

original: de ni dga' ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //🔽de rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ni dga' ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o // de rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: This is called the joyful intention.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa 'chad de /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa 'chad de /
translated: The intention to benefit is explained in the passage beginning with “because they teach them unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.”

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' des gong du bshad pa lta bu'i phyi nang gi sbyin pas sems can la phan btags te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' des gong du bshad pa lta bu'i phyi nang gi sbyin pas sems can la phan btags te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva helps sentient beings through the generosity explained above, both material and immaterial.

original: legs par byas kyang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag gis ni sbyin pa 'di lta bus sems can la phan btags so zhes bdag nyid la de ltar mi sems kyi gang gis sbyin pa blangs pa'i sems can des bdag la phan btags so snyam du sems
analyzed: legs par byas kyang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag gis ni sbyin pa 'di lta bus sems can la phan btags so zhes bdag nyid la de ltar mi sems kyi gang gis sbyin pa blangs pa'i sems can des bdag la phan btags so snyam du sems
translated: Even when they have done something good, bodhisattvas do not think of themselves in this way: “By this kind of generosity, I have benefited sentient beings.”

original: te / ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gal te sbyin pa len pa'i sems can @15b med na ni bdag gis bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi chos rdzogs par mi 'gyur gyi gang gi phyir sems can 'di dag gis bdag gi phyi nang gi sbyin pa blangs pas de'i phyir bdag bla na med pa'i
analyzed: te / ci'i phyir zhe na / gal te sbyin pa len pa'i sems can @15b med na ni bdag gis bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi chos rdzogs par mi 'gyur gyi gang gi phyir sems can 'di dag gis bdag gi phyi nang gi sbyin pa blangs pas de'i phyir bdag bla na med pa'i
translated: Why is this?

original: byang chub tu 'grub pa'i rgyu dang tshogs bsags pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub tu 'grub pa'i rgyu dang tshogs bsags pa yin te /
translated: “If there were no sentient beings to receive the generosity, I would not have completed the qualities of unsurpassable enlightenment. Since these sentient beings have received my inner and outer generosity, they are the cause and accumulation of merit for my attaining unsurpassable🔽enlightenment.”

original: de bas na 'di dag gis bdag la phan btags so snyam du dgongs pa ni phan btags pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag gis bdag la phan btags so snyam du dgongs pa ni phan btags pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the thought “They have benefited me” is called the attitude of benefit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi chags pa'i bsam pa 'chang de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi chags pa'i bsam pa 'chang de /
translated: The bodhisattva called Puṇyamatin and so on have the thought of nonattachment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gong du bshad pa lta bu'i phyi nang gi sbyin pa rgya chen po bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ba de dag sems can la sbyin zhing btang nas kyang tshe 'dir phan btags pa'i lan la yang re ba med la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gong du bshad pa lta bu'i phyi nang gi sbyin pa rgya chen po bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ba de dag sems can la sbyin zhing btang nas kyang tshe 'dir phan btags pa'i lan la yang re ba med la /
translated: The bodhisattva who has the intention of nonattachment gives away his outer and inner possessions to sentient beings, as explained above, and he does not expect any reward in this life for his help.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du yang sbyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po la ma chags bzhin du gtong ste /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du yang sbyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po la ma chags bzhin du gtong ste /
translated: He gives without attachment to the result of his generosity, great wealth, in other lives.

original: de ni ma chags pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ma chags pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the intention of nonattachment.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i phung po de lta bu spangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dge ba'i bsam pa 'chad de /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i phung po de lta bu spangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dge ba'i bsam pa 'chad de /
translated: The bodhisattva who has the intention of virtue gives away that very mass of generosity and so on, and he does not give with a mind that is distracted by other things.

original: byang chub sems dpas gong du bshad pa lta bu'i phyi dang nang gi dngos po'i sbyin pa rgya chen po sbyin pa'i tshogs de 'dra ba btang ba'i 'bras bu bdag gcig pus myong bar shog shig ces mi smon gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gong du bshad pa lta bu'i phyi dang nang gi dngos po'i sbyin pa rgya chen po sbyin pa'i tshogs de 'dra ba btang ba'i 'bras bu bdag gcig pus myong bar shog shig ces mi smon gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva does not wish that the result of the generosity of the vast giving of outer and inner things, as explained above, be experienced by himself alone.

original: bdag gis phyi nang gi sbyin pa rgya chen po byas pa de'i 'bras bu sems can gyi phyir btang nas bdag gi sbyin pa byas pa'i 'bras bu 'di la bdag dang sems can gnyi gas bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob par gyur cig ces
analyzed: bdag gis phyi nang gi sbyin pa rgya chen po byas pa de'i 'bras bu sems can gyi phyir btang nas bdag gi sbyin pa byas pa'i 'bras bu 'di la bdag dang sems can gnyi gas bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob par gyur cig ces
translated: He gives up the result of his vast giving of outer and inner things for the sake of sentient beings, and he dedicates it to the attainment of the result of unsurpassed enlightenment by both himself and sentient beings.

original: sngo bar byed de de ni dge ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sngo bar byed de de ni dge ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o // de la byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: This is called the virtuous intention.

original: bsam pa la gnas te bsgom pa la rnam pa drug tu phye nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyar te bshad nas /
analyzed: bsam pa la gnas te bsgom pa la rnam pa drug tu phye nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyar te bshad nas /
translated: In this section, the cultivation of the perfection of morality and so on is explained in terms of the six aspects of cultivation that were distinguished in the context of the perfection of generosity.

original: da ni tshul khrims dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang sbyar zhing 'chad de /
analyzed: da ni tshul khrims dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang sbyar zhing 'chad de /
translated: Now, it is explained in connection with the perfections of morality and wisdom.

original: de la ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the attitude of dissatisfaction with respect to the cultivation of the perfection of morality up to the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom?🔽For the sake of sentient beings, having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,

original: sems can gyi don du 'jig rten gyi khams me'i phung pos gang ba'i nang du /🔽tshe'i tshad gang @16a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du 'jig rten gyi khams me'i phung pos gang ba'i nang du / tshe'i tshad gang @16a * //
translated: having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,🔽having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,

original: g'a'i klung gi bye mar gnas pas bsgrubs nas tshul khrims gcig rnyed pa yang de bzhin du bsgrubs na skad cig ma gcig gis tshul khrims grub pa nas /
analyzed: g'a'i klung gi bye mar gnas pas bsgrubs nas tshul khrims gcig rnyed pa yang de bzhin du bsgrubs na skad cig ma gcig gis tshul khrims grub pa nas /
translated: having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges in the midst of a world filled with masses of fire,

original: tha ma tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs kyang /🔽da ni tshul khrims kyi phung po rdzogs pas cho ga ces chog par 'dzin pa med pa dang / shes rab la yang tshul de ltar bsgrubs nas shes rab kyi phung po rdzogs kyang /
analyzed: tha ma tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs kyang /🔽da ni tshul khrims kyi phung po rdzogs pas cho ga ces chog par 'dzin pa med pa dang / shes rab la yang tshul de ltar bsgrubs nas shes rab kyi phung po rdzogs kyang /
translated: having accomplished it by remaining for eons equal to the

original: shes rab kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs pas da ni chog go zhes 'dzin pa ni chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs pas da ni chog go zhes 'dzin pa ni chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought I have completed the aggregate of wisdom, now I am satisfied is called the thought of dissatisfaction.

original: gal te de ltar me'i phung po'i nang du tshul khrims sgrub kyang me zhi bar byed pa'i gnyen po tsan dan dang / ga pur dang / chu la sogs pa yod na shin tu dga' ba ma yin no snyam pa la /🔽yo byad thams cad rtag tu phongs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar me'i phung po'i nang du tshul khrims sgrub kyang me zhi bar byed pa'i gnyen po tsan dan dang / ga pur dang / chu la sogs pa yod na shin tu dga' ba ma yin no snyam pa la / yo byad thams cad rtag tu phongs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If one thinks, Even if I practice morality in the midst of a mass of fire, it is not very difficult if there are antidotes to extinguish the fire, such as sandalwood, camphor, water, etc., [the Buddha] says, Always lacking all the necessary conditions.

original: me'i gnyen po tsandan dang / ga pur dang / chu la sogs pa'i yo byad kun kyang med pas rtag tu lus tshig pa'i phyir lhag par yang spyad dka' bar ston to //🔽de ltar na yang bdag gi lus gcig gis sdug bsngal myong na shin tu bya dka' ba ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: me'i gnyen po tsandan dang / ga pur dang / chu la sogs pa'i yo byad kun kyang med pas rtag tu lus tshig pa'i phyir lhag par yang spyad dka' bar ston to // de ltar na yang bdag gi lus gcig gis sdug bsngal myong na shin tu bya dka' ba ma yin no snyam pa la /
translated: Since there are no necessary conditions such as sandalwood, camphor, water, etc., which are antidotes to fire, [the bodhisattva] always burns his body, and it is taught that it is extremely difficult to practice.

original: bdag gi lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag gi lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If one thinks, Even so, it is not very difficult to experience suffering with just one of my bodies, [the Buddha] says, As many bodies as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: bdag gi lus gcig gis sdug bsngal myong ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag gi lus gcig gis sdug bsngal myong ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that I experience suffering with just one body.

original: bdag gi lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cig gis sdug bsngal myong bas lhag par bya dka' ba ston to //
analyzed: bdag gi lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cig gis sdug bsngal myong bas lhag par bya dka' ba ston to //
translated: It shows that it is difficult to surpass the suffering experienced with as many bodies as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river.

original: gal te de ltar na yang tshe'i tshad lo brgya'am stong tsam gyis bsgrubs na tshe'i yun thung bas lhag par bya dka' ba ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang tshe'i tshad lo brgya'am stong tsam gyis bsgrubs na tshe'i yun thung bas lhag par bya dka' ba ma yin no snyam pa la /
translated: Even if it is like that, if it is accomplished in just a hundred or a thousand years, it is not difficult to surpass because the duration of life is short.

original: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i tshe'i tshad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i tshe'i tshad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it says, “The measure of life is equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges river,” and so forth.

original: tshe'i tshad kyang gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i bskal par bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: tshe'i tshad kyang gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i bskal par bsgrubs pas /
translated: The measure of life is also accomplished in eons equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges river.

original: dus kyi tshad ring pa'i phyir lhag par bsgrub dka' bar ston to //
analyzed: dus kyi tshad ring pa'i phyir lhag par bsgrub dka' bar ston to //
translated: Because the measure of time is long, it shows that it is difficult to surpass.

original: de ltar na yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'ga' tsam mes gang bar spyod na ;
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'ga' tsam mes gang bar spyod na ;
translated: Even if it is like that, if one practices in just one world system filled with fire,

original: lhag par bya dka' ba ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: lhag par bya dka' ba ma yin no snyam pa la /
translated: it is not difficult to surpass.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes rab tu gang ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes rab tu gang ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase “the world systems of a billion-world universe filled with fire” is mentioned.

original: mes gang ba yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'ga' tsam mes gang ba ma yin gyi stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun mes gang bar spyod @16b de ;
analyzed: mes gang ba yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'ga' tsam mes gang ba ma yin gyi stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun mes gang bar spyod @16b de ;
translated: The world systems filled with fire are not just some world systems filled with fire, but rather all the world systems of a billion-world universe filled with fire.

original: des na lhag par spyad dka' ba ston to //
analyzed: des na lhag par spyad dka' ba ston to //
translated: This shows that it is difficult to practice in that way.🔽If one practices in that way, it is not difficult to accomplish, but if one practices in a different way, it is difficult to accomplish.

original: de lta na yang spyod lam gcig gis bsgrubs na bya dka' ba ma yin no snyam pa la de'i phyir spyod lam bzhir spyod cing zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta na yang spyod lam gcig gis bsgrubs na bya dka' ba ma yin no snyam pa la de'i phyir spyod lam bzhir spyod cing zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase “practicing in the four postures” is mentioned.

original: de la spyod lam gcig gis spyod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la spyod lam gcig gis spyod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that one practices in only one posture,🔽but rather that one practices in the four postures:

original: 'gro ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / 'chag pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / 'chag pa ste /
translated: walking, standing, sitting, and lying down.

original: spyod lam bzhir spyod cing bsgrubs pas na lhag par bya dka' ba ston te /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhir spyod cing bsgrubs pas na lhag par bya dka' ba ston te /
translated: This shows that it is difficult to practice in that way.

original: de ltar bsgrubs na skad cig ma gcig gis tshul khrims bsgrubs pa nas mthar tshul khrims kyi phung po ji tsam gyis bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs kyang /
analyzed: de ltar bsgrubs na skad cig ma gcig gis tshul khrims bsgrubs pa nas mthar tshul khrims kyi phung po ji tsam gyis bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs kyang /
translated: If you practice in this way, you will complete the aggregate of morality, however much is necessary to become enlightened in unsurpassable enlightenment, in a single instant of morality.🔽But you will not have the thought, “Now I have completed the aggregate of morality, so now I have done enough.”

original: da tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs pas da ni chog go snyam pa'i bsam pa med de de ni chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs pas da ni chog go snyam pa'i bsam pa med de de ni chog mi shes pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the attitude of not being satisfied.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang tshul de dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang tshul de dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be applied in the same way.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: As for “the bodhisattva’s perfection of morality,” and so on,

original: gong du bshad pa'i tshul khrims dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub dka' ba de'ang /🔽nyin gcig ni bsgrub /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i tshul khrims dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub dka' ba de'ang / nyin gcig ni bsgrub /
translated: the practice of the perfection of morality and the perfection of wisdom, which are difficult to accomplish as explained above,🔽is practiced for one day

original: nyin gcig ni mi bsgrub /
analyzed: nyin gcig ni mi bsgrub /
translated: and not practiced for one day.

original: skad cig ma gcig la ni mi bsgrub pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la ni mi bsgrub pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that it is not accomplished in a single moment.

original: mthar bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi snying po la ma 'dug gi bar du skad cig ma gcig nas gcig gi bar du rgyun mi gcod cing bar chad med par sgrub par byed de //
analyzed: mthar bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi snying po la ma 'dug gi bar du skad cig ma gcig nas gcig gi bar du rgyun mi gcod cing bar chad med par sgrub par byed de //
translated: It is accomplished without interruption and without obstacle from one moment to the next, until one sits on the seat of enlightenment.

original: de lta bu ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la rgyas pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la rgyas pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Such is the expansive intention in the cultivation of the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyis sems can bsdus nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyis sems can bsdus nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The cultivation of the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom by the bodhisattva, having gathered sentient beings, etc.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la dga' ba'i bsam pa ji lta bu yin pa ston te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la dga' ba'i bsam pa ji lta bu yin pa ston te /
translated: It shows what the expansive intention is in the cultivation of the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de dag gis ni sems can bsdus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de dag gis ni sems can bsdus te /
translated: Thus, by means of the cultivation of the perfection of morality up to the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva attracts sentient beings.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa de dag la sems can bkod nas sems can la phan 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa de dag la sems can bkod nas sems can la phan 'dogs par byed do //
translated: Having established sentient beings in those perfections, he benefits sentient beings.

original: de ltar sems can la phan thogs par mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba'i khyad par skye ba ltar /
analyzed: de ltar sems can la phan thogs par mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba'i khyad par skye ba ltar /
translated: Seeing that he benefits sentient beings in that way, the bodhisattva generates a special joy.

original: sems can @17a * //
analyzed: sems can @17a * //
translated: Sentient beings

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la bkod de phan btags pa rnams de de tsam du dga' ba'i khyad par mi skye ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la bkod de phan btags pa rnams de de tsam du dga' ba'i khyad par mi skye ste /
translated: do not generate a special joy to that degree when they are established in the perfection of morality, etc., and are benefited.

original: de lta bu'i bsam pa ni dga' ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pa ni dga' ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Such an intention is called the intention of joy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, in order to demonstrate unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, etc.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la phan pa'i bsam pa ston to //🔽gong du bshad pa lta bu tshul khrims bshad pa nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la phan pa'i bsam pa ston to // gong du bshad pa lta bu tshul khrims bshad pa nas /
translated: The intention to benefit the practice of the transcendent perfections from discipline to wisdom is shown.

original: shes rab bshad pa'i bar du de dag gis sems can rnams la phan btags na 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag gis ni sems can la phan btags so snyam du bdag nyid la de ltar mi sems kyi /
analyzed: shes rab bshad pa'i bar du de dag gis sems can rnams la phan btags na 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag gis ni sems can la phan btags so snyam du bdag nyid la de ltar mi sems kyi /
translated: As explained above, from the explanation of discipline to the explanation of wisdom, if bodhisattvas benefit sentient beings in these ways, they do not think of themselves as having benefited sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pas sems can gang la phan pa'i sems can de dag gis bdag la phan btags so snyam du byang chub sems dpa' sde ltar dgos te /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pas sems can gang la phan pa'i sems can de dag gis bdag la phan btags so snyam du byang chub sems dpa' sde ltar dgos te /
translated: Rather, bodhisattvas think that those sentient beings whom they have benefited through discipline and so on have benefited them.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir sems can 'di dag gis bdag gis bstan pa bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa bsgrubs pas bdag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i chogs bsags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can 'di dag gis bdag gis bstan pa bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa bsgrubs pas bdag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i chogs bsags par 'gyur te /
translated: Because by practicing discipline and so on in accordance with what they have been taught, those sentient beings will accumulate the collections for attaining unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: de bas na sems can de dag gis bdag la phan btags so snyam du sems pa ni phan pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bas na sems can de dag gis bdag la phan btags so snyam du sems pa ni phan pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, the thought that “those sentient beings have helped me” is called the “thought of benefit.”

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la mi chags pa'i bsam pa ston te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la mi chags pa'i bsam pa ston te /
translated: The thought of the bodhisattva who is not attached to the practice of the perfections, beginning with the perfection of generosity, is shown in the passage that begins with “the perfection of generosity” and ends with “the perfection of wisdom.”🔽The thought of the bodhisattva who is not attached to the practice of the perfections, beginning with the perfection of generosity, is shown in the passage that begins with “the perfection of generosity” and ends with “the perfection of wisdom.”

original: 'di ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas ;
analyzed: 'di ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas ;
translated: Thus, having accomplished the perfection of generosity, which is the cause of the accumulation of merit,

original: shes rab kyi tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa gong du bshad pa lta bur rgya chen por bsgrubs shing sems can la phan btags kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa gong du bshad pa lta bur rgya chen por bsgrubs shing sems can la phan btags kyang /
translated: up to having accomplished the perfection of wisdom, which is the cause of the accumulation of wisdom, as explained above, and having benefited sentient beings,

original: tshe 'di phan btags pa'i lan la re ba med la tshe rabs gzhan du de dag gi 'bras bu mtho ris la sogs par rnam par smin par 'gyur ba la re ba med de de lta bu'i bsam pa ni mi chags pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di phan btags pa'i lan la re ba med la tshe rabs gzhan du de dag gi 'bras bu mtho ris la sogs par rnam par smin par 'gyur ba la re ba med de de lta bu'i bsam pa ni mi chags pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They do not hope for a reward in this life for their help to others, nor do they hope for the results of those actions in other lives, such as the higher realms. Such an attitude is called the attitude of nonattachment.

original: de la gang byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin du bsod nams kyi phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la gang byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin du bsod nams kyi phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the passage beginning “The bodhisattvas’ attitude of virtue is the same with regard to the accumulation of merit,”

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims bsgom pa nas shes rab bsgom pa la dge ba'i bsam pa ste /🔽'di @17b ltar bdag gis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyang gzhir 'gyur ba tshul khrims bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims bsgom pa nas shes rab bsgom pa la dge ba'i bsam pa ste / 'di @17b ltar bdag gis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyang gzhir 'gyur ba tshul khrims bsgom pa nas /
translated: the attitude of virtue is from the bodhisattvas’ cultivation of discipline up to the cultivation of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattvas do not wish for themselves alone the results of the vast accumulations of merit and wisdom that they have gathered and will gather in the future, from the cultivation of discipline up to the cultivation of wisdom.

original: shes rab bsgom pa'i bar du rgya che ba de 'dra ba bsgom shing bsgrubs pa de'i 'bras bu bdag 'ba' zhig gis thob par shog shig ces mi smon gyi sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bsngos te /
analyzed: shes rab bsgom pa'i bar du rgya che ba de 'dra ba bsgom shing bsgrubs pa de'i 'bras bu bdag 'ba' zhig gis thob par shog shig ces mi smon gyi sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bsngos te /
translated: They dedicate them all to the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: bdag gis gong du bshad pa lta bu'i tshul khrims kyi phung po bsgrubs pa nas /
analyzed: bdag gis gong du bshad pa lta bu'i tshul khrims kyi phung po bsgrubs pa nas /
translated: As I have explained above, I have practiced the aggregate of morality.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag bsgrubs pa'i rgyus //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag bsgrubs pa'i rgyus //
translated: The wholesome intention is the wish: By the cause of my having accomplished the aggregate of morality, etc. as explained above, up to the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdag dang sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i rgyu dang rten du gyur cig ces smon te /🔽de lta bu ni dge ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i rgyu dang rten du gyur cig ces smon te / de lta bu ni dge ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: may I and all sentient beings become the cause and support for attaining the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of Buddhahood.

original: thabs la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thabs la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three kinds of cultivation of the perfections while abiding in the means are as follows:

original: thabs la gnas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yang rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: thabs la gnas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yang rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three kinds of cultivation of the six perfections while abiding in the means.

original: gtong ba po dang / rdzas dang len pa po mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gtong ba po dang / rdzas dang len pa po mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: They are the non-apprehension of the giver, the gift, and the recipient.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate that very meaning, it is said:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'khor gsum yongs su dag par so sor rtog pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'khor gsum yongs su dag par so sor rtog pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because of the thorough discernment of the purity of the three spheres through non-conceptual wisdom.

original: gtong pa po dang / rdzas dang / len pa po gsum la yod par mi rtog pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gtong pa po dang / rdzas dang / len pa po gsum yod par so sor rtog pa la thabs la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtong pa po dang / rdzas dang / len pa po gsum la yod par mi rtog pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gtong pa po dang / rdzas dang / len pa po gsum yod par so sor rtog pa la thabs la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of skill in means is the nonconceptual intuition which does not conceive the existence of the three spheres, the giver, the gift, and the receiver, and the discernment of the existence of the three spheres, the giver, the gift, and the receiver.

original: de la ci'i phyir thabs zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir thabs zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called skill in means?

original: de'i phyir / de ltar thabs de ni yid la byed pa thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ltar thabs de ni yid la byed pa thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so /
translated: Therefore it is said, “because that skill accomplishes all mental attentions.”

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa des ni gong du bshad pa'i yid la byed pa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'grub cing dag par byed de /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa des ni gong du bshad pa'i yid la byed pa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'grub cing dag par byed de /
translated: By that nonapprehension which is the mark of the complete purification of the three spheres, all the mental attentions explained above and all the qualities of the Buddha are accomplished and purified.

original: de bas na de la thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de la thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called skill in means.

original: dbang yod pa la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang yod pa la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The perfection of the power of the basis is the perfection of the power of the roots of good.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sar sku dang gsung dang thugs phun sum tshogs pa brnyes nas sems can gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'jug pa ni dbang yod pa la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sar sku dang gsung dang thugs phun sum tshogs pa brnyes nas sems can gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'jug pa ni dbang yod pa la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Having attained the perfect body, speech, and mind on the Buddha ground, one engages in the six perfections for the sake of sentient beings. This is called “cultivating the perfections while abiding in mastery.”

original: de la rnam pa gsum yod pa ni 'grel pa nas 'byung ba bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum yod pa ni 'grel pa nas 'byung ba bzhin du blta'o //
translated: There are three aspects of this, which should be understood according to the commentary.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis su @18a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis su @18a * //
translated: The two bodies of the Tathāgata

original: blta bar bya ste /🔽ngo bo nyid dang / rdzogs par longs spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blta bar bya ste / ngo bo nyid dang / rdzogs par longs spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: should be seen as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis la lus la dbang yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis la lus la dbang yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The two bodies of the Tathāgata are called “having mastery over the body.”

original: sku gnyis ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku chos kyi sku dang / rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sku gnyis ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku chos kyi sku dang / rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku'o //
translated: The two bodies are the essential body, which is the Dharma body, and the body of perfect enjoyment.

original: de la chos kyi sku ni 'phags pa rnams so so rang gis rig pa nam mkha' bzhin du kun tu khyab pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku ni 'phags pa rnams so so rang gis rig pa nam mkha' bzhin du kun tu khyab pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The Dharma Body is the Noble Ones' intuitive wisdom, which is all-pervading like space, and is the cause of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku ni byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa yan chad theg pa chen po'i chos kyi longs spyod phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku ni byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa yan chad theg pa chen po'i chos kyi longs spyod phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Enjoyment Body is that which causes the perfect enjoyment of the teachings of the Great Vehicle for the Bodhisattvas on the eighth stage and above.

original: gang gis sems can thams cad la chos dang mthun pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gis sems can thams cad la chos dang mthun pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: By which he says, ...all sentient beings... and so on.

original: sngon spyad pa la dbang yod pa ni sprul pa'i sku la bya ste /
analyzed: sngon spyad pa la dbang yod pa ni sprul pa'i sku la bya ste /
translated: The Emanation Body is to be understood as the one who has power over previous conduct.

original: sprul pa'i sku gang gis lha dang mi la sogs pa'i sems can thams cad dang mthun pa'i lus dang spyod pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku gang gis lha dang mi la sogs pa'i sems can thams cad dang mthun pa'i lus dang spyod pa ston pa ste /
translated: The Emanation Body is that which displays bodies and conduct in accordance with all sentient beings, such as gods, humans, and so on.

original: sku gnyis kyis ni sku dang thugs phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: sku gnyis kyis ni sku dang thugs phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The two Bodies show the perfection of body and mind.

original: ston pa dbang yod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ston pa dbang yod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Teacher who has power over... and so on.

original: ston pa la dbang yod pa ni gsungs phun sum tshogs pa gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la lhag chad med par thogs pa med par ston te /
analyzed: ston pa la dbang yod pa ni gsungs phun sum tshogs pa gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la lhag chad med par thogs pa med par ston te /
translated: The teacher's mastery is the perfect speech by which he teaches the six perfections without error or omission and without impediment.

original: 'dis ni gsung phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gsung phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of speech.

original: mdo sde rgyan bam po bzhi pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan bam po bzhi pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the fourth chapter of the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras is finished.

original: // / rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // / rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The verse summary is called the analysis, etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa bstan nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the cultivation of the six perfections,

original: da ni rab tu dbye ba bstan te /
analyzed: da ni rab tu dbye ba bstan te /
translated: now the analysis is taught.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la phye na dpag tu med pa zhig tu 'gyur mod kyi de la yang bsdus te dbye na pha rol tu phyin pa re re zhing yang rang bzhin la sogs pa rnam pa drug drug tu shes te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la phye na dpag tu med pa zhig tu 'gyur mod kyi de la yang bsdus te dbye na pha rol tu phyin pa re re zhing yang rang bzhin la sogs pa rnam pa drug drug tu shes te /
translated: If the six perfections are analyzed, they become immeasurable, but if they are summarized and analyzed, each perfection should be understood as having six aspects such as nature.

original: de yang pha rol tu phyin pa re re zhing tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: de yang pha rol tu phyin pa re re zhing tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: And each perfection is taught by two verses.

original: de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are twelve verses.

original: don rnams gtong par byed pa dang / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don rnams gtong par byed pa dang / zhes bya ba la /
translated: The nature of generosity is to give away things.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i zhing dang yon tan gyi zhing gsum la phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong ba ni sbyin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i zhing dang yon tan gyi zhing gsum la phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong ba ni sbyin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of generosity is to give away external and internal things to the three fields of suffering, qualities and merit.

original: gnas pa'i rtsa ba sems pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rtsa ba sems pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The root of abiding is intention.

original: rtsa ba'i ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum pa bya ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum pa bya ste /
translated: The root is the three roots of virtue.

original: 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang pa dang / gti mi mug pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum dang ldan pa'i sems @18b pa ni sbyin pa'i gnas dang rgyu yin te de gsum la sbyin pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang pa dang / gti mi mug pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum dang ldan pa'i sems @18b pa ni sbyin pa'i gnas dang rgyu yin te de gsum la sbyin pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind endowed with the three roots of virtue nonattachment, nonhatred and nondelusion is the abode and cause of generosity, because generosity arises from those three.

original: lus dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The result of generosity is the attainment of a perfect body and perfect resources.

original: lus phun sum tshogs pa thob pa dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa thob pa ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: lus phun sum tshogs pa thob pa dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa thob pa ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The attainment of a perfect body and the attainment of perfect resources are the result of generosity.

original: nang gi dngos po gtong bas ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang tshe ring po dang ldan pa'i lus thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang gi dngos po gtong bas ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang tshe ring po dang ldan pa'i lus thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By giving internal things, one obtains a body endowed with good complexion, shape, and long life.

original: phyi'i dngos po gtong bas ni gter dang 'bru la sogs pa yo byad phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po gtong bas ni gter dang 'bru la sogs pa yo byad phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By giving external things, one obtains the perfection of resources, endowed with the perfection of wealth such as treasure, grain, etc.

original: bsdu ba gnyis dang bskang ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsdu ba gnyis dang bskang ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two kinds of attraction and the two kinds of fulfillment.

original: bdag dang gzhan gnyis sdud par byed pa dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs skong bar byed pa ni sbyin pa'i las te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gnyis sdud par byed pa dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs skong bar byed pa ni sbyin pa'i las te /
translated: The action of giving is the attraction of both oneself and others, and the fulfillment of the stores of merit and intuition.

original: phongs pa rnams la zang zing byed pas sems can gzhan bsdu zhing sems can gzhan la phan btags pa dang / de'i rgyus ma 'ongs pa na bdag nyid longs spyod chen por 'gyur bas na gzhan bsdu zhing bdag la phan btags so //
analyzed: phongs pa rnams la zang zing byed pas sems can gzhan bsdu zhing sems can gzhan la phan btags pa dang / de'i rgyus ma 'ongs pa na bdag nyid longs spyod chen por 'gyur bas na gzhan bsdu zhing bdag la phan btags so //
translated: One attracts other sentient beings and benefits other sentient beings by giving material things to the poor, and by that cause one attracts oneself and benefits oneself in the future by becoming one of great wealth.

original: de la chos sbyin pas ni ye shes kyi tshogs skong bar byed //
analyzed: de la chos sbyin pas ni ye shes kyi tshogs skong bar byed //
translated: By giving the Dharma, one fulfills the accumulation of wisdom.

original: mi 'jigs pa dang / zang zing byin pas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs skong bar byed do //🔽gnas lnga ba'i mdo sde bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa dang / zang zing byin pas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs skong bar byed do // gnas lnga ba'i mdo sde bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: By giving fearlessness and material things, one fulfills the accumulation of merit.🔽As in the Sutra on the Five Points.🔽In the Sutra on the Five Points,

original: gnas lnga pa yi mdo sde las //
analyzed: gnas lnga pa yi mdo sde las //
translated: it says:

original: gzhan la kha zas byin pas ni //
analyzed: gzhan la kha zas byin pas ni //
translated: “By giving food to others,

original: gnas lnga dag ni kun thob ste //
analyzed: gnas lnga dag ni kun thob ste //
translated: one obtains all five points:

original: tshe dang kha dog stobs dang bde //
analyzed: tshe dang kha dog stobs dang bde //
translated: long life, good complexion, strength, happiness,

original: spobs pa phun sum tshogs dang lnga //
analyzed: spobs pa phun sum tshogs dang lnga //
translated: and perfect eloquence as the fifth.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is as stated in the above passage.

original: ser sna med par ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ser sna med par ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is endowed with non-stinginess.

original: gang la ser sna yod pa de la ni sbyin pa med kyi //
analyzed: gang la ser sna yod pa de la ni sbyin pa med kyi //
translated: Where there is stinginess, there is no generosity.🔽Where there is generosity, there is the quality of non-stinginess.

original: gang la sbyin pa yod pa de la ser sna med pa'i chos yod pas ldan pa ni ser sna med pa'i chos dang ldan no //🔽chos dang zang zing mi 'jigs mthong //
analyzed: gang la sbyin pa yod pa de la ser sna med pa'i chos yod pas ldan pa ni ser sna med pa'i chos dang ldan no // chos dang zang zing mi 'jigs mthong //
translated: It is endowed with the quality of non-stinginess.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the seeing of Dharma, material things, and fearlessness.

original: sbyin pa la phye na rnam pa gsum du 'jug ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la phye na rnam pa gsum du 'jug ste /
translated: When generosity is analyzed, it is included in three types:

original: chos sbyin pa la 'jug pa dang / zang zing sbyin pa la 'jug pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa la 'jug pa'o //🔽de la gsung rab kyi don dang tshig ma nor bar 'chad pa ni chos sbyin pa la 'jug pa'o //🔽phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong ba ni zang zing sbyin pa la 'jug pa'o //🔽rgyal po dang rkun po dang / me dang / chu'i 'jigs pa'i skyabs su byed pa ni mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa la 'jug pa ste /🔽'dis ni @19a * //
analyzed: chos sbyin pa la 'jug pa dang / zang zing sbyin pa la 'jug pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa la 'jug pa'o // de la gsung rab kyi don dang tshig ma nor bar 'chad pa ni chos sbyin pa la 'jug pa'o // phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong ba ni zang zing sbyin pa la 'jug pa'o // rgyal po dang rkun po dang / me dang / chu'i 'jigs pa'i skyabs su byed pa ni mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa la 'jug pa ste / 'dis ni @19a * //
translated: 1.1.1.1.1.1.1. Engaging in the giving of Dharma,🔽1.1.1.1.1.1.2. engaging in the giving of material things,🔽1.1.1.1.1.1.3. engaging in the giving of protection.🔽1.1.1.1.1.1.1. Engaging in the giving of Dharma is teaching the meaning and words of the scriptures without error.🔽1.1.1.1.1.1.2. Engaging in the giving of material things is giving away external and internal things.🔽1.1.1.1.1.1.3. Engaging in the giving of protection is protecting from the fear of kings, thieves, fire, water, and so on.🔽By these,🔽

original: 'jug pa'i don bstan to //🔽sbyin pa de ltar shes nas su //🔽mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed //🔽ces bya ba la /🔽de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i don bstan to //🔽sbyin pa de ltar shes nas su //🔽mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed //🔽ces bya ba la /🔽de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar te /

original: sbyin pa'i rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / las la sogs pa gong du bshad pa lta bu yin par shes nas mkhas pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / las la sogs pa gong du bshad pa lta bu yin par shes nas mkhas pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the wise bodhisattvas, knowing that generosity has the nature, cause, result, and activity explained above, practice the perfection of generosity.

original: ser sna med pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ser sna med pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is engaged in without stinginess.

original: ser sna can rnams la ni sbyin pa la 'jug pa med kyi /
analyzed: ser sna can rnams la ni sbyin pa la 'jug pa med kyi /
translated: For those who are stingy, there is no engagement in generosity.

original: ser sna med pa rnams sbyin pa la 'jug par byed pas na ser sna med pa'i chos dang ldan no //
analyzed: ser sna med pa rnams sbyin pa la 'jug par byed pas na ser sna med pa'i chos dang ldan no //
translated: But those who are not stingy engage in generosity, so they possess the quality of non-stinginess.

original: yan lag drug dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yan lag drug dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: With six aspects.

original: yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims ni tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims ni tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of morality is the morality possessed with six aspects.

original: de yang yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa so sor thar ba'i sdom pas bsdams pa /
analyzed: de yang yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa so sor thar ba'i sdom pas bsdams pa /
translated: Moreover, the morality possessed with six aspects is the morality of those who possess morality, restrained by the vows of individual liberation,

original: cho ga phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: cho ga phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: with perfect ritual,

original: spyod pa dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: spyod pa dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: 1. He is endowed with perfect conduct and domain.

original: kha na ma thob phra rab tsam la yang 'jigs par lta ba /
analyzed: kha na ma thob phra rab tsam la yang 'jigs par lta ba /
translated: 2. He sees danger in the slightest transgression.

original: yang dag par blangs pa'i gnas la slob po zhes 'byung ba'o //🔽zhi sems blangs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i gnas la slob po zhes 'byung ba'o // zhi sems blangs zhes bya ba la /
translated: 3. He trains in the precepts that he has accepted.

original: zhi ba'i sems kyi blangs pa ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: zhi ba'i sems kyi blangs pa ni rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of morality is the acceptance of a tranquil mind.

original: 'phags pa rnams dang po tshul khrims len pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya'o snyam du bsams nas len te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams dang po tshul khrims len pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya'o snyam du bsams nas len te /
translated: The noble ones, when they first accept morality, do so with the thought of attaining nirvana.

original: de bas na sems kyi rgyu'o //🔽bde bar 'gro dang gnas len dang / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na sems kyi rgyu'o // bde bar 'gro dang gnas len dang / zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, morality has a tranquil mind as its cause.

original: bde 'gro len pa dang / gnas len par byed pa ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: bde 'gro len pa dang / gnas len par byed pa ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: The result of morality is the acceptance of happy rebirth and happy states.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan na gang dang gang du skyes pa thams cad du lha dang mir skye ba len pa'i phyir bde 'gro len pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan na gang dang gang du skyes pa thams cad du lha dang mir skye ba len pa'i phyir bde 'gro len pa'o //
translated: The acceptance of happy rebirth is the result of morality, because the moral person is reborn in the happy realms of gods and humans wherever he is reborn.

original: gnas kyi sgras ni ting nge 'dzin la bya ste /
analyzed: gnas kyi sgras ni ting nge 'dzin la bya ste /
translated: The acceptance of happy states refers to the concentration of the form and formless realms.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan na 'gyod pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan na 'gyod pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is endowed with morality, one has no regrets.

original: 'gyod pa med na sems bde'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med na sems bde'o //
translated: When one has no regrets, one’s mind is at ease.

original: sems bde na lus bde'o //
analyzed: sems bde na lus bde'o //
translated: When the mind is at ease, the body is at ease.

original: lus bde na yang sems bde ste /
analyzed: lus bde na yang sems bde ste /
translated: When the body is at ease, the mind is at ease.

original: sems bde na sems rtse gcig pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: sems bde na sems rtse gcig pa 'thob ste /
translated: When the mind is at ease, one attains one-pointedness of mind.

original: de bas na gnas len to //🔽gnas zhi 'jigs pa med pa dang / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na gnas len to // gnas zhi 'jigs pa med pa dang / zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is a basis.

original: gnas byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang / 'jig pa med par byed pa ni gnas so //🔽de la gnas byed pa ni /
analyzed: gnas byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang / 'jig pa med par byed pa ni gnas so // de la gnas byed pa ni /
translated: A basis is that which establishes, that which pacifies, and that which does not destroy.

original: sa gzhi chen po la lo tog thams cad kyi gnas byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: sa gzhi chen po la lo tog thams cad kyi gnas byed pa bzhin du /
translated: Among them, that which establishes is like the great earth, which is the basis for all crops.

original: tshul khrims kyang @19b byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i don kun gyi gnas byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang @19b byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i don kun gyi gnas byed do //
translated: Similarly, morality is the basis for all the goals of the factors of awakening, and so on.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gdung ba sel bar byed pas na zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gdung ba sel bar byed pas na zhi bar byed do //
translated: When one is endowed with morality, one eliminates the torments of attachment, and so on. Therefore, it pacifies.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan na tshe rabs gzhan gyi 'jigs pa dang / tshe 'di'i 'jigs pa med pas na 'jigs pa med par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan na tshe rabs gzhan gyi 'jigs pa dang / tshe 'di'i 'jigs pa med pas na 'jigs pa med par byed pa'o ;
translated: Since one who has morality has no fear of other lives and no fear of this life, it is the maker of fearlessness.

original: / de la tshe rabs gzhan gyi 'jigs pas ni ngan song gsum du 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: / de la tshe rabs gzhan gyi 'jigs pas ni ngan song gsum du 'jigs pa ste /
translated: Therein, fear of other lives is fear of the three lower miserable destinies.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du lha dang mi'i nang du skye bas na ngan song du skye ba'i 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du lha dang mi'i nang du skye bas na ngan song du skye ba'i 'jigs pa med do //
translated: Since one is born in other lives among gods and humans, there is no fear of being born in the lower miserable destinies.

original: tshe 'di'i 'jigs pa yang rnams pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshe 'di'i 'jigs pa yang rnams pa gnyis te /
translated: Fear of this life is also of two kinds:

original: kha na ma tho ba'i 'jigs pa dang / sha kho na gnyer ba'i 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba'i 'jigs pa dang / sha kho na gnyer ba'i 'jigs pa ste /
translated: fear of blame and fear of enmity.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan na de la su yang mi snyan par mi smra bas kha na ma tho ba'i 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan na de la su yang mi snyan par mi smra bas kha na ma tho ba'i 'jigs pa med do //
translated: Since no one speaks unpleasantly of one who has morality, there is no fear of blame.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan na srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i brdeg btsog mi 'byung bas na sha khon gyi 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan na srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i brdeg btsog mi 'byung bas na sha khon gyi 'jigs pa med do //
translated: Since there is no beating or killing that arises from the conditions of killing, etc. for one who has morality, there is no fear of enmity.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Possessing the accumulation of merit.

original: tshul khrims blangs pa dang / lus dang dag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi 'byung bar bsdams pa dang / de ltar bsdams pa dang / dge ba'i chos 'ba' zhig 'phel bas na ldan pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan no //
analyzed: tshul khrims blangs pa dang / lus dang dag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi 'byung bar bsdams pa dang / de ltar bsdams pa dang / dge ba'i chos 'ba' zhig 'phel bas na ldan pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan no //
translated: He is endowed with the accumulation of merit, because he has taken up morality, because he has restrained himself from the performance of evil, unwholesome dharmas through body, speech and mind, because he has thus restrained himself, and because only wholesome dharmas increase.

original: brda dang chos nyid thob pa ni //
analyzed: brda dang chos nyid thob pa ni //
translated: The acquisition of the conventional and the absolute

original: sdom la gnas pa dag la yod //
analyzed: sdom la gnas pa dag la yod //
translated: is in those who abide in the vow.

original: ces bya bas 'jug pa bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya bas 'jug pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the engagement.

original: 'jug pa la yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'jug pa la yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two kinds of engagement.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: dbye ba'i 'jig pa dang / gzhi'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba'i 'jig pa dang / gzhi'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: The engagement of analysis and the engagement of the basis.

original: de la tshul khrims la phye na rnam pa gsum du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims la phye na rnam pa gsum du 'jug ste /
translated: Of these, morality is engaged in as threefold when it is analyzed:

original: so sor thar ba'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang ; zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar ba'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang ; zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: the vow of individual emancipation, the vow of meditation and the vow of the uncontaminated.

original: de la mkhan po dang slob dpon la gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis so sor thar ba'i sdom pa blangs pa ni brda'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mkhan po dang slob dpon la gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis so sor thar ba'i sdom pa blangs pa ni brda'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: The vow of individual emancipation which is taken through the performance of the rite of requesting the upadhyaya, the acarya and the samgha is called the conventional morality.

original: bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i som pa gnyis ni chos nyid kyi tshul khrims zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i som pa gnyis ni chos nyid kyi tshul khrims zhes bya ste /
translated: The two, the vow of meditative concentration and the uncontaminated vow, are called the morality of reality.

original: 'dis ni dbye ba'i 'jug bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dbye ba'i 'jug bstan to //
translated: This shows the engagement of classification.

original: sdom pa gnas pa dag la yod //
analyzed: sdom pa gnas pa dag la yod //
translated: It exists for those who maintain the vow.

original: ces bya bas gzhi'i 'jug pa bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya bas gzhi'i 'jug pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the engagement of basis.

original: gong du bshad pa'i tshul khrims lta bu yang sdom pa la gnas shing bsten pa rnams la yod kyi gzhan la med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i tshul khrims lta bu yang sdom pa la gnas shing bsten pa rnams la yod kyi gzhan la med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
