translated: The meaning is that the morality explained above exists for those who maintain and rely on the vow, but not for others.

original: tshul khrims de bzhin shes nas su //
analyzed: tshul khrims de bzhin shes nas su //
translated: Knowing morality in that way,

original: @20a * // mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @20a * // mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the wise accomplish it perfectly.🔽This shows the engagement of accomplishment.

original: tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin dang rgyu la sogs pa gong du bshad pa lta bu yin par shes nas mkhas pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin du sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽mi mjed ji mi snyam sems dang ; / zhes bya bas /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin dang rgyu la sogs pa gong du bshad pa lta bu yin par shes nas mkhas pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin du sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to // mi mjed ji mi snyam sems dang ; / zhes bya bas /
translated: The meaning is that the wise bodhisattvas, knowing the nature, cause, and so on of morality as explained above, accomplish it in that way.🔽The patient one is tolerant of harm,

original: bzod pa'i rang bzhin bstan te /
analyzed: bzod pa'i rang bzhin bstan te /
translated: This shows the nature of patience.

original: mi mjed ces bya bas ni gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa bstan /
analyzed: mi mjed ces bya bas ni gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa bstan /
translated: The term enduring indicates the patience of enduring harm.

original: ji mi snyam zhes bya bas bdag sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa bstan /
analyzed: ji mi snyam zhes bya bas bdag sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa bstan /
translated: The term not minding indicates the patience of not minding suffering.

original: shes pa zhes bya bas chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa bstan to//
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya bas chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa bstan to//
translated: The term knowing indicates the patience of certainty about the Dharma.

original: snying rje chos la gnas pa'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rje chos la gnas pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of compassion and because of abiding in the Dharma,

original: snying rje dang chos gnyis ni bzod pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: snying rje dang chos gnyis ni bzod pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Compassion and the Dharma are the causes of patience.

original: su la snying rje med pa de ni sems can gyis gnod par byas pa rnams bzod par mi nus kyi snying rje can gyis bzod pa nus pas na snying rje ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: su la snying rje med pa de ni sems can gyis gnod par byas pa rnams bzod par mi nus kyi snying rje can gyis bzod pa nus pas na snying rje ni rgyu'o //
translated: One who is without compassion is not able to endure the harm done by sentient beings, but one who has compassion is able to endure it. Thus, compassion is the cause.

original: chos la gnas pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos la gnas pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Abiding in the Dharma is also twofold:

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te /🔽de rnams bdun zhes bya bas 'jug pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te / de rnams bdun zhes bya bas 'jug pa bstan te /
translated: having taken up morality,🔽The term those indicates the engagement.

original: de rnams la zhes bya bas ni gzhi'i 'jug pa bstan te //
analyzed: de rnams la zhes bya bas ni gzhi'i 'jug pa bstan te //
translated: The term in them indicates the engagement in the basis.

original: gong du bshad pa'i brtson 'grus kyang gang zag brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams la yod kyi brtson 'grus ma brtsams pa la med pas na brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i gang zag ni brtson 'grus kyi gzhi dang rten yin no //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i brtson 'grus kyang gang zag brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams la yod kyi brtson 'grus ma brtsams pa la med pas na brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i gang zag ni brtson 'grus kyi gzhi dang rten yin no //
translated: The above mentioned effort exists for those who have begun to make effort, but not for those who have not begun to make effort. Therefore, the person who begins to make effort is the basis and support of effort.

original: de rnams bdun zhes bya bas rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa bstan te /
analyzed: de rnams bdun zhes bya bas rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa bstan te /
translated: The seven kinds of effort are distinguished by way of the seven kinds of persons.

original: brtson 'grus la phye la bslab pa gsum la brtags pa dang rim gro byed pa'i sgo nas rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus la phye la bslab pa gsum la brtags pa dang rim gro byed pa'i sgo nas rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: Effort is distinguished by way of the seven kinds of persons, and becomes sevenfold by way of the three trainings and by way of service.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs kyis srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba spong zhing dge ba la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs kyis srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba spong zhing dge ba la 'jug par byed de /
translated: Among them, the five collections of consciousness from eye consciousness to body consciousness abandon nonvirtue such as killing and engage in virtue.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs la brtson 'grus lngar gzhag ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs la brtson 'grus lngar gzhag ste /
translated: Effort is posited as fivefold in the five collections of consciousness.

original: de rnam lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab par bsdu'o //
analyzed: de rnam lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab par bsdu'o //
translated: That is included in the training of superior morality.

original: de'i steng du lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gnyis bsnan te bdun no //
analyzed: de'i steng du lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gnyis bsnan te bdun no //
translated: On top of that, the two trainings in higher mind and higher wisdom are added, making seven.

original: de yang lus kyi brtson 'grus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus gnyis su bsdu ste /
analyzed: de yang lus kyi brtson 'grus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus gnyis su bsdu ste /
translated: Moreover, they are summarized as two: physical effort and mental effort.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ni lus kyi brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ni lus kyi brtson 'grus so //
translated: The training in higher morality is physical effort.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ni sems @20b kyi brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ni sems @20b kyi brtson 'grus so //
translated: The training in higher wisdom is mental effort.

original: brtson 'grus de ltar shes nas ni //
analyzed: brtson 'grus de ltar shes nas ni //
translated: Knowing effort in that way,

original: mkhas pas yang dag sgrub par byed //
analyzed: mkhas pas yang dag sgrub par byed //
translated: the wise one accomplishes it correctly.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa gong du bshad pa lta bu'i yin par shes nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin du sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa gong du bshad pa lta bu'i yin par shes nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin du sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that, knowing the nature of effort, its cause, its result, and so on, as explained above, the bodhisattvas accomplish it in that way.

original: ji ltar brtson 'grus brtsams pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos dang ma 'dres shing bde ba la reg par spyod ces bya ba la gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar brtson 'grus brtsams pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos dang ma 'dres shing bde ba la reg par spyod ces bya ba la gsungs so //
translated: As it is said, By undertaking striving, one does not mix with evil, unwholesome dharmas, but lives in contact with happiness.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: brtson 'grus nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i mdo'i gtan tshigs ston te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i mdo'i gtan tshigs ston te /
translated: the sutra passage which shows striving as the antidote to the defilements is quoted.

original: mdo las kyang brtson 'grus brtsams na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spong do //
analyzed: mdo las kyang brtson 'grus brtsams na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spong do //
translated: For it is said in the sutra: By undertaking striving, one abandons evil, unwholesome dharmas.

original: sdig pa'i mi dge ba'i chos spangs nas de dang ma 'dres par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i mi dge ba'i chos spangs nas de dang ma 'dres par gnas pa'o //
translated: Having abandoned evil, unwholesome dharmas, one lives without mixing with them.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos dang ma 'dres na /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos dang ma 'dres na /
translated: When one does not mix with evil, unwholesome dharmas,

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par spyod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan gyi bde ba la reg par spyod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: one lives in contact with the happiness of the dhyanas in the form realm.

original: sems ni nang du gnas pa dang / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems ni nang du gnas pa dang / zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind abides inwardly,

original: gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i yul la sems g-yeng ba las blangs nas sems nang du rtse gcig par 'jog pa ni bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i yul la sems g-yeng ba las blangs nas sems nang du rtse gcig par 'jog pa ni bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: means that the nature of dhyana is to bring the mind back from distraction to external objects such as form, and to settle it inwardly in one-pointed concentration.

original: dran dang brtson la gnas pa dang / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dran dang brtson la gnas pa dang / zhes bya ba la /
translated: Abiding in mindfulness and effort.

original: rgyu bstan te /
analyzed: rgyu bstan te /
translated: The cause is shown.

original: gang dag dran pa nyams pa dang / le lo can la ni bsam gtan mi 'byung gi gang la bsgom par bya ba'i yul sems la ma brjed pa'i dran pa yod pa dang / de nyid la rgyun du sgom par byed pa'i brtson 'grus yod pa de la ni ting nge 'dzin 'byung bar 'gyur bas na dran pa dang brtson 'grus ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang dag dran pa nyams pa dang / le lo can la ni bsam gtan mi 'byung gi gang la bsgom par bya ba'i yul sems la ma brjed pa'i dran pa yod pa dang / de nyid la rgyun du sgom par byed pa'i brtson 'grus yod pa de la ni ting nge 'dzin 'byung bar 'gyur bas na dran pa dang brtson 'grus ni rgyu'o //
translated: Concentration does not occur for those who are forgetful and lazy. But for those who have mindfulness that does not forget the object of meditation and who have the effort that meditates continuously on that object, concentration will occur. Thus, mindfulness and effort are the cause.

original: bde ba dag ni skye ba'i rgyu //
analyzed: bde ba dag ni skye ba'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of the arising of bliss.

original: zhes bya bas 'bras bu bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas 'bras bu bstan te /
translated: The result is shown.

original: bde ba skye ba ni gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba skye ba ni gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba'o //
translated: The arising of bliss is rebirth among the gods of the form realm.

original: bsam gtan bsgrubs na gzugs kyi bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i lha'i nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bsgrubs na gzugs kyi bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i lha'i nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one accomplishes concentration, one will be reborn among the gods of the first concentration of the form realm and so on.

original: de bas na de ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: Therefore, that is the result.

original: mngon shes spyod pa'i dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon shes spyod pa'i dbang byed pa'o //
translated: The power of the superknowledges is the cause of the arising of bliss.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cause is shown.

original: mngon par shes pa la dbang byed pa dang / spyod pa la dbang byed pa ni las te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la dbang byed pa dang / spyod pa la dbang byed pa ni las te /
translated: Mastery of the superknowledges and mastery of conduct are its action.

original: bsam gtan bsgrubs na rdzu 'phrul gyi mig dang / rna ba la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa lnga la dbang byed par 'gyur ba dang / 'phags pa'i spyod pa dang / lha'i spyod pa dang / tshangs pa'i spyod pa la dbang byed par 'gyur te /🔽de la bden @21a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan bsgrubs na rdzu 'phrul gyi mig dang / rna ba la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa lnga la dbang byed par 'gyur ba dang / 'phags pa'i spyod pa dang / lha'i spyod pa dang / tshangs pa'i spyod pa la dbang byed par 'gyur te / de la bden @21a * //
translated: When one has accomplished meditative concentration, one gains mastery of the five superknowledges, such as the divine eye and ear, etc., and one gains mastery of the conduct of the noble ones, the conduct of the gods, and the conduct of Brahma.

original: pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la sogs pa ni 'phags pa'i spyod pa'o //🔽gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la sogs pa ni 'phags pa'i spyod pa'o // gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
translated: The conduct of the noble ones is the four noble truths, the three doors of liberation, etc.

original: lha'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The conduct of the gods is the four meditations of the form realm and the four formless states of composure.

original: tshad med pa bzhi ni tshangs pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi ni tshangs pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The conduct of Brahma is the four immeasurables.

original: chos rnams kyi ni gtso bo dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ni gtso bo dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The best of all things is the Dharma.

original: ldan pa ni chos rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa dang ldan te chos rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: ldan pa ni chos rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa dang ldan te chos rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa ni bsam gtan no //
translated: Endowed with the best of all things means that it is endowed with the best of all dharmas, for concentration is the best of all dharmas.

original: de la gtso bo zhes bya ba dang sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba don gcig ste /
analyzed: de la gtso bo zhes bya ba dang sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba don gcig ste /
translated: Here, the best and the foremost have the same meaning.

original: bsam gtan ni chos rnams kyi sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni chos rnams kyi sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Concentration is the foremost of all dharmas.

original: ji ltar sngon du 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sngon du 'gro zhe na /
translated: How is it foremost?

original: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i shes rab skye'o //
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i shes rab skye'o //
translated: When the mind is in equipoise, the wisdom that knows things as they are comes into being.

original: shes rab skyes na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab skyes na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When wisdom arises, one becomes liberated.

original: rnam par grol na rnam par grol ba'i ye shes skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol na rnam par grol ba'i ye shes skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one is liberated, the wisdom of liberation comes into being.

original: de la yod dang de gsum mo //
analyzed: de la yod dang de gsum mo //
translated: Here, the three exist.

original: zhes bya bas 'jug pa bstan no //
analyzed: zhes bya bas 'jug pa bstan no //
translated: This shows the engagement.

original: de la yod ces bya bas gzhi'i 'jug pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la yod ces bya bas gzhi'i 'jug pa bstan te /
translated: Here, the three exist shows the engagement of the basis.

original: gong du bshad pa'i bsam gtan de las bsam gtan bsgom pa'i gang zag rnams la yod kyi gzhan la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i bsam gtan de las bsam gtan bsgom pa'i gang zag rnams la yod kyi gzhan la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The concentration explained above exists for those who cultivate concentration, but not for others.

original: gang zag ni bsam gtan gyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: gang zag ni bsam gtan gyi gzhi'o //
translated: The person is the basis of the meditative development.

original: gsum zhes bya bas rab tu 'jug pa bstan te /
analyzed: gsum zhes bya bas rab tu 'jug pa bstan te /
translated: The three indicate the entrance.

original: bsam gtan la phyen rnam pa du yod pa ni 'grel pa las 'byung ba bzhin du blta'o //🔽bsam gtan de bzhin shes nas ni //
analyzed: bsam gtan la phyen rnam pa du yod pa ni 'grel pa las 'byung ba bzhin du blta'o // bsam gtan de bzhin shes nas ni //
translated: The divisions of the meditative absorptions should be understood as they are described in the commentary.

original: mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed //
translated: The wise one accomplishes it just as it is after knowing the meditative absorption in this way.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin dang rgyu la sogs pa gong du bshad pa bzhin bshad nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin du sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin dang rgyu la sogs pa gong du bshad pa bzhin bshad nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin du sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The nature of the meditative absorptions, their cause, etc. have been explained above. The bodhisattvas accomplish it just as it is.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsam gtan la phye na rnam pa gsum yod pa ston te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsam gtan la phye na rnam pa gsum yod pa ston te /
translated: The meditative absorptions are differentiated as threefold by way of the statement beginning with: together with conceptualization and with discursive investigation, etc.

original: mi lcogs su mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi lcogs su mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: The first and second meditative absorptions are described as the meditative absorption that is together with conceptualization and together with discursive investigation.

original: bar gyi bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: bar gyi bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa ni /
translated: The intermediate dhyana🔽The second dhyana

original: rnam par mi rtog la dpyod pa tsam gyi bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog la dpyod pa tsam gyi bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: The intermediate dhyana and the second dhyana are called the dhyana of non-discursive thought and mere investigation.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bzhi pa ni rnam par mi rtog mi dpyod pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bzhi pa ni rnam par mi rtog mi dpyod pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: The third and fourth dhyanas are called the dhyana of non-discursive thought and non-investigation.

original: yang dga' ba dang lhan cig ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba @21b la ;
analyzed: yang dga' ba dang lhan cig ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba @21b la ;
translated: Again, it is said to be associated with joy,

original: bsam gtan la rnam pa gsum yod pa rnam pa gzhan du 'chad de /
analyzed: bsam gtan la rnam pa gsum yod pa rnam pa gzhan du 'chad de /
translated: The dhyanas are explained in another way as having three aspects.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa ni dga' ba dang lhan cig ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa ni dga' ba dang lhan cig ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The first and second dhyanas are called associated with joy,

original: lus kyi bsam pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi bsam pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is mental joy.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa ni bde ba dang lhan cig ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa ni bde ba dang lhan cig ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The third dhyana is called associated with pleasure,

original: sems kyi bsam pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is mental pleasure.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo man chad ni btang snyoms dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //🔽shes bya yang dag rab 'byung ni //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo man chad ni btang snyoms dang ldan pa zhes bya'o // shes bya yang dag rab 'byung ni //
translated: From the fourth dhyana up to the peak of existence, it is called associated with equanimity.🔽The arising of the correct knowledge of the knowable

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

original: shes bya'i sgras ni bden pa bzhi dang / theg pa gsum dang / rig pa'i gnas la sogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgras ni bden pa bzhi dang / theg pa gsum dang / rig pa'i gnas la sogs pa la bya ste /
translated: The term “knowable” refers to the four noble truths, the three vehicles, the five sciences, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes shing 'byung ba ni shes shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //🔽yang dag pa smos pas ni mu stegs pa 'di las phyi rol du gyur pa rnams bdag dang rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes bya la 'chal bas log pa'i shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par shes shing 'byung ba ni shes shes rab kyi rang bzhin no // yang dag pa smos pas ni mu stegs pa 'di las phyi rol du gyur pa rnams bdag dang rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes bya la 'chal bas log pa'i shes pa'i phyir /
translated: The nature of wisdom is to know without error the specific and general characteristics of those objects.

original: shes rab ma yin pa sel to //🔽mnyam par gzhag la rab gnas pas //
analyzed: shes rab ma yin pa sel to // mnyam par gzhag la rab gnas pas //
translated: The term “reality” excludes the wisdom of non-Buddhists who are outside this teaching, because they have erroneous wisdom due to their error in regard to the knowable, such as the characteristics of a self, permanence, and so on.

original: zhes bya bas rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas rgyu bstan to //
translated: The cause is indicated by the words “well-established in meditative equipoise.”

original: shes rab kyi rgyu ni ting nge 'dzin yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi rgyu ni ting nge 'dzin yin te /
translated: The cause of wisdom is meditative concentration,

original: mdo las kyang sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i shes rab byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las kyang sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i shes rab byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a sutra declares: “When the mind is well-equipoised, the wisdom that knows reality arises.”

original: nyon mongs pa las rnam grol zhing ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las rnam grol zhing ;
translated: “Liberated from the afflictions”

original: ; zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ; zhes bya ba la /

original: nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol bar byed pa ni shes rab kyi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol bar byed pa ni shes rab kyi 'bras bu ste /
translated: The result of wisdom is that it liberates from the afflictions.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyis ni nyon mongs pa 'jig par byed /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyis ni nyon mongs pa 'jig par byed /
translated: Mundane wisdom destroys the afflictions.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi shes rab kyis ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag la nyal ba spong bar byed /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi shes rab kyis ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag la nyal ba spong bar byed /
translated: The wisdom of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, which is supramundane, eliminates the latent level of the obscurations of affliction.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa gang zag dang chos la bdag med par shes pa theg pa chen pa'i shes rab kyis ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag la nyal tshun chod spong bar byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa gang zag dang chos la bdag med par shes pa theg pa chen pa'i shes rab kyis ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag la nyal tshun chod spong bar byed de /
translated: The wisdom of the Mahayana, which is supramundane and the knowledge of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, eliminates the latent levels of the obscurations of affliction and knowledge.

original: de ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: That is the result.

original: shes rab 'tsho ba ston pa ste //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab 'tsho ba ston pa ste // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is the life force and the teacher.

original: shes rab kyis 'tsho bar byed pa dang sems can la chos ston par byed pa gnyis ni las yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis 'tsho bar byed pa dang sems can la chos ston par byed pa gnyis ni las yin te /
translated: The two activities of wisdom are that it is the life force and that it teaches the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten na tshong dang zhing rmod pa la sogs pas lus rnag can gyi srog mi 'chad par 'tsho bar byed mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten na tshong dang zhing rmod pa la sogs pas lus rnag can gyi srog mi 'chad par 'tsho bar byed mod kyi /
translated: In the world, people make a living by not letting the life of their putrid body be interrupted by trade, farming, and so on.

original: de dag las shes rab kyis 'tsho ba ni 'tsho ba bla na med pa ste /🔽bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i dge @22a * //
analyzed: de dag las shes rab kyis 'tsho ba ni 'tsho ba bla na med pa ste / bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i dge @22a * //
translated: But among those, the living by wisdom is the unsurpassed living,

original: ba'i rtsa ba'i srog mi 'chad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i rtsa ba'i srog mi 'chad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not let the life of the root of merit which will awaken to unsurpassed enlightenment be interrupted.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa sems can la chos ston par byed do chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar 'chad pa'i phyir ro //🔽chos rnams kyi ni dam pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa sems can la chos ston par byed do chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar 'chad pa'i phyir ro // chos rnams kyi ni dam pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The one who has wisdom teaches the Dharma to sentient beings, because he explains the general and specific characteristics of the dharmas without error.🔽The best of the dharmas

original: ldan pa ni chos rnams kyi dam pa dang ldan te ;
analyzed: ldan pa ni chos rnams kyi dam pa dang ldan te ;
translated: means that he is endowed with the best of the dharmas.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi dam pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi dam pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The best of all the perfections is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum la sogs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum la sogs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines and so on it says:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi dam pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi dam pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the best of the perfections.

original: gtso bo'o // khyad par can no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gtso bo'o // khyad par can no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the chief, the special.🔽Therein, existence, those three,

original: de la yod dang de gsum dang // zhes bya bas 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la yod dang de gsum dang // zhes bya bas 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: and so on, shows the engagement.

original: de la yod ces bya bas gzhi'i 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la yod ces bya bas gzhi'i 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: Therein, existence shows the engagement of the basis.

original: gong du bshad pa'i shes rab de yang gang zag shes rab can rnams la yod kyi gzhan la med de /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i shes rab de yang gang zag shes rab can rnams la yod kyi gzhan la med de /
translated: That wisdom explained above exists in the wise, but not in others.

original: de bas na gang zag shes rab can ni shes rab kyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: de bas na gang zag shes rab can ni shes rab kyi gzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, the wise are the basis of wisdom.

original: de gsum zhes bya bas rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa bstan te /
analyzed: de gsum zhes bya bas rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa bstan te /
translated: Those three shows the engagement of the classification.

original: shes rab la phye na yang rnam pa gsum du 'jug go //
analyzed: shes rab la phye na yang rnam pa gsum du 'jug go //
translated: Wisdom, when classified, is threefold.

original: gsum po ni 'jig rten pa'i shes rab dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa chung ngu ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi shes rab dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa chen po ste byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab dang / shes rab de bzhin shes nas ni /
analyzed: gsum po ni 'jig rten pa'i shes rab dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa chung ngu ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi shes rab dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa chen po ste byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab dang / shes rab de bzhin shes nas ni /
translated: Having understood wisdom thus,

original: mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed //
translated: the wise accomplish it perfectly.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows:

original: shes rab kyi rang bzhin dang rgyu la sogs pa gong du bshad pa lta bu yin par shes nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin du sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang bzhin dang rgyu la sogs pa gong du bshad pa lta bu yin par shes nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin du sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having understood the nature, cause, etc. of wisdom as explained above, the bodhisattvas accomplish it accordingly.

original: bsdu ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsdu ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the collections

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi dbye ba bshad nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi dbye ba bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the analysis of the six perfections,

original: sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i chos thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang du bsdus par dbye zhing bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gcig rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i chos thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang du bsdus par dbye zhing bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gcig rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to show and classify all dharmas, such as the stages, perfections, factors of enlightenment, and ten virtues, within the six perfections, one verse is composed.

original: dkar po'i chos kun mnyam par ma bzhag dang // mnyam par bzhag dang gnyi gshes par bya //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos kun mnyam par ma bzhag dang // mnyam par bzhag dang gnyi gshes par bya //
translated: All virtuous dharmas are to be known as unfixed, fixed, and both.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i dkar po'i chos kun pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang du 'dus te @22b dkar po'i chos kyang cha gsum du gzhag go //
analyzed: sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i dkar po'i chos kun pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang du 'dus te @22b dkar po'i chos kyang cha gsum du gzhag go //
translated: all virtuous dharmas such as the stages, perfections, factors of enlightenment, and so on, are included within the six perfections. Virtuous dharmas are also posited in three parts.

original: gang zhe na /🔽mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rang bzhin dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i rang bzhin dang / gnyi ga ste /
analyzed: gang zhe na / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rang bzhin dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i rang bzhin dang / gnyi ga ste /
translated: What are they?🔽Unfixed nature, fixed nature, and both.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i rang bzhin yang yin /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i rang bzhin yang yin /
translated: Fixed nature is also both.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rang bzhin yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rang bzhin yang yin pa'o //
translated: and also has the nature of not being in meditative equipoise.

original: gnyis su pha rol tu phyin pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis su pha rol tu phyin pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The perfections are two-fold.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis kyi nang du ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dge ba rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis kyi nang du ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dge ba rnams bsdus te /
translated: The two perfections of giving and morality include virtues that are not in meditative equipoise.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sbyin pa yang lus kyi sgo nas yongs su gtong ba yin pas mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i ngo bo yin pa la tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa yang lus kyi sgo nas yongs su gtong ba yin pas mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i ngo bo yin pa la tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Giving is the relinquishing of one's body and so on, and thus it is by nature not in meditative equipoise. Morality is threefold:

original: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa las /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa las /
translated: the morality of taking up what is right, the vows of individual liberation, the vows of meditative concentration, and the uncontaminated vows.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang srog mi gcod pa la sogs pa lus dang ngag gis bsrung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang srog mi gcod pa la sogs pa lus dang ngag gis bsrung ba yin gyi /
translated: The vows of individual liberation are the protection of one's body and speech from taking life and so on,

original: sems kyis bsrung ba ma yin bas na mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sems kyis bsrung ba ma yin bas na mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: but they are not the protection of one's mind, and thus they are by nature not in meditative equipoise.

original: gnyis gnyis rab tu bsdu bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis rab tu bsdu bar 'gyur //
translated: Two are subsumed in each.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: bsam gtan dang / shes rab gnyis kyis ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i chos rnams bsdu ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / shes rab gnyis kyis ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i chos rnams bsdu ste /
translated: the two of concentration and wisdom subsume the phenomena of meditative equipoise.

original: bsam gtan ni dngos su mnyam par bzhag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas de'i nang du bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa yang bsdu la /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni dngos su mnyam par bzhag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas de'i nang du bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa yang bsdu la /
translated: Concentration is the actual nature of meditative equipoise, so the vows of concentration and uncontaminated vows are subsumed within it.

original: shes rab ji ltar mnyam par bzhag par bsdu zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab ji ltar mnyam par bzhag par bsdu zhe na /
translated: How is wisdom subsumed in meditative equipoise?

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of wisdom:

original: mnyan pa'i shes rab dang / bsam pa'i shes rab dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab gsum las /
analyzed: mnyan pa'i shes rab dang / bsam pa'i shes rab dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab gsum las /
translated: the wisdom of listening, the wisdom of contemplation and the wisdom of meditation.

original: mnyan pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab gnyis ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i nang du bsdu la /
analyzed: mnyan pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab gnyis ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i nang du bsdu la /
translated: The wisdom of listening and the wisdom of contemplation are subsumed within the non equipoise category.

original: bsgom pa'i shes rab ni sems mnyam par bzhag pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom pa'i shes rab 'byung bas na /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i shes rab ni sems mnyam par bzhag pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom pa'i shes rab 'byung bas na /
translated: The wisdom of meditation arises from the mind in meditative equipoise and it is the wisdom that meditates on the nature of reality just as it is.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i nang du bsdus te /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i nang du bsdus te /
translated: Therefore it is subsumed within the category of meditative equipoise.

original: bsam gtan ni zhi gnas kyi rang bzhin yin la shes rab ni lhag mthong gi rang bzhin yin pas mnyam par bzhag par gtogs par rig par bya'o //🔽bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus gnyis ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rang bzhin yang yin la /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni zhi gnas kyi rang bzhin yin la shes rab ni lhag mthong gi rang bzhin yin pas mnyam par bzhag par gtogs par rig par bya'o // bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus gnyis ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rang bzhin yang yin la /
translated: Concentration is the nature of meditative serenity, and wisdom is the nature of insight, so they should be understood as belonging to meditative equipoise.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i rang bzhin yang yin te /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i rang bzhin yang yin te /
translated: Patience and effort are both the nature of meditative equipoise and the nature of non-equipoise.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽byang chub @23a * //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / byang chub @23a * //
translated: How is that?

original: sems dpa' sbyin pa gtong zhing tshul khrims bsrung ba'i dus na yang bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus yod pas /
analyzed: sems dpa' sbyin pa gtong zhing tshul khrims bsrung ba'i dus na yang bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus yod pas /
translated: When the bodhisattva is practicing generosity and guarding morality, he has patience and effort.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag par yang gtogs la /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag par yang gtogs la /
translated: So they belong to non-equipoise.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i dus na yang bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus yod pas na mnyam par bzhag par yang gtogs so //🔽mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i dus na yang bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus yod pas na mnyam par bzhag par yang gtogs so // mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: But when he is cultivating serenity and insight, he has patience and effort, so they belong to meditative equipoise.🔽A verse on the analysis of the resistances.

original: bsdu ba bshad nas /
analyzed: bsdu ba bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the collections, now a verse on the resistances.

original: da ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽tshigs su bcad pa rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: da ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs phye na du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir / tshigs su bcad pa rtsom pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate how many counteragents there are to the six perfections, he composes this chapter.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa re re zhing phye na mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdun bdun yod de /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa re re zhing phye na mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdun bdun yod de /
translated: There are seven counteragents to each perfection, when they are classified.

original: de la longs spyod la chags pa la sogs pa 'grel pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la longs spyod la chags pa la sogs pa 'grel pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: The commentary explains that attachment to enjoyments and so on are the counteragents to generosity.

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong mi phod pa ni longs spyod la chags pa zhes bya ste de med pas na /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong mi phod pa ni longs spyod la chags pa zhes bya ste de med pas na /
translated: The inability to give up external and internal things is called attachment to enjoyments.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni //
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattva

original: ma chags mi chags chags pa med //
analyzed: ma chags mi chags chags pa med //
translated: is without attachment, nonattached, and unattached.

original: ces bya'o ; sbyin pa gtong ba yang slong ba po la 'ongs ma thag tu mi gtong gi /
analyzed: ces bya'o ; sbyin pa gtong ba yang slong ba po la 'ongs ma thag tu mi gtong gi /
translated: Generosity is not given immediately to the petitioner, but

original: di ring ngam sang gtong zhe'am /
analyzed: di ring ngam sang gtong zhe'am /
translated: one thinks, “I will give today or tomorrow, or later.”

original: phyis gtong ngo snyam du sems pa ni bshol ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyis gtong ngo snyam du sems pa ni bshol ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called attachment to delay.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have such a limited attitude, it is said that they are not attached.

original: sbyin pa'i 'di tsam zhig btang bas chog ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'di tsam zhig btang bas chog ste /
translated: It is attachment to limited generosity to think, “I have given this much in alms, so that is enough.

original: phan chad btang mi dgos she'am /
analyzed: phan chad btang mi dgos she'am /
translated: I do not need to give any more.

original: nyam du gnyen bshes dang bran g-yog la sbyin gyi kun la mi sbyin zhe'am /
analyzed: nyam du gnyen bshes dang bran g-yog la sbyin gyi kun la mi sbyin zhe'am /
translated: I give to my relatives and servants, but not to everyone.🔽I give in this region, but not everywhere.

original: phyogs 'dir sbyin gyi phyogs kun tu mi sbyin zhe'am /🔽dus 'di'i tshe na sbyin gyi dus thams cad du mi sbyin no snyam du sems pa ni de tsam gyis chog pa la chags pa zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: phyogs 'dir sbyin gyi phyogs kun tu mi sbyin zhe'am / dus 'di'i tshe na sbyin gyi dus thams cad du mi sbyin no snyam du sems pa ni de tsam gyis chog pa la chags pa zhes bya ste ;
translated: I give at this time, but not all the time.🔽”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can kun la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can kun la /
translated: Bodhisattvas give to all sentient beings

original: phyogs bcu kun tu dus thams cad du gtong ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun tu dus thams cad du gtong ste /
translated: everywhere in the ten directions and at all times.

original: de tsam gyis de chog pa la chags pas na chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis de chog pa la chags pas na chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are not attached to the idea that that is enough, it is said that they are not attached.

original: bdag gis 'di la phyi nang gi dngos po btang ste /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di la phyi nang gi dngos po btang ste /
translated: I have given this person outer and inner things.

original: byin na bdag la slar phan 'dogs so snyam du sems shing byin pa ni lan re ba la chags pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byin na bdag la slar phan 'dogs so snyam du sems shing byin pa ni lan re ba la chags pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Giving with the thought, “If I give, he will benefit me in return,” is called “attachment to reward.”

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na /
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na /
translated: Since a bodhisattva does not have such a thought,

original: chags pa nyid du 'gyur ba'ang med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa nyid du 'gyur ba'ang med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said that he is “without attachment.”

original: sbyin pa 'di btang bas ma 'ongs pa na 'bras bu longs spyod chen po thob par shog shig ces smon pa ni rnam par smin pa la chags pa @23b zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa 'di btang bas ma 'ongs pa na 'bras bu longs spyod chen po thob par shog shig ces smon pa ni rnam par smin pa la chags pa @23b zhes bya ste /
translated: “ Giving with the thought, ‘By giving this gift, may I obtain great wealth in the future,’ is called ‘attachment to evolutionary development.’

original: 'di lta bu'i chags pa med pas na /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i chags pa med pas na /
translated: Since a bodhisattva does not have such attachment,

original: ma chags pa zhes bya'o //🔽mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma chags pa zhes bya'o // mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it is said that he is “without attachment.”

original: ser sna dang chags pa'i bag la nyal ma bcom pa ste /
analyzed: ser sna dang chags pa'i bag la nyal ma bcom pa ste /
translated: “ Attachment to the adverse” is the non-eradication of the latent dispositions to stinginess and attachment.

original: ji srid du bag la nyal ma bcom pa de srid du yo byad la chags pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji srid du bag la nyal ma bcom pa de srid du yo byad la chags pa 'byung ngo //
translated: As long as the latent dispositions are not eradicated, attachment to goods and chattels arises.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ser sna'i bag la nyal bcom pas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ser sna'i bag la nyal bcom pas na /
translated: Since the bodhisattva has eradicated the latent dispositions to stinginess,

original: mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said that he is “without attachment.”

original: de bas na mngon pa'i chos bsdus pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na mngon pa'i chos bsdus pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the treatise that summarizes the Abhidharma also says:

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byas pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnas kyi chos snang bar gyur pa las nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byas pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnas kyi chos snang bar gyur pa las nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: Afflictions arise from not abandoning the latent afflictions, from improper mental activity, and from the appearance of phenomena that are the basis of the afflictions.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i chags pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i chags pa la gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of attachment to distraction:

original: yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba dang / rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba dang / rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba'o //
translated: distraction of mental activity and distraction of conceptualization.

original: de la yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir spyod cing bsngo ba ste /
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir spyod cing bsngo ba ste /
translated: Distraction of mental activity is the practice of generosity and so on in order to attain the hearers’ nirvana, and dedicating it to that end.

original: de ltar bsngos pa sa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar bsngos pa sa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar ltung bar 'gyur ro // rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba ni /
translated: By dedicating in that way, one will fall to the extreme of nirvana.

original: gtong ba po dang / len pa dang / rdzas gsum yod par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gtong ba po dang / len pa dang / rdzas gsum yod par rtog pa ste /
translated: Distraction of conceptualization is the conceptualization that the giver, the recipient, and the substance exist.

original: des ni sbyin pa la sogs pa 'khor bar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni sbyin pa la sogs pa 'khor bar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Generosity and so on would cause one to fall into cyclic existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa byas ba bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bas yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba med pa dang / gtong ba po dang / len pa dang / rdzas gsum yod par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa byas ba bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bas yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba med pa dang / gtong ba po dang / len pa dang / rdzas gsum yod par mi rtog ste /
translated: But the bodhisattva, by dedicating the generosity that he has practiced to unsurpassed enlightenment, is without the distraction of attention, and he does not conceive of the three spheres: the giver, the gift, and the recipient.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul gyis gtong bas rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba med de /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul gyis gtong bas rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba med de /
translated: He gives without the distraction of conceptual thought, by means of the purity of the three spheres.

original: de ltar rnam par g-yeng ba med pa la chags pa med pas na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par g-yeng ba med pa la chags pa med pas na /
translated: Thus, he is without distraction, and because he is without attachment,

original: chags pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he is said to be without attachment.

original: de ltar sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bdun gyi dbang du byas nas 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bdun gyi dbang du byas nas 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Thus, in the noble Aksayamati Sūtra, the seven kinds of resistances to generosity are presented as follows:

original: gzhan yang btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu /
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi mthun pa'i longs spyod yongs su tshol ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi mthun pa'i longs spyod yongs su tshol ba'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: the bodhisattvas do not practice a generosity that seeks to obtain wealth for themselves.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sems can la gnod pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sems can la gnod pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: For the bodhisattvas, there is no giving that harms sentient beings.

original: nga rgyal skyed cing sbyin pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: nga rgyal skyed cing sbyin pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: There is no giving that produces pride.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattvas

original: ma chags mi chags chags pa med //
analyzed: ma chags mi chags chags pa med //
translated: is not attached, not attached, not attached,

original: ces bya ba la sogs @24a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs @24a * //
translated: and so on.

original: pa la ; byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa dang dngos su spyod pa la chags pa ste /
analyzed: pa la ; byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa dang dngos su spyod pa la chags pa ste /
translated: The resistances to the bodhisattvas morality are the attachments to the actual practice of killing, stealing, and so on.

original: kha cig ni 'dod chags kyi sgo nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa byed pa la chags /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'dod chags kyi sgo nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa byed pa la chags /
translated: Some are attached to killing, etc. through desire.

original: kha cig ni zhe sdang gi sgo nas chags /
analyzed: kha cig ni zhe sdang gi sgo nas chags /
translated: Some are attached through hatred.

original: kha cig ni gti mug gi sgo nas chags so //
analyzed: kha cig ni gti mug gi sgo nas chags so //
translated: Some are attached through delusion.

original: de bas na las kyi lam rnam pa bcu rnams ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod de /
analyzed: de bas na las kyi lam rnam pa bcu rnams ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, the ten paths of action are considered to be of three kinds.

original: 'dod chags las skyes pa'i srog gcod pa dang // zhe sdang dang gti mug las skyes pa'i srog gcod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags las skyes pa'i srog gcod pa dang // zhe sdang dang gti mug las skyes pa'i srog gcod pa'o //
translated: killing born of passion, killing born of hatred, and killing born of delusion.

original: de lta bur dngos su spyod pa'i phyogs byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bur dngos su spyod pa'i phyogs byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva does not actually engage in such conduct, he is said to be “nonattached.”

original: tshul khrims yang dag par len pa yang brtun te de ma thag tu mi len gyi sems shing byis len par byed pa ni bshol ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par len pa yang brtun te de ma thag tu mi len gyi sems shing byis len par byed pa ni bshol ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “Attachment to procrastination” means that one does not immediately take up the practice of morality but thinks about it and puts it off.

original: de lta bu mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva does not do this, he is said to be “nonattached.”🔽“Attachment to a limited amount” means that one thinks, “I will observe morality for one day or two days,

original: nyi ma gcig gnyis zhe'am /🔽lo gcig gnyis shig bsrung zhe'am /
analyzed: nyi ma gcig gnyis zhe'am / lo gcig gnyis shig bsrung zhe'am /
translated: or for one year or two years,

original: sems can 'di dag gi srog mi gcad /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gi srog mi gcad /
translated: but I will not spare the lives of these sentient beings,

original: longs spyod la ma byin par mi blang gi / de las ma gtogs pa gzhan dag gi srog la gnod pa bya zhing /
analyzed: longs spyod la ma byin par mi blang gi / de las ma gtogs pa gzhan dag gi srog la gnod pa bya zhing /
translated: or I will not take what is not given to me, but I will harm others and take what is not given to them.”🔽Since the bodhisattva does not do this, he is said to be “nonattached.”

original: longs spyod la ma byin par len to zhes sems pa ni de tsam gyis chog pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: longs spyod la ma byin par len to zhes sems pa ni de tsam gyis chog pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “Attachment to a limited amount” means that one thinks, “I will observe morality for one day or two days,🔽or for one year or two years,🔽but I will not spare the lives of these sentient beings,🔽or I will not take what is not given to me, but I will harm others and take what is not given to them.”

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have such a thing, it is called “nonattachment.”

original: sems can 'di dag gi srog ma bcad cing /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gi srog ma bcad cing /
translated: “ If I do not take the lives of these sentient beings,🔽and if I do not take their wealth without giving anything in return, they will benefit me.”

original: nor la ma byin par ma blangs na bdag la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing tshul khrims bsrung pa ni lan re ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nor la ma byin par ma blangs na bdag la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing tshul khrims bsrung pa ni lan re ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: To guard morality with such a thought is called “attachment to reward.”

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa nyid du 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa nyid du 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have such a thing, it is called “nonattachment.”🔽“ If I guard morality, I will be reborn among gods and humans.”

original: tshul khrims bsrungs na lha dang mi'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems nas tshul khrims srung bar byed pa ni rnam par smin pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrungs na lha dang mi'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems nas tshul khrims srung bar byed pa ni rnam par smin pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: To guard morality with such a thought is called “attachment to ripening.”

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have such a thing, it is called “nonattachment.”

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The latent states of the mental afflictions such as desire, hatred, and ignorance that have not been abandoned are called “attachment to adverse factors.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ngang tshul ngan pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu bag la nyal kun bcom ste med par byed pas na mi chags @24b pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ngang tshul ngan pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu bag la nyal kun bcom ste med par byed pas na mi chags @24b pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because a bodhisattva has destroyed and eliminated all the latent states that are the causes for the development of an evil moral character, he or she is called “one who is free of attachment.”

original: tshul khrims yang dag par bsrungs pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg par mi bsngo bas yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba med pa dang / gang zag dang / tshul khrims dang / bsrung bas gsum du mi rtog pas rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba med de /
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par bsrungs pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg par mi bsngo bas yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba med pa dang / gang zag dang / tshul khrims dang / bsrung bas gsum du mi rtog pas rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba med de /
translated: Because he or she does not dedicate the morality that has been perfectly practiced to the vehicles of the śrāvakas, etc., there is no distraction of attention. And because he or she does not conceive of the three—that is, the person, the morality, and the protection—there is no distraction of conceptual thought.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba la chags pa med pas na chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba la chags pa med pas na chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because he or she is free of attachment to the distractions of conceptual thought, he or she is called “one who is free of attachment.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Regarding the passage that begins “The patience of a bodhisattva” and so on,

original: bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni zhe sdang gis dngos su sems can la gnod pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni zhe sdang gis dngos su sems can la gnod pa byed pa ste /
translated: The opposite of patience is anger, which directly harms sentient beings.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas have no such anger, they are said to be unattached.

original: sems can 'ga' zhig la zhe sdang langs na de ma thag tu zhe sdang gi sems spong bar mi byed kyi bsams shing brtags nas phyis gnod pa bzod par byed pa ni bshol ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can 'ga' zhig la zhe sdang langs na de ma thag tu zhe sdang gi sems spong bar mi byed kyi bsams shing brtags nas phyis gnod pa bzod par byed pa ni bshol ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If they feel anger toward some sentient beings, they do not immediately get rid of the thought of anger, but they put it aside and later, after reflection and analysis, they patiently accept the harm.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not do this, they are said to be unattached.

original: bzod pa cung zad tsam byas pas chog go snyam du sems pa'am //🔽bdag gis bshes pa'am /
analyzed: bzod pa cung zad tsam byas pas chog go snyam du sems pa'am // bdag gis bshes pa'am /
translated: Thinking that a little patience is enough,🔽or thinking that one should be patient with friends

original: mdza' ba rnams la ni bzod par bya'i gzhan la mi bya'o snyam du sems pa'am //
analyzed: mdza' ba rnams la ni bzod par bya'i gzhan la mi bya'o snyam du sems pa'am //
translated: and loved ones but not with others,

original: phyogs 'di dang dus 'dir bzod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'di dang dus 'dir bzod par bya'o //
translated: or thinking that one should be patient in this place or at this time,🔽but not in other places or times,

original: phyogs kun dang / dus kun tu bzod par mi bya'o snyam du sems pa ni de tsam gyis chog pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs kun dang / dus kun tu bzod par mi bya'o snyam du sems pa ni de tsam gyis chog pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The thought I will not be patient with everyone and at all times is called attachment to a limited scope.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have such a thought, they are said to be without attachment.

original: sems can 'di dag gis bdag la gnod pa byas pa rnams bdag gis bzod par byas na 'di dag bdag la phan 'dogs par byed do snyam du bsams nas bzod par byed pa ni lan re ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis bdag la gnod pa byas pa rnams bdag gis bzod par byas na 'di dag bdag la phan 'dogs par byed do snyam du bsams nas bzod par byed pa ni lan re ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one thinks, If I am patient with those who harm me, they will be helpful to me, and one is patient, this is called attachment to a reward.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa nyid du 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya'o //🔽bzod pa bsgoms na ma 'ongs pa na g-yog 'khor mang po dang / byad gzugs bzang bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems nas bzod pa bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa nyid du 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya'o // bzod pa bsgoms na ma 'ongs pa na g-yog 'khor mang po dang / byad gzugs bzang bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems nas bzod pa bsgom pa ste /
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have such a thought, they are said to be without attachment.

original: rnam par smin pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one thinks, If I cultivate patience, in the future I will have many attendants and followers and I will have a beautiful body, and one cultivates patience, this is called attachment to a ripening result.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva does not have such a thing, it is called “non-attachment.”

original: bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhe sdang gi bag la nyal ma spangs pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa zhes bya ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' zhe sdang gi bag la nyal spangs pas na mi @25a * //
analyzed: bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhe sdang gi bag la nyal ma spangs pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa zhes bya ste / byang chub sems dpa' zhe sdang gi bag la nyal spangs pas na mi @25a * //
translated: “Attachment to the counteragent” means that the latent tendency to hatred, which is the counteragent to patience, has not been eliminated.

original: chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva has eliminated the latent tendency to hatred, it is called “non-attachment.”

original: bzod pa bsgoms pa yang theg pa chung ngur mi bsngo bas /
analyzed: bzod pa bsgoms pa yang theg pa chung ngur mi bsngo bas /
translated: Also, the cultivation of patience is not dedicated to the Lesser Vehicle.

original: yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba med pa dang / gang zag dang / bzod pa dang / bsgom pa gsum mi dmigs pas rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ni chags pa med ces bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba med pa dang / gang zag dang / bzod pa dang / bsgom pa gsum mi dmigs pas rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ni chags pa med ces bya'o //
translated: Since there is no distraction of mental activity and no distraction of conceptualization, due to the non-apprehension of the three—the person, patience, and cultivation—it is called “non-attachment.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Regarding “the bodhisattva’s effort,” and so on,

original: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni /
translated: the counteragent to effort is

original: nyal ba dang 'phres pa la sogs pa'i bde ba la chags shing le lo byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi las bya ba mang po la zhugs shing de ba la mi 'jug pa'i le lo la chags pa ste /
analyzed: nyal ba dang 'phres pa la sogs pa'i bde ba la chags shing le lo byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi las bya ba mang po la zhugs shing de ba la mi 'jug pa'i le lo la chags pa ste /
translated: They are attached to the pleasures of sleeping, lying around, and so on, and are lazy; and they are attached to laziness, being engaged in many worldly activities and not being engaged in virtue.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have such laziness, they are said to be free of attachment.

original: bsdad bsdad nas dge ba la 'jug gi / dge ba'i phyogs la myur du mi 'jug pa ni bshol ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsdad bsdad nas dge ba la 'jug gi / dge ba'i phyogs la myur du mi 'jug pa ni bshol ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They are attached to procrastination, in that they put off engaging in virtue and do not do so promptly.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have such procrastination, they are said to be free of attachment.

original: brtson 'grus cung zad tsam zhig brtsams pas chog ce'am /
analyzed: brtson 'grus cung zad tsam zhig brtsams pas chog ce'am /
translated: They are attached to a small amount of effort, thinking that a little effort is enough.

original: bshes dang grogs rnams kyi las ni bya'i gzan gyi ni mi bya zhe'am /
analyzed: bshes dang grogs rnams kyi las ni bya'i gzan gyi ni mi bya zhe'am /
translated: Or they are attached to the activities of friends and companions, thinking that they should do those, but not the activities of virtue.

original: dus dang phyogs 'dir ni brtson 'grus rtsom gyi /
analyzed: dus dang phyogs 'dir ni brtson 'grus rtsom gyi /
translated: Or they are attached to the idea that they should make an effort at a certain time and place, but not at other times and places.

original: dus dang phyogs ni gzhan du mi rtsom mo snyam du sems pa ni de tsam gyis chog pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dus dang phyogs ni gzhan du mi rtsom mo snyam du sems pa ni de tsam gyis chog pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The idea that time and place do not initiate anything else is called attachment to mere sufficiency.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have such ideas, they are said to be without attachment.

original: sems can 'di dag gi las su bya ba'i grogs byas na bdag la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas grogs byed pa ni lan re ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gi las su bya ba'i grogs byas na bdag la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas grogs byed pa ni lan re ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The idea that if one helps these sentient beings with their work, they will help one in return is called attachment to return.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa nyid du gyur pa'ang med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa nyid du gyur pa'ang med ces bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have such ideas, they are said to be without attachment.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams na ma 'ongs par las kyi mtha' thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas de'i tshe brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni rnam par smin pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams na ma 'ongs par las kyi mtha' thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas de'i tshe brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni rnam par smin pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The idea that if one initiates effort, in the future all work will be accomplished is called attachment to fruition.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have such ideas, they are said to be without attachment.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni le lo ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni le lo ste /
translated: The resistance to effort is laziness.

original: lo lo'i bag la nyal ma spangs kyi bar du mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: lo lo'i bag la nyal ma spangs kyi bar du mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma spangs pa'o //
translated: As long as the latent dispositions of laziness are not abandoned, the resistance is not abandoned.

original: byang chub sems dpa' le lo'i bag la nyal bcom pas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' le lo'i bag la nyal bcom pas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has destroyed the latent dispositions of laziness is called “unattached.”🔽He also avoids the distraction of attention by not dedicating the effort he has begun to the vehicles of the śrāvakas, etc.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa yang nyan @25b thos la sogs pa'i theg par mi bsngo bas yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba spangs pa dang / gang zag dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsgrub pa gsum di mi rtog pas rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba spangs te chad pas na chags pa min pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa yang nyan @25b thos la sogs pa'i theg par mi bsngo bas yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba spangs pa dang / gang zag dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsgrub pa gsum di mi rtog pas rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba spangs te chad pas na chags pa min pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He avoids the distraction of conceptualization by not conceptualizing the three: the person, the effort, and the practice.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva’s meditative absorption, etc.

original: bsam gtan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni sems g-yeng ba la chags pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni sems g-yeng ba la chags pa ste /
translated: The resistance to meditative absorption is attachment to distraction.

original: ji srid du sems phyi rol du g-yeng bar 'gyur ba de srid du sems rtse gcig pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji srid du sems phyi rol du g-yeng bar 'gyur ba de srid du sems rtse gcig pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: As long as the mind is distracted externally, it does not become one-pointed.

original: de byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have that, it is called nonattachment.

original: bsam gtan bsgom pa la myur du brtun te mi 'jug gi / phyis 'jug par byed pa ni bshol ba dang chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bsgom pa la myur du brtun te mi 'jug gi / phyis 'jug par byed pa ni bshol ba dang chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Not quickly engaging in the cultivation of concentration, but engaging in it later, is called procrastination and attachment.

original: de byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have that, it is called nonattachment.

original: bsam gtan chung zhes byas pa chog par 'dzin pa'am /🔽sems can kha cig gi don du bsam gtan byed pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan chung zhes byas pa chog par 'dzin pa'am / sems can kha cig gi don du bsam gtan byed pa'am /
translated: Being satisfied with a small amount of concentration is called attachment to that much.🔽Cultivating concentration for the sake of some sentient beings, but not for the sake of others,

original: kha cig gi don du mi byed pa'am /🔽dus dang phyogs kha cig tu bsgom gyi /
analyzed: kha cig gi don du mi byed pa'am / dus dang phyogs kha cig tu bsgom gyi /
translated: or🔽cultivating it in some places and times, but not in all places and times,

original: dus dang phyogs thams cad du mi bsgom pa ni de tsam gyis chog pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dus dang phyogs thams cad du mi bsgom pa ni de tsam gyis chog pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called attachment to that much.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi mnga' bas na chags pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi mnga' bas na chags pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not have that, it is called nonattachment.

original: sems can 'di dag gi don byed pa'i bsam gtan bsgoms nas bdag la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro snyam nas bsam gtan bsgom na ni lan la re ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gi don byed pa'i bsam gtan bsgoms nas bdag la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro snyam nas bsam gtan bsgom na ni lan la re ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If one cultivates the meditative concentration of benefitting sentient beings, thinking, I will benefit myself, it is called attachment to hope for a reward.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa nyid du gyur pa'ang med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa nyid du gyur pa'ang med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva does not have such a thing, it is said that he has no attachment at all.

original: bsam gtan bsgoms na lus la nad med pa la sogs pa dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bsgoms na lus la nad med pa la sogs pa dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one cultivates meditative concentration, one will have a healthy body, etc., and will be reborn among the gods of the form realm.

original: de'i bsgom pa ni rnam par smin pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i bsgom pa ni rnam par smin pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That cultivation is called attachment to the maturation of the effect.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva does not have such a thing, it is said that he has no attachment.

original: bsam gtan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sems g-yeng ba'i bag la nyal ma spang pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sems g-yeng ba'i bag la nyal ma spang pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The non-abandonment of the latent tendency to distraction, which is the counteragent to meditative concentration, is called attachment to counteragents.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva does not have such a thing, it is called “non-attachment.”

original: bsam gtan bsgom pa yang nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das par mi @26a * //🔽bsngo bas yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba med pa dang / gang zag dang / bsam gtan dang / bsgom pa gsum mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bsgom pa yang nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das par mi @26a * // bsngo bas yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba med pa dang / gang zag dang / bsam gtan dang / bsgom pa gsum mi dmigs pas /
translated: Also, the cultivation of meditative concentration is not dedicated to the nirvāṇa of the śrāvakas and so on.🔽Since there is no distraction of mental activity, and since there is no distraction of conceptual thought, because of the non-apprehension of the three—the person, meditative concentration, and cultivation—
