original: rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba med de de'i phyir chags pa min pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba med de de'i phyir chags pa min pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called “non-attachment.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for “the bodhisattva’s wisdom,” and so on,

original: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs par rtog pa'i lta ba la chags shing dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir brtson par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs par rtog pa'i lta ba la chags shing dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir brtson par mi byed pa ste /
translated: the counteragent to wisdom is attachment to views that conceive of permanence, annihilation, and so on, and not striving to serve the spiritual friend.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva does not have such a thing, it is called “non-attachment.”

original: de bas na mdo dag la /
analyzed: de bas na mdo dag la /
translated: Therefore, in the sūtras,

original: klog go // 'dri'o //
analyzed: klog go // 'dri'o //
translated: they read and copy.

original: rtog go // gzhan la 'dri'o //
analyzed: rtog go // gzhan la 'dri'o //
translated: He thinks, he asks others,

original: thos pa'i rnam par 'dzin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: thos pa'i rnam par 'dzin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he retains what he has heard.

original: mnyan pa dang bsams pa la sogs pa la myur du mi 'jug gi //
analyzed: mnyan pa dang bsams pa la sogs pa la myur du mi 'jug gi //
translated: He does not immediately apply himself to listening, reflecting, etc.

original: bshol te 'jug pa ni ba shol ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bshol te 'jug pa ni ba shol ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He puts it off and then applies himself. This is called attachment to postponement.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva does not have such, he is said to be without attachment.

original: shes rab cung zad tsam bsgrubs pas chog go snyam pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab cung zad tsam bsgrubs pas chog go snyam pa'am /
translated: He thinks that it is enough to accomplish a little wisdom,

original: chos kha cig shes kha cig mi shes kyang rung ste chog go snyam pa la /
analyzed: chos kha cig shes kha cig mi shes kyang rung ste chog go snyam pa la /
translated: or that it is enough to know some things and not know others.

original: yul dang phyogs kha cig tu shes rab bsgrub kyi yul dang phyogs kun tu bsgrub mi dgos so snyam du sems pa ni de tsam gyis chog pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yul dang phyogs kha cig tu shes rab bsgrub kyi yul dang phyogs kun tu bsgrub mi dgos so snyam du sems pa ni de tsam gyis chog pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He thinks that wisdom should be accomplished in some places and not in all places. This is called attachment to just that much.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva does not have such, he is said to be without attachment.

original: bdag gis chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gzhan la bshad na gzhan gyis bdag la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni lan re ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gis chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gzhan la bshad na gzhan gyis bdag la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni lan re ba la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If I explain the general and specific characteristics of phenomena to others, others will benefit me.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa nyid du 'gyur ba'ang med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na chags pa nyid du 'gyur ba'ang med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not think in this way, they are said to be without attachment.

original: bdag gis shes rab bsgrubs pas ma 'ongs pa na bdag rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas par 'gyur snyam du bsams nas shes rab bsgrub pa ni /
analyzed: bdag gis shes rab bsgrubs pas ma 'ongs pa na bdag rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas par 'gyur snyam du bsams nas shes rab bsgrub pa ni /
translated: The pursuit of wisdom with the thought In the future, I will become learned in the five sciences

original: rnam par smin pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is attachment to the maturation of that wisdom.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since bodhisattvas do not think in this way, they are said to be without attachment.

original: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtag chad du rtogs pa'i 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi bag la nyal ma spangs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtag chad du rtogs pa'i 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi bag la nyal ma spangs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The non-abandonment of the latent dispositions of the erroneous understanding of eternalism and nihilism, which are the counteragents of wisdom, is called attachment to counteragents.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes @26b bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems dpa' la mi mnga' bas na mi chags pa zhes @26b bya'o //
translated: Since the bodhisattva does not have such a thing, he is called “nonattached.”

original: shes rab bsgrubs kyang nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa dman par mi bsngo bas na yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba med pa dang / gang zag dang / shes rab dang / sgrub pa gsum du mi rtog pas rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir chags pa min pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab bsgrubs kyang nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa dman par mi bsngo bas na yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba med pa dang / gang zag dang / shes rab dang / sgrub pa gsum du mi rtog pas rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir chags pa min pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “nonattached” because he is without the distraction of mental activity and without the distraction of conceptual thought. He is without the distraction of mental activity because, although he has accomplished wisdom, he does not dedicate it to the inferior vehicle of the disciples and so on. He is without the distraction of conceptual thought because he does not think in terms of the three—person, wisdom, and accomplishment.

original: yon tan rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Twenty-three verses on the analysis of the excellences.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the resistances to the six perfections,

original: da ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan gang yin pa dang / yon tan la phye na rnam pa du yod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan gang yin pa dang / yon tan la phye na rnam pa du yod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: now, in order to teach the excellences of the six perfections and the types of excellence that are distinguished, there are twenty-three verses.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa re re zhing yang phye na yon tan rnam pa bzhi bzhi yod de /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa re re zhing yang phye na yon tan rnam pa bzhi bzhi yod de /
translated: If each of the perfections is analyzed, it has four qualities.

original: bzhi po ni rgya che ba dang zang zing med pa dang / don che ba dang / mi zad pa'o //🔽sangs rgyas sras rnams srog la mi lta snying rjes slod la rnam par gtong //
analyzed: bzhi po ni rgya che ba dang zang zing med pa dang / don che ba dang / mi zad pa'o // sangs rgyas sras rnams srog la mi lta snying rjes slod la rnam par gtong //
translated: The four are vast, disinterested, fruitful, and inexhaustible.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The buddhas' spiritual heir, indifferent to life, gives with compassion.

original: snying rje zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rkang pa dang po las byung mod kyi tshigs su bcad pa'i rkang pa gnyis pa gzhan la lan mi re zhes 'byung ba'i skabs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: snying rje zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rkang pa dang po las byung mod kyi tshigs su bcad pa'i rkang pa gnyis pa gzhan la lan mi re zhes 'byung ba'i skabs su sbyar ro //
translated: The first line of this verse is already explained, but the second line is applied in the context of the verse, Do not hope for reward.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: The buddhas' spiritual heir is the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams gal te don du gnyer ba'i sems can slong ba yod na lus dang srog la yang mi lta bar gtong bar byed na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams gal te don du gnyer ba'i sems can slong ba yod na lus dang srog la yang mi lta bar gtong bar byed na /
translated: If there are beings who need something and ask the bodhisattvas for it, they give it, not even caring about their bodies and lives.

original: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po lta ci zhig smos te gtong zhes bya'o //🔽de ltar gtong ba de'ang nyin 'ga' gtong /
analyzed: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po lta ci zhig smos te gtong zhes bya'o // de ltar gtong ba de'ang nyin 'ga' gtong /
translated: What need to mention external things, such as food and clothing?

original: nyin 'ga' mi gtong /🔽lo 'ga' gtong /🔽lo 'ga' mi gtong /
analyzed: nyin 'ga' mi gtong / lo 'ga' gtong / lo 'ga' mi gtong /
translated: This giving is not something that is practiced for a few days,🔽or a few months,🔽or a few years,

original: skad cig ma gcig la gtong /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la gtong /
translated: or a few lifetimes.

original: skad cig ma gcig la mi gtong ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la mi gtong ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not something that is practiced for a moment,🔽and not practiced the next moment.🔽It is practiced continuously for as long as cyclic existence lasts, and for as long as space endures.

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' dang / nam mkha'i mtha' ji tsam du ji srid kyi bar du rgyun du gtong bar byed pas rtag par gtong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' dang / nam mkha'i mtha' ji tsam du ji srid kyi bar du rgyun du gtong bar byed pas rtag par gtong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, it is called “constant giving.”🔽In this way, both external and internal things are given, and all of them are given.

original: de lta bur phyi dang nang gi dngos po gnyi ga gtong la thams cad bas na tshig rkang dang po 'dis ni rgya che ba bstan te //🔽gzhan la lan mi re zhing 'bras bu don du gnyer pa med //
analyzed: de lta bur phyi dang nang gi dngos po gnyi ga gtong la thams cad bas na tshig rkang dang po 'dis ni rgya che ba bstan te // gzhan la lan mi re zhing 'bras bu don du gnyer pa med //
translated: The first line of the verse shows that this giving is vast.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: It is not given in order to receive something in return, nor is it given for the sake of a result.

original: bdag gis phyi dang nang gi dngos po btang bas bdag la sems can rnams phyis phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhes len re ba'i phyir sbyin pa med kyang /
analyzed: bdag gis phyi dang nang gi dngos po btang bas bdag la sems can rnams phyis phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhes len re ba'i phyir sbyin pa med kyang /
translated: Since I have given away outer and inner things, sentient beings will later benefit me.

original: sems can brel phongs pa rnams la snying rje ba'i dbang gis gtong ba dang / sbyin pa byas pa'i 'bras bus longs spyod chen @27a * //
analyzed: sems can brel phongs pa rnams la snying rje ba'i dbang gis gtong ba dang / sbyin pa byas pa'i 'bras bus longs spyod chen @27a * //
translated: Thus, although there is no expectation of return, out of the power of compassion for sentient beings who are in need, one gives without any thought of reward, thinking,

original: por 'gyur ro zhes sbyin pa byed pa med /
analyzed: por 'gyur ro zhes sbyin pa byed pa med /
translated: “By the result of giving, I will have great wealth.”🔽Since one does not strive for a result, one has no hope of return in this life, and one is not attached to the evolutionary development in another life.

original: 'bras bu don du gnyer ba med pas na tshe 'dir lan la re ba med pa dang / cha rabs gzhan du rnam par smin pa la chags pa med pa'i phyir tshigs bcad gnyis pas ni zang zing med par bstan pa'o //🔽sbyin pa des kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
analyzed: 'bras bu don du gnyer ba med pas na tshe 'dir lan la re ba med pa dang / cha rabs gzhan du rnam par smin pa la chags pa med pa'i phyir tshigs bcad gnyis pas ni zang zing med par bstan pa'o // sbyin pa des kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
translated: The second verse shows that giving is disinterested.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: And by that giving, he establishes all beings in the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: de ltar phyi dang nang gi sbyin pas sems can rnams bsdus nas 'jig rten gyi longs spyod kyi 'bras bu la bkod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar phyi dang nang gi sbyin pas sems can rnams bsdus nas 'jig rten gyi longs spyod kyi 'bras bu la bkod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, having attracted sentient beings by means of external and internal generosity, he does not establish them in the result of worldly enjoyment.

original: skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du nyan thos kyi byang chub dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang / byang chub chen po la bkod de /
analyzed: skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du nyan thos kyi byang chub dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang / byang chub chen po la bkod de /
translated: Rather, he establishes them in the enlightenment of the sravakas, the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddhas, and the great enlightenment, in accordance with their lot.

original: tshig rkang pa gsum pa 'dis ni don che bar bstan to //
analyzed: tshig rkang pa gsum pa 'dis ni don che bar bstan to //
translated: This third line shows its great import.

original: shes pas bzung ba'i sbyin pas 'jig rten mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: shes pas bzung ba'i sbyin pas 'jig rten mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba la /
translated: Generosity held by knowledge establishes the world in inexhaustible enjoyments.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sbyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ma zin pas /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sbyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ma zin pas /
translated: The generosity of ordinary beings is not held by nonconceptual knowledge.

original: gtong ba po dang / len pa dang / rdzas gsum yod par rtog cing longs spyod thob par bya ba'i phyir gtong ste /
analyzed: gtong ba po dang / len pa dang / rdzas gsum yod par rtog cing longs spyod thob par bya ba'i phyir gtong ste /
translated: They give in order to obtain enjoyments, conceiving of the three: the giver, the recipient, and the substance.

original: sbyin pa de 'khor bar ltung bas rnam par smin pa'i longs spyod zad na sbyin pa yang zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin pa de 'khor bar ltung bas rnam par smin pa'i longs spyod zad na sbyin pa yang zad par 'gyur te /
translated: That generosity is exhausted when the enjoyments resulting from it are exhausted, because it causes one to fall into cyclic existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni 'khor bar mi ltung bas na mi zad pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni 'khor bar mi ltung bas na mi zad pa yin te /
translated: The generosity of bodhisattvas is inexhaustible because they do not fall into samsara.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Thus the Akṣayamatisūtra says,

original: sbyin pa de ni yang dag par zin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa de ni yang dag par zin te /
translated: That generosity is fully appropriated.

original: de'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is inexhaustible.

original: sbyin pa de ni khams gsum pa dang yang dag par ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa de ni khams gsum pa dang yang dag par ma 'dres pa ste /
translated: That generosity is not mixed with the three realms.

original: de'i phyir mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is inexhaustible.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam du khong du chud la snying rje chen po spangs pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam du khong du chud la snying rje chen po spangs pas /
translated: Noble śrāvakas understand just the selflessness of persons, but they abandon great compassion.

original: phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zhugs pa na zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zhugs pa na zad par 'gyur te /
translated: When they enter the expanse of nirvana without residual aggregates, they are exhausted.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig gi phyogs gcig tu lhung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig gi phyogs gcig tu lhung ba yin gyi /
translated: They fall to one extreme, that of mere nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud cing /
translated: Bodhisattvas understand the selflessness of persons and of phenomena.

original: snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pas 'khor ba'i mtha' dang sems can gyi mtha' ji srid du rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pas 'khor ba'i mtha' dang sems can gyi mtha' ji srid du rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ste /
translated: It arises uninterruptedly for as long as the limits of cyclic existence and the limits of sentient beings last, because it is fully embraced by great compassion.

original: de bas na tshig rkang pa bzhi pas mi zad pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na tshig rkang pa bzhi pas mi zad pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the fourth line teaches inexhaustibility.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Thus, the noble Aksayamatinirdesa states:

original: sbyin pa de ni gtong pa nyid kyi rnam pas bsgrubs te /
analyzed: sbyin pa de ni gtong pa nyid kyi rnam pas bsgrubs te /
translated: “That generosity is accomplished by the aspect of giving.

original: de'i phyir mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @27b so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @27b so ;
translated: Therefore, it is inexhaustible.”

original: / sangs rgyas sras rnams sdom dang brtson pa'i tshul khrims gsum rtag 'dzin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / sangs rgyas sras rnams sdom dang brtson pa'i tshul khrims gsum rtag 'dzin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The buddhas’ spiritual heir always maintains the three moralities:🔽the morality of restraint, the morality of accumulating virtuous natures, and the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab tshig rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab tshig rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The bodhisattva’s training has three aspects:

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of restraint, the morality of accumulating virtuous natures, and the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de la sdom pa zhes bya bas sdom pa'i tshul khrims bstan /
analyzed: de la sdom pa zhes bya bas sdom pa'i tshul khrims bstan /
translated: The word “restraint” in the first of these indicates the morality of restraint.

original: brtson zhes bya ba'i sgras dge ba chos sdud pa dang sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims bstan to //
analyzed: brtson zhes bya ba'i sgras dge ba chos sdud pa dang sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims bstan to //
translated: The word “striving” teaches the morality of gathering virtue and acting for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de la nyan thos rnams ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims len par zad kyi don byed pa'i sems can gyi don byed pa dang / dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims mi len mi srung zhing /
analyzed: de la nyan thos rnams ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims len par zad kyi don byed pa'i sems can gyi don byed pa dang / dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims mi len mi srung zhing /
translated: The listeners only take up the morality of restraint, but they do not take up and observe the morality of acting for the welfare of sentient beings and gathering virtue.

original: de yang tshe gsum du bsrung bar zad kyi /
analyzed: de yang tshe gsum du bsrung bar zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, they observe it for only three lifetimes.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni tshul khrims rnam pa gsum 'dzin cing bsrung la de'ang byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du srung bar byed de tshig 'dis ni rgya che ba bstan to //🔽mtho ris mi 'dod yang dag blangs kyang de la chags mi byed //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni tshul khrims rnam pa gsum 'dzin cing bsrung la de'ang byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du srung bar byed de tshig 'dis ni rgya che ba bstan to // mtho ris mi 'dod yang dag blangs kyang de la chags mi byed //
translated: But the bodhisattvas observe and keep all three forms of morality and they keep them until they are seated in the bodhimaṇḍa. This verse shows their vastness.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: They do not desire the higher realms, but if they are born there, they are not attached.

original: tshul khrims bsrung ba 'dis lha dang mi'i gnas mtho ris thob par shog shig ces mtho ris 'dod pa'i tshul khrims srung bar byed pa ma yin pa dang / tshul khrims bsrungs pa'i 'bras bu mtho ris su skyes shing /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung ba 'dis lha dang mi'i gnas mtho ris thob par shog shig ces mtho ris 'dod pa'i tshul khrims srung bar byed pa ma yin pa dang / tshul khrims bsrungs pa'i 'bras bu mtho ris su skyes shing /
translated: They do not observe morality with the wish for high status, thinking, May this morality obtain for me the high status of gods and humans.🔽And even though they are reborn in high status as a result of observing morality, they are not attached to or cling to the pleasures of high status.

original: mtho ris kyi gnas blangs kyang mtho ris kyi gnas kyi bde ba la chags shing zhen pa med de rkang pa gnyis pa 'dis ni zang zing med pa bstan to //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi gnas blangs kyang mtho ris kyi gnas kyi bde ba la chags shing zhen pa med de rkang pa gnyis pa 'dis ni zang zing med pa bstan to //
translated: This second line shows that they are without material desires.

original: tshul khrims des kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims des kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod // ces bya ba la /
translated: And they establish all beings in the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: gong du bshad pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyis skye ba rnam pa bzhir skyes pa'i sems can rnams bsdus nas theg pa gsum gyi byang chub gsum la bkod de rkang pa gsum pa 'dis ni don che ba bstan to //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyis skye ba rnam pa bzhir skyes pa'i sems can rnams bsdus nas theg pa gsum gyi byang chub gsum la bkod de rkang pa gsum pa 'dis ni don che ba bstan to //
translated: This third line shows that morality has great value, because by means of the three kinds of morality explained above, they gather to themselves all beings who are born in the four ways of birth and establish them in the three kinds of enlightenment of the three vehicles.

original: shes pas bsrung ba'i tshul khrims kyis ni 'jig rten mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: shes pas bsrung ba'i tshul khrims kyis ni 'jig rten mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba la /
translated: By the morality guarded by knowledge, the world is established as inexhaustible.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi tshul khrims ni gang zag dang / tshul khrims dang / bsrung ba gsum du dmigs te ;
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi tshul khrims ni gang zag dang / tshul khrims dang / bsrung ba gsum du dmigs te ;
translated: The morality of the worldly is observed in three spheres: the person, the morality, and the protection.

original: 'khor bar lhung ba yin pas rnam par smin pa zad nas tshul khrims zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor bar lhung ba yin pas rnam par smin pa zad nas tshul khrims zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it falls into cyclic existence, when the evolutionary development is exhausted, the morality is exhausted.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni 'khor gsum mi dmigs par shes te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni 'khor gsum mi dmigs par shes te /
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva is known without observing the three spheres.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zin pas na mi zad par 'gyur te /🔽de'i phyir 'phags pa blo gros mi zad @28a * //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zin pas na mi zad par 'gyur te / de'i phyir 'phags pa blo gros mi zad @28a * //
translated: Since it is taken hold of by non-discriminative knowledge, it becomes inexhaustible.

original: pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa it is said,

original: gang 'dod pa'i khams la mi brten pa dang / gzugs kyi khams la mi gnas pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na mi 'dug pa de ni tshul khrims so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i khams la mi brten pa dang / gzugs kyi khams la mi gnas pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na mi 'dug pa de ni tshul khrims so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “That which does not rely on the desire realm, does not abide in the form realm, and does not remain in the formless realm, that is morality.”

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi tshul khrims ni snying rje chen po dang bral bas mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig ni mthar lhung ba'i phyir phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zhugs pa dang zad par 'gyur gyi🔽/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni thugs rje chen pos yongs su zin pas phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das par zhugs kyang dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor ba dang nam mkha'i mtha' ji srid kyi bar du tshul khrims kyi
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi tshul khrims ni snying rje chen po dang bral bas mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig ni mthar lhung ba'i phyir phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zhugs pa dang zad par 'gyur gyi / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni thugs rje chen pos yongs su zin pas phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das par zhugs kyang dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor ba dang nam mkha'i mtha' ji srid kyi bar du tshul khrims kyi
translated: The morality of the noble śrāvakas, being devoid of great compassion, ends up in mere nirvāṇa, and so it enters into and is exhausted in the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder of the aggregates.

original: bya ba zad mi shes par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bya ba zad mi shes par 'byung ste /
translated: But the morality of the bodhisattva, being embraced by great compassion, enters into nirvāṇa without remainder of the aggregates, and yet the activity of morality occurs inexhaustibly for as long as the world and space endure, through pure mundane gnosis.

original: rkang pa bzhi pa 'dis ni mi zad pa bstan to //
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pa 'dis ni mi zad pa bstan to //
translated: This fourth line teaches inexhaustibility.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Thus the Akṣayamatisūtra says,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu tshul khrims mi zad pa ni rgyun mi zad pa'i phyir blta'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu tshul khrims mi zad pa ni rgyun mi zad pa'i phyir blta'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the inexhaustibility of morality should be seen as being due to its continuity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi tshul khrims ni skye ba'i gnas kyis zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi tshul khrims ni skye ba'i gnas kyis zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of ordinary beings is exhausted by the place of rebirth.

original: phyi rol gyi lnga mngon par shes pa rnams kyi tshul khrims ni mngon par shes pa nyams pas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi lnga mngon par shes pa rnams kyi tshul khrims ni mngon par shes pa nyams pas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of those outside is exhausted by the degeneration of the superknowledges.

original: mi rnams kyi tshul khrims ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi tshul khrims ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of humans is exhausted by the exhaustion of the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu rnams kyi tshul khrims ni bsod nams zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu rnams kyi tshul khrims ni bsod nams zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of the gods of the desire realm is exhausted by the exhaustion of merit.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi lha'i bu rnams kyi tshul khrims ni tshad med pa dang bsam gtan zad pas zad par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi lha'i bu rnams kyi tshul khrims ni tshad med pa dang bsam gtan zad pas zad par 'gyur ro//
translated: The morality of the gods of the form realm is exhausted by the exhaustion of the immeasurables and dhyānas.

original: gzugs med pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyi tshul khrims ni ji lta bur snyoms par zhugs pas skyes pa zad na zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyi tshul khrims ni ji lta bur snyoms par zhugs pas skyes pa zad na zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of the sons of the gods of the formless realm is exhausted when the meditative absorption in which it arose is exhausted.

original: nyan thos dang slob pa dang mi slob pa'i tshul khrims ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang slob pa dang mi slob pa'i tshul khrims ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of the disciples, both those in training and those who have passed beyond training, is exhausted in nirvana.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims ni snying rje chen po dang bral bas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims ni snying rje chen po dang bral bas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of the solitary realizers is exhausted by the absence of great compassion.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims ni mi zad pa ste //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims ni mi zad pa ste //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the morality of the bodhisattvas is inexhaustible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar tshul khrims de las tshul khrims thams cad 'byung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul khrims de las tshul khrims thams cad 'byung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Because all moralities arise from that morality.

original: sangs rgyas sras rnams mi yi gnod pa bya dka' @28b thams cad bzod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras rnams mi yi gnod pa bya dka' @28b thams cad bzod //
translated: The bodhisattvas endure all the difficult harms that humans can do.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas' patience is of three kinds:

original: gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa dang sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa dang sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is threefold: patience in withstanding harmful persons, patience in accepting suffering, and patience in investigating the Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can rnams la bu gcig pa lta bur byams pas na sems can gyis dbyig pa dang rdo ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa thams cad bzod pa ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can rnams la bu gcig pa lta bur byams pas na sems can gyis dbyig pa dang rdo ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa thams cad bzod pa ste /
translated: Patience in withstanding harmful persons means that, because of their love for sentient beings, as if for their only children, the bodhisattvas endure all the harm sentient beings inflict on them with sticks, clods, and so on.

original: de ni gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa yin no //
translated: This is the patience in withstanding harm.

original: spyad dka' ba ni sems can smin par bya ba dang / bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos sbyin par byas pa la zhugs pa na grang ba dang tsha ba dang bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pa ni spyad dka' ba thams cad bzod pa ste /
analyzed: spyad dka' ba ni sems can smin par bya ba dang / bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos sbyin par byas pa la zhugs pa na grang ba dang tsha ba dang bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pa ni spyad dka' ba thams cad bzod pa ste /
translated: Patience in accepting suffering means that, when they have undertaken to bring sentient beings to maturity and to give the Buddha qualities to themselves, the bodhisattvas endure all the sufferings of cold, heat, hunger, thirst, and so on. This is the patience in accepting all difficult tasks.

original: de ni sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the patience in accepting suffering.

original: de ltar phyi nang gi sdug bsngal kun bzod pas na rkang pa dang po 'dis ni rgya che ba bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar phyi nang gi sdug bsngal kun bzod pas na rkang pa dang po 'dis ni rgya che ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, by enduring all the sufferings of self and others, the first line shows the vastness of patience.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamatinirdesa states,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod par blta'o //
translated: “Venerable Subhuti, the patience of the bodhisattvas should be seen in thirty-two ways.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty-two?

original: bag la nyal spangs pa'i phyir bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal spangs pa'i phyir bzod par blta'o //
translated: Patience should be seen as the abandonment of the proclivity to anger.🔽Patience should be seen as non-violence.

original: mi gnod pa'i phyir bzod par blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: mi gnod pa'i phyir bzod par blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: And so on at length.

original: mtho ris mi nus pa dang 'jigs pa phan btags lta bas min //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtho ris mi nus pa dang 'jigs pa phan btags lta bas min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Not for heaven, not for power, not from fear, not from a view of service,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bzod pa la gnas pa yang mtho ris kyi bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir bzod pa la gnas par byed pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bzod pa la gnas pa yang mtho ris kyi bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir bzod pa la gnas par byed pa ma yin gyi //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ patience is not for the sake of attaining the happiness of heaven.

original: mngon par shes par drug thob pas na mthu dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par shes par drug thob pas na mthu dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it for the sake of attaining the power of the six higher knowledges.

original: de bas na mthu chen po rnams la sogs par mi nus pa'i phyir bzod par bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: de bas na mthu chen po rnams la sogs par mi nus pa'i phyir bzod par bya ba ma yin /
translated: Therefore, it is not a patience that is practiced in order to gain great power, etc.

original: 'jigs pa lnga dang bral bas rgyal po dang rkun pos 'jigs pa'i phyir bzod pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'jigs pa lnga dang bral bas rgyal po dang rkun pos 'jigs pa'i phyir bzod pa ma yin /
translated: It is not a patience that is practiced because of fear of the five fears, such as fear of rulers and thieves.

original: bdag gis sems can 'di dag la bzod par byas nas bdag la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhes bzod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di dag la bzod par byas nas bdag la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhes bzod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not a patience that is practiced with the thought, “Having practiced patience toward these sentient beings, they will benefit me.”

original: de bas na rkang pa gnyis pa 'dis ni zang zing med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na rkang pa gnyis pa 'dis ni zang zing med pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this second line shows that it is disinterested.🔽The third line shows its great import:

original: zla med bzod pas skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //🔽ces bya ba'i rkang pa gsum pa 'dis don chen po bstan to //
analyzed: zla med bzod pas skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod // ces bya ba'i rkang pa gsum pa 'dis don chen po bstan to //
translated: “With unshared patience, he establishes all beings in the three enlightenments.”

original: bzod pa rnam pa gsum la bla na med pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //🔽shes pa @29a * //
analyzed: bzod pa rnam pa gsum la bla na med pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o // shes pa @29a * //
translated: The three kinds of patience are called “unsurpassed patience.”🔽The fourth line shows its inexhaustibility:

original: bzung ba'i bzod pa yis ni 'jig rten mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba'i rkang pa bzhi pa 'dis mi zad pa bstan te /
analyzed: bzung ba'i bzod pa yis ni 'jig rten mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba'i rkang pa bzhi pa 'dis mi zad pa bstan te /
translated: “With the patience of acceptance and definite realization, he establishes the world inexhaustibly in the three vehicles.”

original: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa yang bshad do //
analyzed: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa yang bshad do //
translated: The patience of acceptance is also explained.

original: tshig gi don zhib tu bshad pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don zhib tu bshad pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The detailed explanation of the meaning of the words should be applied as explained above.

original: de'i don kyang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las des bzod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i don kyang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las des bzod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: The meaning of that is also stated in the noble Aksayamati Sūtra: “What is the complete purity of patience?

original: gang brag ca'i sgra dang mtshungs par shin tu rtogs pa'i phyir spyos pa las mi spyo ba dang / lus gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang brag ca'i sgra dang mtshungs par shin tu rtogs pa'i phyir spyos pa las mi spyo ba dang / lus gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not retaliating for abuse because one fully understands that it is like an echo, and not retaliating for blows because one understands that the body is like a reflected image, and so on.

original: brdeg pa las slar mi rdeg pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang de la shin tu bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: brdeg pa las slar mi rdeg pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang de la shin tu bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is the utmost patience?

original: gang stong pa nyid rtogs pa de la lta bar gyur pa la yang bsal ba med /
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid rtogs pa de la lta bar gyur pa la yang bsal ba med /
translated: It is the patience of one who, understanding emptiness, does not remove the views,

original: stong pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa yang med de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa yang med de /
translated: and does not superimpose emptiness.

original: lta bar gyur pa nyid stong pa'o zhes gang 'di la bzod pa 'di ni shin tu bzod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa nyid stong pa'o zhes gang 'di la bzod pa 'di ni shin tu bzod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The view itself is empty. This is the utmost patience. ”

original: sangs rgyas sras rnams go cha sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dpe med pa //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽go cha'i sgras ni go cha'i brtson 'grus bstan /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras rnams go cha sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dpe med pa // zhes bya ba la / go cha'i sgras ni go cha'i brtson 'grus bstan /
translated: The buddhas' heirs' incomparable diligence in armor and application🔽The term armor indicates armor-like diligence.

original: sbyor ba'i sgras kyang sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus bstan to zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sgras kyang sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus bstan to zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa bya ste /
translated: The term application indicates the diligence of application.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis go cha'i brtson 'grus dpe med pa brtsams pa dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dpe med pa brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis go cha'i brtson 'grus dpe med pa brtsams pa dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dpe med pa brtsams te /
translated: The buddhas' heirs begin incomparable armor-like diligence and incomparable diligence of application.

original: dpe med pa'i sgras ni 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi brtson 'grus las byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus khyad zhugs par ston te /
analyzed: dpe med pa'i sgras ni 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi brtson 'grus las byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus khyad zhugs par ston te /
translated: The term incomparable indicates that bodhisattvas' diligence is superior to the diligence of mundane beings, listeners, and solitary realizers.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi brtson 'grus ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang 'dres pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi brtson 'grus dpe med pa brtsams dag kyang kyang gang zag la bdag med pa tsam rtogs par bya ba dang / bdag gi don la zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi brtson 'grus ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang 'dres pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi brtson 'grus dpe med pa brtsams dag kyang kyang gang zag la bdag med pa tsam rtogs par bya ba dang / bdag gi don la zhugs pa yin la /
translated: The effort of mundane beings is mixed with the side of the afflictions, and the effort of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas is immeasurable, but it is engaged in for the sake of realizing just the selflessness of persons and for their own benefit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres pa dang / gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir zhugs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres pa dang / gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir zhugs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ste /
translated: The effort of the bodhisattvas is not mixed with the side of the afflictions, it is engaged in for the sake of realizing the selflessness of persons and phenomena, and it is engaged in for the sake of both oneself and others.

original: rkang pa dang po 'dis ni rgya che ba bstan to //
analyzed: rkang pa dang po 'dis ni rgya che ba bstan to //
translated: The first line of this verse teaches its vastness.

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus dpe med pa yang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus dpe med pa yang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
translated: The immeasurable armor effort is taught in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de la byang chub @29b sems dpa' rnams kyi go cha mi zad pa gang zhe na gang 'di 'khor ba na mi skyo ba ste /🔽de bskal pa 'di snyed cig tu go cha bgo'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de la byang chub @29b sems dpa' rnams kyi go cha mi zad pa gang zhe na gang 'di 'khor ba na mi skyo ba ste / de bskal pa 'di snyed cig tu go cha bgo'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable armor? It is not being discouraged by saṃsāra.🔽They do not seek enlightenment by counting eons, thinking, “I will don the armor for this many eons,🔽but not for this many eons.”

original: bskal pa 'di snyad cig tu mi bgo'o zhes bskal pa bgrang bas byang chub mi tshol gyi bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i go cha gyon par byed de /
analyzed: bskal pa 'di snyad cig tu mi bgo'o zhes bskal pa bgrang bas byang chub mi tshol gyi bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i go cha gyon par byed de /
translated: They don the armor of the inconceivable.

original: gal te nyin zhag gcig pa yang 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' tsam la de lta bu'i nyin zhag gis zhag bco lnga zhing zla ba phyed ces bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te nyin zhag gcig pa yang 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' tsam la de lta bu'i nyin zhag gis zhag bco lnga zhing zla ba phyed ces bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa'o //
translated: If one day is equal to the beginningless past of saṃsāra, then by those days, fifteen days is half a month, and so on, as stated extensively.

original: sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dpe med pa yang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dpe med pa yang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
translated: The incomparable diligence of application is stated in the noble Aksayamati Sūtra:

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol gnon pa mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol gnon pa mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable heroism?

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba las kyang 'bog ste de bzhin gshegs pa lta bar mos pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba las kyang 'bog ste de bzhin gshegs pa lta bar mos pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And even if the trichiliocosm were filled with fire, I would cross it to see the Tathagata.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs tshogs 'joms byang chub mchog thob pa //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs tshogs 'joms byang chub mchog thob pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: They destroy the afflictions in themselves and others and attain supreme enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa ni bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed cing /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa ni bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed cing /
translated: The noble listeners and so forth destroy the afflictions that exist in their own mindstreams,

original: bdag mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin la /
translated: and they enter the path in order to attain nirvana for themselves.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa yang 'joms par byed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa yang 'joms par byed la /
translated: But bodhisattvas destroy the afflictions that exist in their own mindstreams

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa yang 'joms par byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa yang 'joms par byed cing /
translated: and they also destroy the afflictions that exist in the mindstreams of others.

original: bdag nyid kyang byang chub mchog ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par byed la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang byang chub mchog ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par byed la /
translated: And they themselves attain supreme enlightenment, that is, the gnosis of omniscience.

original: sems can gzhan yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: sems can gzhan yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'jog par byed de /
translated: And they establish all other sentient beings in the pristine wisdom of omniscience.

original: de ltar bdag gi don 'ba' zhig tu ma zhugs kyi gzhan gyi don la yang zhugs pas rkang pa gnyis pa 'dis ni zang zing med par bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi don 'ba' zhig tu ma zhugs kyi gzhan gyi don la yang zhugs pas rkang pa gnyis pa 'dis ni zang zing med par bstan te /
translated: Thus, they do not engage in their own aim alone, but also engage in the aim of others.

original: bdag lta bus sred pas yongs su zin pa de dag ni zang zing dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag lta bus sred pas yongs su zin pa de dag ni zang zing dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are so thoroughly seized by craving, like myself, are called “those with a price. ”

original: de la nyon mongs tshogs 'joms zhes bya bas ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs tshogs 'joms zhes bya bas ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan /
translated: “Destroying the mass of afflictions” shows the perfection of abandonment.

original: byang chub mchog thob ces bya bas ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa de bstan te //
analyzed: byang chub mchog thob ces bya bas ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa de bstan te //
translated: “Attaining supreme enlightenment” shows the perfection of pristine wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus des kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
analyzed: brtson 'grus des kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
translated: And by that effort, they establish all beings in the three enlightenments.

original: ces bya ba'i rkang pa gsum pas don che ba bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rkang pa gsum pas don che ba bstan to //
translated: The three lines beginning “By that effort” show the greatness of the aim.

original: shes pas gzung ba'i brtson 'grus kyis ni 'jig rten mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba'i rkang pa'i bzhi pas mi zad pa bstan te /
analyzed: shes pas gzung ba'i brtson 'grus kyis ni 'jig rten mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba'i rkang pa'i bzhi pas mi zad pa bstan te /
translated: “By the effort of holding through knowledge, they establish the world in inexhaustibility” shows inexhaustibility.

original: shes pas gzung ba'i tshig gis ni rnam par mi @30a * //
analyzed: shes pas gzung ba'i tshig gis ni rnam par mi @30a * //
translated: The words that consciousness apprehends are not🔽the ultimate.🔽

original: rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa bstan te /
analyzed: rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “with knowledge” indicates that he possesses nonconceptual gnosis.

original: 'jig rten mi zad gzhag ces bya bas snying rje dang ldan pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten mi zad gzhag ces bya bas snying rje dang ldan pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “he is the one who has established the world in the inexhaustible” indicates that he possesses compassion.

original: de'i don kyang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i don kyang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
translated: The meaning of this is stated in the Akṣayamatisūtra:

original: sems kyi brtson 'grus de gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyi brtson 'grus de gang zhe na /
translated: “What is mental diligence?

original: sems kyi 'gro ba dang sems gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi 'gro ba dang sems gnas pa ste /
translated: It is the movement of the mind and the stability of the mind.

original: de la sems 'gro ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems 'gro ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the movement of the mind?

original: gang byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsom pa'o //🔽de la sems 'gro ba gang zhe na /🔽gang sems can la snying rje ba'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsom pa'o // de la sems 'gro ba gang zhe na / gang sems can la snying rje ba'o //
translated: It is the undertaking of the thought of awakening.

original: sems gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the stability of the mind?

original: gang bdag med pa la bzod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //🔽sangs rgyas sras rnams ting 'dzin mang po'i bsam gtan kun du bsgrubs //
analyzed: gang bdag med pa la bzod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so // sangs rgyas sras rnams ting 'dzin mang po'i bsam gtan kun du bsgrubs //
translated: It is the patience of selflessness.”

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The buddhas’ heirs have accomplished all the concentrations of the many meditative stabilizations.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la sogs pa bsgrubs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la sogs pa bsgrubs te /
translated: Bodhisattvas accomplish the first, second, third, and so on meditative concentrations of the form realm.

original: de dag mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they actualize them.

original: bsam gtan de dag kyang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: bsam gtan de dag kyang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What are those meditative concentrations like?

original: de'ang theg pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dpa' bar 'gro ba dang / nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de'ang theg pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dpa' bar 'gro ba dang / nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan bsgrubs te /
translated: They are meditative concentrations endowed with immeasurable Mahāyāna samādhis such as the heroic stride and the sky treasury.

original: rkang pa dang po 'dis ni rgya che ba bstan to //
analyzed: rkang pa dang po 'dis ni rgya che ba bstan to //
translated: The first line teaches their vastness.

original: de bas na mngon pa'i chos bsdus pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na mngon pa'i chos bsdus pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: Therefore the treatise Abhidharma-samuccaya says:

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa'i bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis ming yang mi shes te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa'i bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis ming yang mi shes te /
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not even know the names of the samādhis included within the first meditative concentration that the buddhas and bodhisattvas enter.

original: ji ltar bsam gtan dang po pa de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dang gzugs med pa rnams kyis bsdus pa yang de dang 'dra bar blta'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan dang po pa de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dang gzugs med pa rnams kyis bsdus pa yang de dang 'dra bar blta'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Just as the first concentration is included in the first dhyana, so too should you view the second concentration and so on and the formless states.

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Also, the noble Aksayamati Sūtra says,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable concentration?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan mi zad pa ni rnam pa bcu drug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan mi zad pa ni rnam pa bcu drug ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ imperishable concentration is sixteenfold.

original: de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is not found in any of the Disciples and Solitary Sages.”

original: yang gsungs te /
analyzed: yang gsungs te /
translated: And it also says,

original: de ltar ting 'dzin 'di dag mtha' yas dpag med de //
analyzed: de ltar ting 'dzin 'di dag mtha' yas dpag med de //
translated: “Thus, these concentrations are infinite, immeasurable.

original: bsam gtan bye ba phrag dag brgya ni pha rol song //
analyzed: bsam gtan bye ba phrag dag brgya ni pha rol song //
translated: They have gone beyond a billion concentrations.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: And it also says,

original: bsam gtan bde ba'i mchog spyod snying rjes skye bor tha mar gnas //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan bde ba'i mchog spyod snying rjes skye bor tha mar gnas //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Having enjoyed the highest bliss of concentration, they finally remain for the sake of sentient beings through compassion.

original: @30b gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan thob na lus sim pa dang / sems bde ba'i mchog gi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @30b gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan thob na lus sim pa dang / sems bde ba'i mchog gi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one attains the meditative concentrations of the form realm, one attains the supreme result of physical well-being and mental bliss.

original: de lta bu'i bde ba mchog thob kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i mchog la ma chags shing /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bde ba mchog thob kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i mchog la ma chags shing /
translated: But even though they attain such supreme bliss, bodhisattvas are not attached to the supreme bliss of meditative concentration.

original: gzugs kyi khams su mi gnas par snying rje'i dbang gis khams gsum du skye bo mang po dang ngan song gi gnas su sems can gyi don du skye bar mdzad de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su mi gnas par snying rje'i dbang gis khams gsum du skye bo mang po dang ngan song gi gnas su sems can gyi don du skye bar mdzad de /
translated: And without remaining in the form realm, through the power of their compassion, they take birth in the three worlds and in the lower realms for the sake of many beings.

original: rkang pa gnyis pa 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi ro la ma chags pas zang zing med par bstan to //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pa 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi ro la ma chags pas zang zing med par bstan to //
translated: The second line shows that they are disinterested in material things because they are not attached to the taste of meditative concentration.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And for that reason, the noble Aksayamati Sūtra says,

original: bdag bde ba la ma chags pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni ro myang ba'o //
analyzed: bdag bde ba la ma chags pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni ro myang ba'o //
translated: “Because they are not attached to their own happiness, bodhisattvas’ meditative concentration is not enjoyed.”

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni snying rje chen po la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni snying rje chen po la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is focused on great compassion, in order to eliminate the afflictions of all sentient beings.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni ting nge 'dzin zlog pa'o zhes bya gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni ting nge 'dzin zlog pa'o zhes bya gsungs so //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is the reversal of meditative absorption, because it focuses on the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan des kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan des kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod // ces bya ba la /
translated: And by that concentration, they establish all beings in the three enlightenments.

original: bsam gtan gyis mngon par shes pa bsgrubs nas mngon par shes pa sems can bsdus te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis mngon par shes pa bsgrubs nas mngon par shes pa sems can bsdus te /
translated: Here, having accomplished the superknowledges through concentration, they gather sentient beings with the superknowledges.

original: theg pa gsum gyi byang chub la bkod pas na /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi byang chub la bkod pas na /
translated: And by establishing them in the enlightenment of the three vehicles,

original: rkang pa gsum pa 'dis don che ba bstan to //
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pa 'dis don che ba bstan to //
translated: this third line teaches great import.

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa it is said,

original: sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni sems can gyi bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni sems can gyi bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is preceded by the thoughts of sentient beings in order to liberate all sentient beings.

original: shes pas bzung ba'i bsam gtan gyis ni 'jig rten mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba'i rkang pa bzhi pas mi zad pa bstan te /
analyzed: shes pas bzung ba'i bsam gtan gyis ni 'jig rten mi zad gzhag / ces bya ba'i rkang pa bzhi pas mi zad pa bstan te /
translated: The four lines beginning with “The concentration held by knowledge establishes the world as inexhaustible” teach inexhaustibility.

original: shes pas bzung zhes bya bas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan par ston te /
analyzed: shes pas bzung zhes bya bas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan par ston te /
translated: “Held by knowledge” shows that it is endowed with nonconceptual gnosis.

original: 'jig rten mi zad gzhag ces bya ba'i tshig gis snying rje chen po dang ldan pas dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis sprul pa'i sku sems can gyi don byed par bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten mi zad gzhag ces bya ba'i tshig gis snying rje chen po dang ldan pas dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis sprul pa'i sku sems can gyi don byed par bstan to //
translated: The phrase “establishes the world as inexhaustible” shows that it is endowed with great compassion and that through pure mundane gnosis the emanation body acts for the sake of sentient beings.

original: 'di yang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las bshad de /
analyzed: 'di yang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las bshad de /
translated: This is also explained in the Akṣayamatisūtra.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: da la bsam gtan yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: da la bsam gtan yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the purification of concentration?

original: gang mngon par shes pa dang ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang mngon par shes pa dang ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of the superknowledges and of knowledge.

original: de la mngon par shes pa ni gang ye shes ni gang @31a * //
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa ni gang ye shes ni gang @31a * //
translated: What is the superknowledge? What is the knowledge?

original: zhe na ; gang gis gzugs su snang ba thams cad mthong ba 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe na ; gang gis gzugs su snang ba thams cad mthong ba 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The seeing of all forms that appear is called the superknowledge.

original: gang gis gzugs thams cad kyi chos nyid mi zad par shes kyang zad pa'i chos mngon sum du mi byed pa 'dis ni ye shes zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis gzugs thams cad kyi chos nyid mi zad par shes kyang zad pa'i chos mngon sum du mi byed pa 'dis ni ye shes zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The knowledge of the non-exhaustion of the reality of all forms, and the non-actualization of the knowledge of the exhaustion of things, is called knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas sras rnams de nyid shes bya ma lus thams cad shes //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras rnams de nyid shes bya ma lus thams cad shes // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Buddha-offspring know reality, and all that is to be known without exception.

original: bden pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: What is to be known is twofold:

original: don dam pa'i bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: ultimate truth and relative truth.

original: dal de nyid ces bya bas don dam pa'i bden pa ston te /
analyzed: dal de nyid ces bya bas don dam pa'i bden pa ston te /
translated: The word “reality” in the first line of the root verse indicates ultimate truth.

original: de'ang chos rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid gang zag la bdag med pa dang ; chos la bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: de'ang chos rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid gang zag la bdag med pa dang ; chos la bdag med pa ste /
translated: Ultimate truth is the general characteristic of all phenomena, namely, the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gang zag dang chos la bdag med par khong du chud de /
translated: And with nonconceptual gnosis, they have a thorough understanding of the no self of individuals and of phenomena.

original: de'ang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad nam mkha'i ngos lta bu bzhin du rtogs so //
analyzed: de'ang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad nam mkha'i ngos lta bu bzhin du rtogs so //
translated: Moreover, with nonconceptual gnosis, they realize that all phenomena are like the surface of the sky.

original: shes bya'i gnas de dang de dag gi lha dang mi dang rigs ngan dang gdol pa la sogs pa'i ming skad rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tha snyad rnams rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la rgyab nas thob pas dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis tha snyad🔽de dag thams cad shes te /
analyzed: shes bya'i gnas de dang de dag gi lha dang mi dang rigs ngan dang gdol pa la sogs pa'i ming skad rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tha snyad rnams rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la rgyab nas thob pas dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis tha snyad de dag thams cad shes te /
translated: With the pure mundane gnosis that follows on from nonconceptual gnosis, they know all the conventional expressions of the various languages of gods, humans, untouchables, outcastes and so forth, in all their different aspects.

original: de'ang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang chu'i zla ba lta bur shes nas chos kyi mtshan nyid la rmongs pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de'ang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang chu'i zla ba lta bur shes nas chos kyi mtshan nyid la rmongs pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir ;
translated: And knowing that these are like illusions, mirages and the reflection of the moon in water, they dispel the confusion about the characteristics of phenomena.

original: chos 'di dag ni zag pa can 'di dag ni zag pa med pa 'di dag ni 'dus byas 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas zhes 'jig rten la tha snyad du gsungs te /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni zag pa can 'di dag ni zag pa med pa 'di dag ni 'dus byas 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas zhes 'jig rten la tha snyad du gsungs te /
translated: These are mundane dharmas, these are supramundane dharmas, these are contaminated, these are uncontaminated, these are compounded, these are uncompounded.

original: de ltar don dam pa'i bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa gnyis thugs su chud pas na rkang pa dang po 'dis ni rgya che ba bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar don dam pa'i bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa gnyis thugs su chud pas na rkang pa dang po 'dis ni rgya che ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, by understanding the two truths, the ultimate truth and the conventional truth, the first line shows the vastness of the bodhisattva path.

original: 'di'i don yang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'di'i don yang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
translated: The meaning of this is taught in the Akṣayamatisūtra:

original: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conventional truth?

original: ji snyed du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yi ge dang sgra dang brdar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yi ge dang sgra dang brdar bstan pa'o //
translated: It is whatever is taught as mundane convention, as letters, words, and expressions.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Ultimate truth is that in which the movement of the mind does not exist, let alone letters.

original: mya ngan 'das la blo chags mi skyed 'khor bar ga la zhig / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das la blo chags mi skyed 'khor bar ga la zhig / ces bya ba la /
translated: How can one who is attached to nirvāṇa generate the mind of enlightenment?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba gnyis ka yang sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba yang sgyu ma lta bur shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba gnyis ka yang sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba yang sgyu ma lta bur shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the wisdom of the bodhisattva comprehends that both nirvana and cyclic existence have the character of illusion, he knows that the happiness of nirvana is also like an illusion.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang chags pa mi skyed na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang chags pa mi skyed na /
translated: Therefore he does not generate attachment even to nirvana.

original: @31b sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid sdug bsngal gyi gnas su gyur pa'i 'khor ba'i chos lta ga la zhig chags pa skyed de /
analyzed: @31b sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid sdug bsngal gyi gnas su gyur pa'i 'khor ba'i chos lta ga la zhig chags pa skyed de /
translated: How could he generate attachment to the phenomena of cyclic existence, which have the character of illusion and are the basis of suffering?

original: nyan thos ltar mya ngan las 'das pa la chags pa'i sems kyang mi skyed de /
analyzed: nyan thos ltar mya ngan las 'das pa la chags pa'i sems kyang mi skyed de /
translated: He does not generate the thought of attachment to nirvana as do the sravakas.

original: so so'i skye bo ltar 'khor ba la chags pa'i sems kyang mi skyed de /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ltar 'khor ba la chags pa'i sems kyang mi skyed de /
translated: He does not generate the thought of attachment to cyclic existence as do ordinary beings.

original: gang du yang ma chags pas na //
analyzed: gang du yang ma chags pas na //
translated: Since he is not attached to anything,

original: rkang pa gnyis pa 'dis ni zang zing med pa bstan to //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pa 'dis ni zang zing med pa bstan to //
translated: this second line shows that he is free of material desires.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamatinirdesa says,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang / 'khor ba'i khams dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings de ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang / 'khor ba'i khams dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings de ni mtshungs so //
translated: The realm of the Dharma, the realm of cyclic existence, and the realm of nirvana are the same.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang / sems can gyi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / chos thams cad kyi khams ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang / sems can gyi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / chos thams cad kyi khams ni mtshungs so //
translated: The realm of the Dharma, the realm of sentient beings, the realm of space, and the realm of all phenomena are the same.

original: ci'i phyir mtshungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshungs she na /
translated: Why are they the same?

original: stong pa nyid du mtshungs pas na de ni mtshungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du mtshungs pas na de ni mtshungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: They are the same because they are the same in emptiness.

original: ye shes des kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
analyzed: ye shes des kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
translated: And by that wisdom, he establishes all beings in the three enlightenments.

original: ces bya ba'i rkang pa gsum pas don che ba bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rkang pa gsum pas don che ba bstan to //
translated: The three lines beginning with “And by that wisdom” teach great meaning.

original: shes pas bzung ba'i shes rab kyis ni 'jig rten mi zad gzhag / ces bya bas mi zad pa bstan te /
analyzed: shes pas bzung ba'i shes rab kyis ni 'jig rten mi zad gzhag / ces bya bas mi zad pa bstan te /
translated: The line “By wisdom, he establishes the world in inexhaustibility” teaches inexhaustibility.

original: shes pas bzung zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes zin par ston /
analyzed: shes pas bzung zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes zin par ston /
translated: The phrase “By wisdom” teaches that it is taken up by nonconceptual wisdom.

original: 'jig rten mi zad gzhag ces byas snying rje chen pos yongs su zin par ston te /
analyzed: 'jig rten mi zad gzhag ces byas snying rje chen pos yongs su zin par ston te /
translated: The phrase “He establishes the world in inexhaustibility” teaches that it is taken up by great compassion.

original: shes pas zin pa ni 'khor bar ma ltung ba'i phyir so so'i skye bo bzhin du mi zad do //
analyzed: shes pas zin pa ni 'khor bar ma ltung ba'i phyir so so'i skye bo bzhin du mi zad do //
translated: Since it is sustained by wisdom, it does not perish like the virtue of ordinary beings, because it does not fall into cyclic existence.

original: snying rje chen pos zin pas na nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su mi zad de /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos zin pas na nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su mi zad de /
translated: Since it is sustained by great compassion, it does not perish in the realm of nirvana like the virtue of the disciples.

original: 'di'i don kyang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'di'i don kyang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
translated: The meaning of this is stated in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa:

original: gzhan yang 'dus byas la mkhas pa rnams ni gang sems can thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i 'od zer mnyam par gtong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dus byas la mkhas pa rnams ni gang sems can thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i 'od zer mnyam par gtong ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, those skilled in the conditioned gather sentient beings with the four social practices, because they emit the light of nonobstruction equally to all sentient beings.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir sems can sdud pa 'di ni 'dus byas la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir sems can sdud pa 'di ni 'dus byas la mkhas pa'o //
translated: This is the skill in the conditioned.🔽Those skilled in the unconditioned do not grasp or appropriate or contact anything, because there are no sentient beings and no self.🔽And they dedicate to omniscience the skill in the social practices that they have in the unconditioned, because they are devoted to the unconditioned.

original: gang la sems can med pa dang bdag med pas mi 'dzin mi len reg par mi byed cing bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa de yang 'dus ma byas la mos pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir bsngo ba 'di ni 'dus byas la mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba
analyzed: gang la sems can med pa dang bdag med pas mi 'dzin mi len reg par mi byed cing bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa de yang 'dus ma byas la mos pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir bsngo ba 'di ni 'dus byas la mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba
translated: This is the skill in the conditioned.

original: la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: ye shes kyis sems can yongs su 'dzin pa ni snying rjes sems can mi gtong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /🔽byang chub sems @32a * //
analyzed: ye shes kyis sems can yongs su 'dzin pa ni snying rjes sems can mi gtong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la / byang chub sems @32a * //
translated: The retention of sentient beings by intuition is because of the nonabandonment of sentient beings by compassion.

original: dpa'i shes rab ye shes kyis zin pas mi zad pa yang ye shes de snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pas mya ngan las 'das pa phyogs gcig tu mi ltung gi / sprul pa'i sku 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas shes rab🔽mi zad par rig par bya'o //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa drug la tshigs su bcad pa drug gi yon tan bstan pa'i don ni /
