analyzed: dpa'i shes rab ye shes kyis zin pas mi zad pa yang ye shes de snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pas mya ngan las 'das pa phyogs gcig tu mi ltung gi / sprul pa'i sku 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas shes rab mi zad par rig par bya'o // pha rol tu phyin pa drug la tshigs su bcad pa drug gi yon tan bstan pa'i don ni /
translated: The inexhaustibility of the bodhisattvas intuition of wisdom is because that intuition is retained by great compassion, which does not fall into the extreme of nirvana, but by the wheel of Dharma through the emanation body, it is known to be inexhaustible until the end of samsara.🔽There are six verses on the qualities of the six perfections.

original: rgya che zang zing med pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan to //🔽slong ba mthong rdzogs dga' ba dang // mi dga' ba dang sems re dang // gtong ba snying rje can rtag par //
analyzed: rgya che zang zing med pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan to // slong ba mthong rdzogs dga' ba dang // mi dga' ba dang sems re dang // gtong ba snying rje can rtag par //
translated: The six verses beginning with the line, “vast, disinterested, etc.,” teach the meaning of the qualities of the perfections.🔽The bodhisattvas generosity is superior to the generosity of the mundane, the heterodox, and the disciples and hermit buddhas, because it is vast, disinterested, nonconceptual, magnanimous, and inexhaustible.

original: lhag pa'i tshul gyis zil gyis gnon //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul gyis zil gyis gnon //
translated: The bodhisattvas morality is superior to that of the mundane, the heterodox, and the disciples and hermit buddhas, because it is motivated by great compassion, because it is irreproachable, because it is endowed with the transcendences, because it is unattached, because it is unattached, because it is not misdirected, and because it is not deficient.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: yang 'di man chad pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan rnam pa gzhan du 'chad de /
analyzed: yang 'di man chad pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan rnam pa gzhan du 'chad de /
translated: from here on, the qualities of the six perfections are explained in another way.

original: de la dang po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan ston to //
analyzed: de la dang po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan ston to //
translated: Among them, first, the qualities of the perfection of generosity are shown.

original: de la slong ba po'i gang zag rnams gtong ba po'i gang zag mthong na dga' ba dang / slong ba po'i gang zag kyang gtong ba po las bdag gis yo byad 'di lta bu zhig thob par bya'o zhes bsams pa las gtong ba po'i gang zag las ci 'dod pa thob ste /
analyzed: de la slong ba po'i gang zag rnams gtong ba po'i gang zag mthong na dga' ba dang / slong ba po'i gang zag kyang gtong ba po las bdag gis yo byad 'di lta bu zhig thob par bya'o zhes bsams pa las gtong ba po'i gang zag las ci 'dod pa thob ste /
translated: There, when the persons who are petitioners see the persons who are givers, they are delighted. Also, the persons who are petitioners think, “I will obtain such and such requisites from the giver.” From the persons who are givers, they obtain whatever they want.

original: bsams pa yid bzhin du rdzogs na dga' ba dang / slong ba po'i gang zag de gtong ba po'i gang zag ma mthong na mi dga' ba dang / gang bsams pa'i bsam pa mi rdzogs na yang mi dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsams pa yid bzhin du rdzogs na dga' ba dang / slong ba po'i gang zag de gtong ba po'i gang zag ma mthong na mi dga' ba dang / gang bsams pa'i bsam pa mi rdzogs na yang mi dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If their thoughts are fulfilled according to their wishes, they are delighted. If the persons who are petitioners do not see the persons who are givers, they are not delighted. If their thoughts are not fulfilled, they are also not delighted.

original: gzhan yang slong ba po de gtong ba po'i gang zag mthong yang ci ma rung snyam du sems pa dang / mthong nas kyang bdag gis gang dang gang du thob par bya bar sems pa de dang de thob kyang ci ma rung snyam du sems pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang slong ba po de gtong ba po'i gang zag mthong yang ci ma rung snyam du sems pa dang / mthong nas kyang bdag gis gang dang gang du thob par bya bar sems pa de dang de thob kyang ci ma rung snyam du sems pa las /
translated: And having seen him, he thinks, “How good it would be if he were to get whatever he hopes to get from me!”

original: bsam pa bzhin du re ba rdzogs na dga'/
analyzed: bsam pa bzhin du re ba rdzogs na dga'/
translated: If his hopes are fulfilled, he is pleased.

original: re ba ma rdzogs na ni mi dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: re ba ma rdzogs na ni mi dga' ba skye'o //
translated: If his hopes are not fulfilled, he is displeased.

original: de las bzlog ste byang chub sems dpas gtong ba pos slong ba po mthong na dga' ba skye la /
analyzed: de las bzlog ste byang chub sems dpas gtong ba pos slong ba po mthong na dga' ba skye la /
translated: But the bodhisattva, when he sees the petitioner, is pleased.

original: slong ba pos dngos po gang dang gang 'dod par bsams pa'i dngos po dang de dag btang ste /
analyzed: slong ba pos dngos po gang dang gang 'dod par bsams pa'i dngos po dang de dag btang ste /
translated: And when the petitioner gets whatever he wants, whatever he had hoped to get from the bodhisattva,

original: slong ba po'i bsam pa rdzogs na dga' ba skye'o //🔽de bzhin du gtong ba pos slong ba po ma mthong na mi dga' la /
analyzed: slong ba po'i bsam pa rdzogs na dga' ba skye'o // de bzhin du gtong ba pos slong ba po ma mthong na mi dga' la /
translated: the bodhisattva is pleased.🔽But if the bodhisattva does not see the petitioner, he is displeased.

original: de'i bsam pa ma rdzogs na mi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bsam pa ma rdzogs na mi dga' ba'o //
translated: And if the petitioner’s hopes are not fulfilled, he is displeased.

original: gzhan yang gtong ba po'i byang chub sems dpa' slong ba po mthong yang ci ma rung snyam du sems re ba dang / mthong nas kyang de'i bsam pa @32b rdzogs par byas kyang ci ma rung snyam du re ba las re ba rdzogs na ni dga' bar 'gyur la re ba ma rdzogs na ni mi dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gtong ba po'i byang chub sems dpa' slong ba po mthong yang ci ma rung snyam du sems re ba dang / mthong nas kyang de'i bsam pa @32b rdzogs par byas kyang ci ma rung snyam du re ba las re ba rdzogs na ni dga' bar 'gyur la re ba ma rdzogs na ni mi dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Having seen him, he thinks, “How good it would be if I could fulfill his wishes,” and he hopes that he can do so. If his hope is fulfilled, he is delighted. If his hope is not fulfilled, he is not delighted.🔽The beggar is delighted to see the giver, to have his wishes fulfilled, and to have his mental hopes fulfilled.

original: de la slong ba pos gtong ba po mthong na dga' ba dang / bsam pa rdzogs na dga' ba dang / sems kyi re ba rdzogs na dga' ba dang / gtong ba po byang chub sems dpa'i slong ba po mthong na dga' ba dang / de'i bsam pa rdzogs na dga' ba dang /
analyzed: de la slong ba pos gtong ba po mthong na dga' ba dang / bsam pa rdzogs na dga' ba dang / sems kyi re ba rdzogs na dga' ba dang / gtong ba po byang chub sems dpa'i slong ba po mthong na dga' ba dang / de'i bsam pa rdzogs na dga' ba dang /
translated: The bodhisattva giver is even more delighted to see the beggar, to fulfill his wishes, and to fulfill his mental hopes.

original: sems kyi re ba bzhin du grub na dga' ba dang / slong ba po bas gtong ba po dga' ba lhag par che ste /
analyzed: sems kyi re ba bzhin du grub na dga' ba dang / slong ba po bas gtong ba po dga' ba lhag par che ste /
translated: The giver is more delighted than the beggar.

original: de bas na gtong ba po snying rje can byang chub sems dpa' slong pa po rnams kyis dga' ba zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: de bas na gtong ba po snying rje can byang chub sems dpa' slong pa po rnams kyis dga' ba zil gyis gnon to //
translated: Therefore, the compassionate giver, the bodhisattva, surpasses the beggars in joy.

original: de bzhin slong ba po rnams kyis dga' ba zil gyis gnon to //🔽de bzhin du slong ba pos gtong ba po ma mthong na mi dga' ba dang / bdag gi bsam pa ma rdzogs na mi dga' ba dang / sems kyi re ba ma rdzogs na mi dga' bas byang chub sems dpa' gtong ba po ma mthong na mi dga' ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin slong ba po rnams kyis dga' ba zil gyis gnon to // de bzhin du slong ba pos gtong ba po ma mthong na mi dga' ba dang / bdag gi bsam pa ma rdzogs na mi dga' ba dang / sems kyi re ba ma rdzogs na mi dga' bas byang chub sems dpa' gtong ba po ma mthong na mi dga' ba dang /
translated: In the same way, the beggars surpass the giver in joy.🔽In the same way, the bodhisattva surpasses the beggars in joy when he does not see the giver, when his intention is not fulfilled, and when his hope is not fulfilled.

original: de'i bsam pa ma rdzogs na mi dga' ba dang / re ba ma rdzogs na mi dga' ba slong ba po bas gtong ba po che ste /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa ma rdzogs na mi dga' ba dang / re ba ma rdzogs na mi dga' ba slong ba po bas gtong ba po che ste /
translated: The giver surpasses the beggars in joy when he sees the giver, when his intention is fulfilled, and when his hope is fulfilled.

original: des kyang gtong ba po snying rje can rnams mi dga' ba'i khyad par gyis slong ba po'i mi dga' ba zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: des kyang gtong ba po snying rje can rnams mi dga' ba'i khyad par gyis slong ba po'i mi dga' ba zil gyis gnon te /
translated: And the compassionate giver surpasses the beggars in joy by the excellence of his joy.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig po 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig po 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: This single verse shows the special qualities of the perfection of generosity.

original: snying rjes lus dang longs spyod chung ma dag / nam zhig sems can dag la gtong byed cing //
analyzed: snying rjes lus dang longs spyod chung ma dag / nam zhig sems can dag la gtong byed cing //
translated: With compassion, when will I give my body, my possessions, and my wife to sentient beings,

original: ci dgar rjes su yi rang de las 'bral bar cir mi srung //
analyzed: ci dgar rjes su yi rang de las 'bral bar cir mi srung //
translated: and rejoice in whatever they do, protecting them from separation?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This verse shows the quality of pure morality.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnam par dag par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnam par dag par rig par bya'o /
translated: Pure morality should be understood as the purity of the path of the ten virtues.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje can rnams gzhan gyi don du bdag gi lus dang srog kyang yongs su btang nas ci dgar rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje can rnams gzhan gyi don du bdag gi lus dang srog kyang yongs su btang nas ci dgar rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: There, compassionate bodhisattvas, for the sake of others, give away their bodies and lives and rejoice in whatever they do.

original: sems mchog tu dga' ba skye na sems can gzhan gyi sog gcod pa las bral ba cir mi srung ste /
analyzed: sems mchog tu dga' ba skye na sems can gzhan gyi sog gcod pa las bral ba cir mi srung ste /
translated: When they experience supreme joy, they protect sentient beings from separation from what they enjoy.

original: bdag gi don du sems can gzhan gyi srog gcod pa lta ga la zhig byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi don du sems can gzhan gyi srog gcod pa lta ga la zhig byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: How could I take the life of another being for my own sake?

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi don du bdag gi longs spyod thams cad kyang yongs su btang nas ci @33a * //🔽dgar rjes su yi rang ba skye ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi don du bdag gi longs spyod thams cad kyang yongs su btang nas ci @33a * // dgar rjes su yi rang ba skye ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have great compassion give away all their possessions for the sake of beings, and they rejoice in whatever others take from them.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i sems skye na sems can gyi longs spyod las bral bar cir mi srung ste /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i sems skye na sems can gyi longs spyod las bral bar cir mi srung ste /
translated: When they experience the joy of the thought of giving, how could they not protect beings from taking what is not given?

original: gzhan gyi longs spyod la ma byin par len pa ga la 'dod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi longs spyod la ma byin par len pa ga la 'dod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: How could they want to take what is not given?

original: byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje can rnams ma 'ongs pa na tshangs par spyod pa'i phyir bdag gi chung ma yang gzhan la ci dgar btang nas rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje can rnams ma 'ongs pa na tshangs par spyod pa'i phyir bdag gi chung ma yang gzhan la ci dgar btang nas rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: The compassionate bodhisattvas give away their wives to others, as they wish, in order to practice celibacy in the future, and they rejoice in that.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i sems skye na gzhan gyi chung ma la mi tshangs par spyod pa las bral bar cir mi srung ste /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i sems skye na gzhan gyi chung ma la mi tshangs par spyod pa las bral bar cir mi srung ste /
translated: When they experience the joy of the thought of giving, how could they not protect beings from sexual misconduct?

original: gzhan gyi chung ma la mi tshangs par spyod par ga la byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chung ma la mi tshangs par spyod par ga la byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: How could he commit sexual misconduct with another’s wife?

original: tshigs su bcad pa des ni lus kyi nyes pa gsum spangs pa'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa des ni lus kyi nyes pa gsum spangs pa'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: This verse shows the quality of avoiding the three faults of the body.

original: mi lta sems mnyam 'jigs pa med //
analyzed: mi lta sems mnyam 'jigs pa med //
translated: He does not look, his mind is equal, and he is fearless.

original: snying rje'i rgyud kyis kun gtong na //🔽'phags pa gzhan la gnod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: snying rje'i rgyud kyis kun gtong na // 'phags pa gzhan la gnod pa'i phyir //
translated: When he is completely generous through the stream of compassion,🔽how could the noble one speak falsely

original: log pa'i tshig ni ga la smra //🔽zhes bya bas /
analyzed: log pa'i tshig ni ga la smra // zhes bya bas /
translated: for the sake of harming another?

original: tshig gi nyes pa bzhi yod pa las tshigs su bcad pa 'dis brdzun du smra ba'i nyes pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gi nyes pa bzhi yod pa las tshigs su bcad pa 'dis brdzun du smra ba'i nyes pa bstan to //
translated: This verse shows the fault of lying from among the four faults of speech.

original: brdzun du smra ba ni lus dang srog la lta ste /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba ni lus dang srog la lta ste /
translated: Lying is done out of regard for one’s body and life.

original: lus phangs pa dang srog phangs na lus dang srog mi gtang ba'i phyir brdzun du smra ba bgrang na byang chub sems dpa' ni lus dang srog la mi lta ste /
analyzed: lus phangs pa dang srog phangs na lus dang srog mi gtang ba'i phyir brdzun du smra ba bgrang na byang chub sems dpa' ni lus dang srog la mi lta ste /
translated: When one values one’s body and life, one lies in order to protect one’s body and life. But the bodhisattva does not look to his body and life.

original: de gnyis ka la phangs par mi 'dzin na 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis ka la phangs par mi 'dzin na 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If you do not consider both of these to be regrettable, then you are not a bodhisattva.🔽

original: log pa'i tshig ga la smra ste /
analyzed: log pa'i tshig ga la smra ste /
translated: If one does not consider them both as precious, how could the noble bodhisattvas speak falsely to others in order to harm them?

original: brdzun mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gzhan yang brdzun du smra ba ni nye du gnyen bshes la sogs pa kha cig la byams pas de dag la phan gdags pa'i phyir brdzun smra ba'am /
analyzed: brdzun mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to // gzhan yang brdzun du smra ba ni nye du gnyen bshes la sogs pa kha cig la byams pas de dag la phan gdags pa'i phyir brdzun smra ba'am /
translated: They do not tell lies.🔽Moreover, some people tell lies out of love for their relatives and friends and so on, in order to help them,

original: dgra la sogs pa kha cig la zhe sdang ste de dag la gnod pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba yin te /
analyzed: dgra la sogs pa kha cig la zhe sdang ste de dag la gnod pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba yin te /
translated: or out of hatred for their enemies and so on, in order to harm them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po thob pa'i tshe na chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po thob pa'i tshe na chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs te /
translated: But when bodhisattvas attain the first level, they realize that the dharmadhatu is omnipresent

original: bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyi sems thob pas /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyi sems thob pas /
translated: and they acquire the attitude that oneself and others are the same.

original: de la byams par bya ba dang / zhe sdang bar bya ba su zhig yod na /
analyzed: de la byams par bya ba dang / zhe sdang bar bya ba su zhig yod na /
translated: So who is there to love and who to hate?

original: 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang la phan pa'i phyir brdzun smra la su la gnod par bya ba'i phyir brdzun smra ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang la phan pa'i phyir brdzun smra la su la gnod par bya ba'i phyir brdzun smra ste /
translated: Noble bodhisattvas tell lies for the sake of benefitting others, but for whose sake would they tell lies to harm others?

original: de bas na long pa'i tshig brdzun mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na long pa'i tshig brdzun mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva does not tell lies for the sake of gain.

original: brdzun smra ba ni rgyal po'am rkun po'i 'jigs pa'am /
analyzed: brdzun smra ba ni rgyal po'am rkun po'i 'jigs pa'am /
translated: One tells lies out of fear of a king or a robber,

original: bu smad dam nor 'phrog pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs @33b pas brdzun smra bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: bu smad dam nor 'phrog pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs @33b pas brdzun smra bar byed pa yin na /
translated: or out of fear of losing one’s wife, children, or wealth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la zhugs phan chad 'jigs pa lnga dang bral te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la zhugs phan chad 'jigs pa lnga dang bral te /
translated: But once bodhisattvas have entered the first spiritual level, they are free of the five fears.

original: 'jigs pa lnga med na 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i phyir log pa'i tshig brdzun ga la smra ste mi smra ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽brdzun smra ba ni rnyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa lnga med na 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i phyir log pa'i tshig brdzun ga la smra ste mi smra ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽brdzun smra ba ni rnyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: So, noble bodhisattvas, being free of the five fears, for whose sake would they tell lies to harm others? They would not tell lies.

original: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i zang zing cung zad tsam gyi phyir brdzun smra bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i zang zing cung zad tsam gyi phyir brdzun smra bar byed pa yin na /
translated: For the sake of a little food, clothing, and so on, one tells lies.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje can ni bdag la yod pa'i phyir nang gi dngos po kun yang gtong bar byed pa yin na cung zad kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje can ni bdag la yod pa'i phyir nang gi dngos po kun yang gtong bar byed pa yin na cung zad kyi phyir ram /
translated: But the compassionate bodhisattva, because of his compassion, gives away all his inner and outer possessions. How could he tell a lie for the sake of a little,

original: gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i phyir brdzun gyi tshig ga la smra ste mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i phyir brdzun gyi tshig ga la smra ste mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or for the sake of harming others? He could not.

original: snying rje can ni bdag la phan 'dod pa //
analyzed: snying rje can ni bdag la phan 'dod pa //
translated: The compassionate one, wishing to benefit himself,

original: gzhan dag sdug bsngal skye bar shin tu 'jigs //
analyzed: gzhan dag sdug bsngal skye bar shin tu 'jigs //
translated: is terrified of causing suffering to others.

original: sems can gdul la rab tu brtson 'gyur la //🔽ngag gi nyes gsum las ni shin du ring //
analyzed: sems can gdul la rab tu brtson 'gyur la // ngag gi nyes gsum las ni shin du ring //
translated: He is dedicated to training sentient beings🔽and is far from the three verbal faults.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i 'dis phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal ba gsum spangs pa'i yon tan ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i 'dis phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal ba gsum spangs pa'i yon tan ston te /
translated: This verse shows the virtues of abandoning the three verbal faults—slander, harsh words, and idle talk.

original: phra ma smra ba ni 'ga' zhig la phan gdags 'ga' zhig la gnod pa bya ba'i phyir dbyen gyi tshig phra ma smra na /
analyzed: phra ma smra ba ni 'ga' zhig la phan gdags 'ga' zhig la gnod pa bya ba'i phyir dbyen gyi tshig phra ma smra na /
translated: Slander is to speak divisive words in order to benefit some and harm others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje can rnams ni bdag dang sems can mnyam par thugs su chud pa dang / mdza' ba dang dgra ma nyam par thugs su chud pas mtshungs pa kho nar sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bzhed pa yin na /🔽sems can gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje can rnams ni bdag dang sems can mnyam par thugs su chud pa dang / mdza' ba dang dgra ma nyam par thugs su chud pas mtshungs pa kho nar sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bzhed pa yin na / sems can gzhan la gnod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: But bodhisattvas, who are compassionate, have realized that they and sentient beings are the same and have realized that there is no difference between friends and enemies. They are impartial and want only to benefit and make happy all sentient beings.

original: sems can dbye bar 'gyur ba'i phra ma'i tshig ga la smra ste mi smra'o //
analyzed: sems can dbye bar 'gyur ba'i phra ma'i tshig ga la smra ste mi smra'o //
translated: So how could they speak divisive words that are slander and that cause harm to other sentient beings? They do not speak in that way.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje can rnams ni sems can sdug bsngal bar gyur na ma legs so snyam du thugs mi dgyes shing 'jigs par dgongs pa yin na bdag nyid kyis sems can gyi sems dang / lus la gnod par 'gyur ba'i tshig ga la zhig smra ste mi smra'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje can rnams ni sems can sdug bsngal bar gyur na ma legs so snyam du thugs mi dgyes shing 'jigs par dgongs pa yin na bdag nyid kyis sems can gyi sems dang / lus la gnod par 'gyur ba'i tshig ga la zhig smra ste mi smra'o //
translated: Compassionate bodhisattvas are afraid that it would not be right for sentient beings to suffer, so how could they say anything that would harm the minds and bodies of sentient beings? They would not say such things.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje can rnams ni sems can gyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gdul bar bya ba la brtson pa yin na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje can rnams ni sems can gyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gdul bar bya ba la brtson pa yin na /
translated: Compassionate bodhisattvas are diligent in subduing the defilements of sentient beings, such as their attachment and aversion.

original: de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' de bdag nyid bdag dang gzhan nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu /
analyzed: de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' de bdag nyid bdag dang gzhan nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu /
translated: How could such bodhisattvas say anything that would cause defilements to arise in themselves and others,

original: rgyal po dang rkun po la sogs pa'i tshig 'khyal ba ga la zhig smra ste /
analyzed: rgyal po dang rkun po la sogs pa'i tshig 'khyal ba ga la zhig smra ste /
translated: such as the idle talk of kings and thieves?

original: de bas na ngag gi nyes pa gsum ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams @34a * //
analyzed: de bas na ngag gi nyes pa gsum ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams @34a * //
translated: Therefore, the three faults of speech are

original: la shin tu thag ring ste spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: la shin tu thag ring ste spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is very far away, and so it is abandoned.

original: thams cad gtong snying rje can //
analyzed: thams cad gtong snying rje can //
translated: The compassionate give everything,

original: rten 'byung chos la shin tu mkhas //
analyzed: rten 'byung chos la shin tu mkhas //
translated: Are very skilled in dependent origination,🔽And in all ways avoid

original: yid kyi nyon mongs rnam pa kun //
analyzed: yid kyi nyon mongs rnam pa kun //
translated: Mental afflictions of the mind.

original: des ni dang du ga la len //
analyzed: des ni dang du ga la len //
translated: How could they take up mental afflictions?

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis yid kyi nyes pa gsum spangs pa'i yon tan bstan te byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin pas phyi'i dngos po bdag la yod pa rnams kyang yongs su gtong ba dang / nang gi dngos po mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa yang yongs su gtong na yid kyi nyon mongs pa chags sems kyi sems can la gnod pa'i nor dang chung ma la sogs pa la chags pa'i sems dang du: kha la len te /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis yid kyi nyes pa gsum spangs pa'i yon tan bstan te byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin pas phyi'i dngos po bdag la yod pa rnams kyang yongs su gtong ba dang / nang gi dngos po mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa yang yongs su gtong na yid kyi nyon mongs pa chags sems kyi sems can la gnod pa'i nor dang chung ma la sogs pa la chags pa'i sems dang du: kha la len te /
translated: This verse shows the good qualities of abandoning the three faults of the mind. Since bodhisattvas are free of attachment, they give away all the external things that they possess, and they also give away the internal things, their heads, legs, arms, and so on. So how could they take up the mental afflictions of the mind, the mental state of attachment, the thought of attachment to the wealth, spouses, and so on of sentient beings who are harmed by attachment?

original: chags sems cung zad kyang skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chags sems cung zad kyang skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that they do not give rise to the slightest thought of attachment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zhe sdang dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zhe sdang dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Bodhisattvas are free from hatred.

original: sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin du snying rje dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin du snying rje dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: They have compassion for all sentient beings, as if they were their only child.

original: yid kyi nyon mongs pa gnod sems kyi sems can gzhan dag la brdeg pa dang gsad par bya'o snyam du sems pa'i zhe sdang gi sems dang du: khas len te /
analyzed: yid kyi nyon mongs pa gnod sems kyi sems can gzhan dag la brdeg pa dang gsad par bya'o snyam du sems pa'i zhe sdang gi sems dang du: khas len te /
translated: They do not accept the hateful thought of those who are mentally disturbed, who think of harming and killing other sentient beings.

original: de lta bu'i sems skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They do not generate such a thought.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gti mug dang bral bas phyi nang gi chos thams cad rten cing 'brel ba nye 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin bar rab tu mkhas pa yin na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gti mug dang bral bas phyi nang gi chos thams cad rten cing 'brel ba nye 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin bar rab tu mkhas pa yin na /
translated: Bodhisattvas are free from delusion. They are well versed in the fact that all outer and inner phenomena are characterized by dependent origination.

original: chos rnams dbang phyug dang byed pa po la sogs pas byas so zhes yid kyi nyon mongs pa log pa'i lta ba dang du: kha la len te /
analyzed: chos rnams dbang phyug dang byed pa po la sogs pas byas so zhes yid kyi nyon mongs pa log pa'i lta ba dang du: kha la len te /
translated: They do not accept the mental disturbance of wrong views, such as the view that phenomena are created by Īśvara, a creator, and so on.

original: log pa'i lta ba cung zad kyang mi mang 'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: log pa'i lta ba cung zad kyang mi mang 'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They do not entertain any wrong views at all.

original: tshul khrims ngan pa'i gnyen po chos kyi khyad par dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa'i gnyen po chos kyi khyad par dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The line “Endowed with the distinctive qualities that are the antidotes to immorality” and so on.

original: tshul khrims ngan pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus kyi mi dge ba gsum dang / brdzun la sogs pa dag gi nyes pa bzhi dang / chags sems la sogs pa yid kyi nyes pa rnam pa gsum rnams te /
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus kyi mi dge ba gsum dang / brdzun la sogs pa dag gi nyes pa bzhi dang / chags sems la sogs pa yid kyi nyes pa rnam pa gsum rnams te /
translated: Immorality is the three nonvirtuous actions of body such as killing, the four verbal faults such as lying, and the three mental faults such as covetousness.

original: de dag gi gnyen po chos kyi khyad par ni phyi nang gi dngos po kun gtong ba nas rten 'brel gyi chos la mkhas pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po chos kyi khyad par ni phyi nang gi dngos po kun gtong ba nas rten 'brel gyi chos la mkhas pa'i bar du ste /
translated: The distinctive qualities that are the antidotes to these are from giving away all outer and inner things to being skilled in the Dharma of dependent origination.

original: gnyen po de dag ldan pas na byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: gnyen po de dag ldan pas na byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bstan to //
translated: Endowed with these antidotes, the bodhisattvas possess the qualities of pure discipline.🔽When the compassionate ones, in order to benefit others,

original: nam zhig snying rje can gnod dang // gzhan la phan pa'i sdug bsngal la //
analyzed: nam zhig snying rje can gnod dang // gzhan la phan pa'i sdug bsngal la //
translated: are happy to take on suffering

original: rtag phan 'du shes dga' thob na //
analyzed: rtag phan 'du shes dga' thob na //
translated: that is always beneficial,

original: de ni ga las @34b ci zhig bzod //
analyzed: de ni ga las @34b ci zhig bzod //
translated: what is there for them to bear?

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bzod pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bzod pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This verse shows the good qualities of patience.

original: gdod bzod pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan gyi brdeg pa dang 'tshog pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa byas pa la mi 'khrug cing nyams su blangs na gdod bzod pa zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gdod bzod pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan gyi brdeg pa dang 'tshog pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa byas pa la mi 'khrug cing nyams su blangs na gdod bzod pa zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: Patience is so called because it is the practice of not being upset by the harm others do, such as beating and killing.

original: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje can rnams ni sems can gzhan gyis brdeg pa dang gsad pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa byas na sems can 'dis bdag la gnod pa byas pas 'di ni dgra yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes mi 'byung gi / gnod pa byed pa
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje can rnams ni sems can gzhan gyis brdeg pa dang gsad pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa byas na sems can 'dis bdag la gnod pa byas pas 'di ni dgra yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes mi 'byung gi / gnod pa byed pa
translated: But when other sentient beings beat and kill the compassionate bodhisattvas, the idea that they are enemies who are harming me does not occur to them.

original: rnams la 'dis bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i grogs byas pas na 'dis ni bdag la phan btags so zhes dgra la phan btags pa'i 'du shes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnams la 'dis bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i grogs byas pas na 'dis ni bdag la phan btags so zhes dgra la phan btags pa'i 'du shes 'byung ste /
translated: Rather, the idea occurs to them that these people are helping me, because they are helping me to complete the accumulations for unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: gang la yang dgra'i 'du shes mi 'byung na /
analyzed: gang la yang dgra'i 'du shes mi 'byung na /
translated: So, if they do not think of anyone as an enemy,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dgra gang zhig la bzod par byas pa yod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dgra gang zhig la bzod par byas pa yod de /
translated: What enemy is there that the bodhisattva forgives?

original: gang las kyang bzod par byas pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang las kyang bzod par byas pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is there that he does not forgive?

original: 'dis ni gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the patience of accepting suffering.

original: gzhan yang bzod pa zhes bya ba ni grang ba dang tsha ba dang bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su blangs nas gdod bzod pa zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang bzod pa zhes bya ba ni grang ba dang tsha ba dang bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su blangs nas gdod bzod pa zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: Moreover, if patience is said to be the acceptance of suffering such as cold, heat, hunger, and thirst,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal byung ba rnams la sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes mi 'byung gi sdug bsngal 'di gnyis kyis dga' ba dang bde bar shes te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal byung ba rnams la sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes mi 'byung gi sdug bsngal 'di gnyis kyis dga' ba dang bde bar shes te /
translated: then when the bodhisattva experiences the suffering of cold, heat, etc. for the sake of benefiting and gladdening others, he does not think of it as suffering. He knows that these two sufferings are joy and happiness.

original: des sdug bsngal ji zhig nyams su blangs nas byang chub sems dpa' de la bzod pa la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des sdug bsngal ji zhig nyams su blangs nas byang chub sems dpa' de la bzod pa la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: What suffering does he accept that the bodhisattva is said to abide in patience?

original: de la sdug bsngal gang yang med pas na bzod par byas pa cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gang yang med pas na bzod par byas pa cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since there is no suffering at all, there is not the slightest thing to be patient with.

original: gnod par byed pa la yang bzod par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa la yang bzod par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One should also be patient with the perpetrators of harm.

original: bzod pa zhes bya ba la gnod par byed pa nyams su blangs na bzod pa zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: bzod pa zhes bya ba la gnod par byed pa nyams su blangs na bzod pa zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: If patience is the practice of enduring harm,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa rnams la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa rnams la /
translated: then when bodhisattvas are harmed by other sentient beings,

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni bzod pa'i tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i grogs byas pas bdag la phan 'dogs so snyam pa'i 'du shes 'byung na /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni bzod pa'i tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i grogs byas pas bdag la phan 'dogs so snyam pa'i 'du shes 'byung na /
translated: they think, “These sentient beings are helping me to complete the perfection of patience. They are helping me.”

original: des dgra gang zhig la bzod par byas pa yod /
analyzed: des dgra gang zhig la bzod par byas pa yod /
translated: So with respect to whom should they be patient?

original: grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su blangs na bzod pa zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su blangs na bzod pa zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: If patience is the practice of enduring suffering, such as cold and heat,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can @35a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can @35a * //
translated: then when bodhisattvas are suffering

original: gyi don du sdug bsngal byung ba rnams de la sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gyi don du sdug bsngal byung ba rnams de la sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The meaning is that the sufferings that arise for the sake of others are not suffering for him.

original: dga' zhing bde bar 'gyur na des sdug bsngal gang zhig las bzod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dga' zhing bde bar 'gyur na des sdug bsngal gang zhig las bzod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What suffering is there that he should endure?

original: gzhan la gzhan pa'i 'du shes bral //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan pa'i 'du shes bral //
translated: He is free from the notion of “other” in regard to others.

original: bdag pas lhag par gzhan rtag byams //
analyzed: bdag pas lhag par gzhan rtag byams //
translated: He always loves others more than himself.

original: dga' spyod snying rje ldan pa yi //
analyzed: dga' spyod snying rje ldan pa yi //
translated: He is compassionate and delights in giving.

original: brtson 'grus mi dka' shin tu dka' //
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi dka' shin tu dka' //
translated: His effort is not difficult, but very difficult.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus gzhan gyi don gyi phyir dka' ba spyod pa rnams mi dka' ba yin //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus gzhan gyi don gyi phyir dka' ba spyod pa rnams mi dka' ba yin //
translated: This verse shows the excellence of the bodhisattva’s effort, which is not difficult for one who is engaged in the difficult tasks of the benefit and happiness of others.

original: dka' ba yang yin pa'i brtson 'grus kyi yon tan ston to //
analyzed: dka' ba yang yin pa'i brtson 'grus kyi yon tan ston to //
translated: It is difficult for one who is not so engaged.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi don du mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa btang ba'i dka' bar spyod pa rnams mi dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi don du mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa btang ba'i dka' bar spyod pa rnams mi dka' ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the difficult tasks of the bodhisattva, such as giving his head and limbs, are not difficult for him.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan la gzhan pa'i 'du shes med de sa dang por chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba rtogs pas bdag dang gzhan du tha dad par 'du shes pa med de /
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan pa'i 'du shes med de sa dang por chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba rtogs pas bdag dang gzhan du tha dad par 'du shes pa med de /
translated: They have no notion of other in regard to others, because on the first stage they realize the all-pervading nature of the realm of the Dharma, and so they have no notion of a difference between self and others.

original: de bas na gzhan gyi don du dka' ba spyod pa'i brtson 'grus de mi dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyi don du dka' ba spyod pa'i brtson 'grus de mi dka' ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effort that is the performance of difficult tasks for the sake of others is not difficult for them.

original: gzhan la yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag pas lhag par sems can gzhan la byams shing sdug pa dang phangs par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan la yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag pas lhag par sems can gzhan la byams shing sdug pa dang phangs par byed de /
translated: Moreover, bodhisattvas love other sentient beings more than themselves, and they cherish and hold dear those other beings.

original: de bas na gzhan gyi don du dka' bar spyod pa'i brtson 'grus rnams kyis dka' ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyi don du dka' bar spyod pa'i brtson 'grus rnams kyis dka' ba yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effort that is the performance of difficult tasks for the sake of others is difficult for them.

original: de'i don kyang sgrub pa bshad pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: de'i don kyang sgrub pa bshad pa'i skabs su /
translated: The meaning of that is explained in the section on accomplishment:

original: gzhan dang bdag tu mnyam pa'i sems rnyed pa //🔽yang na bdag pas gzhan mchog sdug byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan dang bdag tu mnyam pa'i sems rnyed pa // yang na bdag pas gzhan mchog sdug byed pa //
translated: Having attained the attitude of sameness between self and others,🔽Or loving others more than oneself,

original: de ltar bdag pas gzhan don mchog tu shes //
analyzed: de ltar bdag pas gzhan don mchog tu shes //
translated: One knows that the benefit of others is superior to one’s own benefit.

original: bdag gi don gang gzhan gyi don kyang gang //
analyzed: bdag gi don gang gzhan gyi don kyang gang //
translated: What is one’s own benefit? What is the benefit of others?

original: ji ltar snying rje'i bdag nyid gzhan don phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar snying rje'i bdag nyid gzhan don phyir //
translated: Just as the compassionate one, for the sake of others,

original: de bzhin bdag la sdug bsngal gdung byed ltar //🔽de ltar 'jig rten pa dag dgra dag la //
analyzed: de bzhin bdag la sdug bsngal gdung byed ltar // de ltar 'jig rten pa dag dgra dag la //
translated: would take on himself the suffering that torments them,🔽so the worldly person, who has no compassion,

original: gdung bar bya phyir snying brtse yod ma yin //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gdung bar bya phyir snying brtse yod ma yin // zhes bshad do //
translated: torments himself for the sake of his enemies.

original: de lta mod kyi shin tu dka' bar spyod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi shin tu dka' bar spyod pa yang yin te /
translated: But it is also a practice that is very difficult.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?🔽It is difficult to think, “Whatever is another is myself,” without the notion of another.

original: gzhan la gzhan pa'i 'du shes mi skyed par gzhan gang yin pa de nyid bdag yin no zhes sems pa yang dka' ba dang / bdag pas kyang gzhan la byams pa dang sdug par 'du shes 'byung ba rnyed dka' ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan pa'i 'du shes mi skyed par gzhan gang yin pa de nyid bdag yin no zhes sems pa yang dka' ba dang / bdag pas kyang gzhan la byams pa dang sdug par 'du shes 'byung ba rnyed dka' ba ste /
translated: And it is difficult to find the notion of love and affection for another that is greater than for oneself.

original: de bas na dka' bar spyod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dka' bar spyod pa yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a practice that is very difficult.

original: bde ba chung dang bdag nyid bde //
analyzed: bde ba chung dang bdag nyid bde //
translated: The worldly person has little happiness and is himself the obstacle to his own happiness.

original: zhan nyams zhan dang myos ldan pa //
analyzed: zhan nyams zhan dang myos ldan pa //
translated: He is weak, feeble, and intoxicated.

original: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum du shes @35b byang chub sems dpa'i bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum du shes @35b byang chub sems dpa'i bzlog pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is the opposite.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi yon tan bstan te /
translated: This verse shows the virtues of meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan gsum ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / nyan thos kyi bsam gtan dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / nyan thos kyi bsam gtan dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan no //
translated: There are three kinds of meditative concentration: the meditative concentration of mundane beings, the meditative concentration of disciples, and the meditative concentration of the self-enlightened.

original: de la 'jig rten pa rnams kyi bsam gtan ni bde ba chung ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa rnams kyi bsam gtan ni bde ba chung ba ste /
translated: The meditative concentration of mundane beings is of little happiness,

original: zag pa can gyi bde ba tsam yod par zad kyi zag pa med pa'i bde ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa can gyi bde ba tsam yod par zad kyi zag pa med pa'i bde ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has only the happiness of the contaminated realm and lacks the happiness of the uncontaminated realm.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan ni bdag nyid bde ba ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan ni bdag nyid bde ba ste /
translated: The meditative concentration of disciples and self-enlightened ones is for their own happiness,

original: zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gyis bdag gi rgyud tsam sim par byed par zad kyi /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gyis bdag gi rgyud tsam sim par byed par zad kyi /
translated: because their uncontaminated meditative concentration only refreshes their own mental continuum

original: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la sim par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la sim par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and does not refresh the mental continua of all sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan rnams zhen pa can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan rnams zhen pa can zhes bya ste /
translated: The meditative concentrations of mundane beings, disciples, and self-enlightened ones are called “clinging,”🔽because they cling to the happiness of their own mental continuum.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba yod pas 'khor bar zhen pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi snying rje chen po dang mi ldan pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig gi phyogs su zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba yod pas 'khor bar zhen pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi snying rje chen po dang mi ldan pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig gi phyogs su zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the existence of the view of the transitory composite, one is attached to saṃsāra, and because of the absence of the great compassion of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha, one is attached to the extreme of nirvāṇa alone.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan ni nyams pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan ni nyams pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The mundane meditative concentration is called “degenerated”

original: 'chi 'phos nas med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi 'phos nas med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is lost upon death and transmigration.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan ni zad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan ni zad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha meditative concentration is called “exhausted”

original: phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das par mthar thug ste med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das par mthar thug ste med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it ends in nirvāṇa, which is the abandonment of the remainder of the aggregates, and is lost.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa dang ldan pas na myong ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa dang ldan pas na myong ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The mundane and śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha meditative concentration is called “experienced” because it is associated with nonafflicted nescience.

original: gang zag la bdag med par ma rtogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par ma rtogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa'o //
translated: Non-realization of the selflessness of the person is the afflicted ignorance.

original: chos la bdag med par ma rtogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: chos la bdag med par ma rtogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa ste /
translated: Non-realization of the selflessness of phenomena is non-afflicted ignorance.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan la ni nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa gnyis ka dang ldan pas na myos ba can no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan la ni nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa gnyis ka dang ldan pas na myos ba can no //
translated: Since the mundane dhyanas possess both afflicted and non-afflicted ignorance, they are intoxicating.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan la /
translated: The dhyanas of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa med kyang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa yod pas myos pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa med kyang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa yod pas myos pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: are not intoxicating due to afflicted ignorance, but they are intoxicating due to non-afflicted ignorance.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni de las bzlog ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni de las bzlog ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas' dhyanas are the opposite of that.

original: theg pa chen po'i bsam gtan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pas bde ba mang ba dang / nyan thos ltar bdag gi don du zhugs pa ma yin @36a * //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i bsam gtan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pas bde ba mang ba dang / nyan thos ltar bdag gi don du zhugs pa ma yin @36a * //
translated: Since they possess the immeasurable dhyanas of the Mahayana, they are blissful, and since they are not engaged for their own benefit like the sravakas,🔽they are not intoxicating.

original: gyi ; bdag dang gzhan gyi don du zhugs pas bdag dang gzhan la bde ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'khor ba la mi gnas pa dang / snying rje chen pos mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir zhen pa med pa dang shi 'phos nas med par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi tshe rabs thams cad du 'byung bas nyams par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: gyi ; bdag dang gzhan gyi don du zhugs pas bdag dang gzhan la bde ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'khor ba la mi gnas pa dang / snying rje chen pos mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir zhen pa med pa dang shi 'phos nas med par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi tshe rabs thams cad du 'byung bas nyams par mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is without attachment because it is engaged for the benefit of self and other, it is not exhausted because it occurs in all lives, not being nonexistent after death.

original: phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das par zhugs kyang rgyun mi zad par 'byung bas mi zad pa dang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das par zhugs kyang rgyun mi zad par 'byung bas mi zad pa dang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas /
translated: It is inexhaustible because it occurs without interruption even when entering the nirvana that is the abandonment of the remainder of the aggregates.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa med pas rmongs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa med pas rmongs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: It is not associated with confusion because it is devoid of afflicted and unafflicted ignorance.

original: ji ltar mtshan mo lag tshod pa //
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan mo lag tshod pa //
translated: Like a lamp in the darkness,🔽like the sun, like a precious gem,🔽like a great mine of jewels,🔽like the inexhaustible ocean,🔽like the king of mountains,🔽like the earth, like the wind,🔽like fire, like a cloud,🔽like a great drum,

original: khebs sgron de bzhin shes pa gsum //
analyzed: khebs sgron de bzhin shes pa gsum //
translated: the three knowledges are like these.

original: snying rje can gyi shes pa ni //
analyzed: snying rje can gyi shes pa ni //
translated: The cognition of the compassionate

original: nyi ma'i zer bzhin mtshungs pa med //
analyzed: nyi ma'i zer bzhin mtshungs pa med //
translated: is incomparable, like the rays of the sun.

original: ces bya bas shes rab kyi yon tan bstan te /🔽de la 'jig rten pa'i shes rab dang / nyan thos kyi shes rab dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi shes rab gsum ni mtshan mo lag tshod kyis nom pa dang / khang bu'am /
analyzed: ces bya bas shes rab kyi yon tan bstan te / de la 'jig rten pa'i shes rab dang / nyan thos kyi shes rab dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi shes rab gsum ni mtshan mo lag tshod kyis nom pa dang / khang bu'am /
translated: This shows the good qualities of wisdom.

original: phug tu mar me bus pa dang 'dra bar ston te /
analyzed: phug tu mar me bus pa dang 'dra bar ston te /
translated: Among them, the three kinds of wisdom—that of the worldly person, that of the śrāvaka, and that of the pratyekabuddha—are like groping in the dark with one’s hand, or like lighting a lamp in a house or a cave.

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig mtshan mo mun pa stug po'i nang na lag pas bsnams pa dang / bum pa'am snam bu la sogs pa dngos po 'ga' zhig la reg nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye'o ;
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig mtshan mo mun pa stug po'i nang na lag pas bsnams pa dang / bum pa'am snam bu la sogs pa dngos po 'ga' zhig la reg nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye'o ;
translated: Thus, in the darkness of the night, if one touches with one’s hand some object such as a pot or a piece of cloth, a bodily consciousness arises.

original: ; de'i rjes la sngon bud pa mthong ba ma brjed pa'i dran pa skye ste /🔽de nas dran pa des 'di lta bu'i bum pa zhig ce'am /
analyzed: ; de'i rjes la sngon bud pa mthong ba ma brjed pa'i dran pa skye ste / de nas dran pa des 'di lta bu'i bum pa zhig ce'am /
translated: After that, a memory arises that does not forget what was seen before.

original: snam bu zhig yin no zhes rjes su dpog ste /
analyzed: snam bu zhig yin no zhes rjes su dpog ste /
translated: Then, through that memory, one infers, “It is a pot like this” or “It is a piece of cloth like that.”

original: de'i tshe dngos po gang la reg pa de tsam zhig shes pas na spyod yul chung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po gang la reg pa de tsam zhig shes pas na spyod yul chung ba'o //
translated: At that time, since one only knows that much which is touched by a thing, it is of small scope.

original: bum pa la sogs pa mig gis ma mthong bas na mngon sum ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa mig gis ma mthong bas na mngon sum ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since a pot, etc. is not seen by the eye, it is not direct perception.

original: bum pa'i kha dog sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa ma bcad pas na mi gsal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bum pa'i kha dog sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa ma bcad pas na mi gsal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the color of a pot, blue, red, etc. is not discerned, it is called unclear.

original: kha dog ma bcad pa yang mun pas bsgribs pas na ma bcad do //
analyzed: kha dog ma bcad pa yang mun pas bsgribs pas na ma bcad do //
translated: Since the color is not discerned, it is not discerned because it is obscured by darkness.

original: de dang 'dra bar 'jig rten pa'i nyan pa dang sems pa dang sgom pa'i shes rab kyang de lta bur blta ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar 'jig rten pa'i nyan pa dang sems pa dang sgom pa'i shes rab kyang de lta bur blta ste /
translated: The mundane wisdom of listening, reflection, and meditation should be seen in the same way.

original: nyan pa'i dus na gang thos pa'i chos tsam las mi shes pas spyod yul chung ba'o //
analyzed: nyan pa'i dus na gang thos pa'i chos tsam las mi shes pas spyod yul chung ba'o //
translated: At the time of listening, since one does not know anything other than the mere Dharma that is heard, it is of small scope.

original: sems pa'i dus na yang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i don la rjes su dpog pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: sems pa'i dus na yang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i don la rjes su dpog pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: At the time of reflection, it is merely an inference about the meaning of impermanence, suffering, etc.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don mngon sum du ma mthong bas na mngon sum ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don mngon sum du ma mthong bas na mngon sum ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since the meaning of impermanence, etc. is not directly seen, it is not direct perception.

original: sgom @36b pa'i dus na shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i mun pa chen pos bsgribs bzhin du bsgom pas na mi gsal ba zhes bya'o //🔽ji ltar phug gam khang bur sgron ma bus na gang du bus pa'i gnas nyi tshe tsam gyi mun pa bsal nas de nyi tshe tsam du snang bar byed pa dang 'dra bar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab kyis kyang /
analyzed: sgom @36b pa'i dus na shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i mun pa chen pos bsgribs bzhin du bsgom pas na mi gsal ba zhes bya'o // ji ltar phug gam khang bur sgron ma bus na gang du bus pa'i gnas nyi tshe tsam gyi mun pa bsal nas de nyi tshe tsam du snang bar byed pa dang 'dra bar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab kyis kyang /
translated: Since it is meditated upon while obscured by the great darkness of the obscurations of the knowable and of affliction, it is called “unclear”.

original: bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam nyi tshe tsam bsal nas bdag gi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga tsam bdag med par ye shes kyis shes shing snang bar byed pas na khebs sgron dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam nyi tshe tsam bsal nas bdag gi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga tsam bdag med par ye shes kyis shes shing snang bar byed pas na khebs sgron dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as when a lamp is lit in a cave or a house, it dispels the darkness only in the place where it is lit and illuminates only that place, in the same way, the wisdom of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas dispels only the darkness of the obscurations of affliction that exist in their own mindstreams, and with that wisdom they know and illuminate only the absence of self in their own five appropriated aggregates. Thus it is like a lamp in a cave.

original: dper na nyi ma shar na 'od zer dpag tu med pa dang 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mun pa kun sel ba dang / snang bar bya ba'i gnas thams cad du 'od zer gyis snang bar byed pa dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab dang shes pa dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma shar na 'od zer dpag tu med pa dang 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mun pa kun sel ba dang / snang bar bya ba'i gnas thams cad du 'od zer gyis snang bar byed pa dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab dang shes pa dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: Just as when the sun rises, it has countless rays, it dispels all the darkness of the world and its rays illuminate all the places that are illuminated, in the same way, the bodhisattvas have immeasurable wisdom and knowledge.

original: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa kun sel ba dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i chos la sogs pa ji snyed shes par bya ba ma lus par shes pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba chen po 'byung bas na nyi ma shar ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa kun sel ba dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i chos la sogs pa ji snyed shes par bya ba ma lus par shes pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba chen po 'byung bas na nyi ma shar ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: They dispel all the obscurations of the knowable and of defilements and they give rise to the great light of gnosis that knows all there is to know, all the conventional and ultimate phenomena and so forth.

original: gzhan yang 'di man chad tshigs su bcad pa drug gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams pha rol tu sbyin pa dang / mchog dang / dam pa dang / yon tan can yin par ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di man chad tshigs su bcad pa drug gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams pha rol tu sbyin pa dang / mchog dang / dam pa dang / yon tan can yin par ston te /
translated: The following six verses show how the six transcendent perfections are superior, supreme, sublime and endowed with good qualities.

original: de'i phyir / gzhi dang dngos po mtshan ma dang / bsngo dang rgyu dang ye shes dang // gzhi dang gnas pa bdag gis kyang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gzhi dang dngos po mtshan ma dang / bsngo dang rgyu dang ye shes dang // gzhi dang gnas pa bdag gis kyang //
translated: The basis, the thing, the sign, the dedication, the cause, the wisdom, the field, and the reliance of giving

original: sbyin pa mchog tu shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sbyin pa mchog tu shes par bya // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: are to be known as the best.

original: de la mchog rnam pa brgyad dang ldan pas phyin pa mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la mchog rnam pa brgyad dang ldan pas phyin pa mchog ces bya'o //
translated: Therein, giving is called the best because it has eight kinds of excellence.

original: mchog rnam pa brgyad ni gzhi mchog dang / dngos po mchog dang / mtshan ma mchog dang / bsngo ba mchog dang / rgyu mchog dang / ye shes mchog dang / zhing mchog dang / gnas pa mchog go //
analyzed: mchog rnam pa brgyad ni gzhi mchog dang / dngos po mchog dang / mtshan ma mchog dang / bsngo ba mchog dang / rgyu mchog dang / ye shes mchog dang / zhing mchog dang / gnas pa mchog go //
translated: The eight kinds of excellence are: the best basis, the best thing, the best sign, the best dedication, the best cause, the best wisdom, the best field, and the best reliance.

original: de la gzhi zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba la gzhi ni gtong ba po la bya ste /
analyzed: de la gzhi zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba la gzhi ni gtong ba po la bya ste /
translated: Therein, the best basis is the bodhisattva. The basis is the giver.

original: gtong ba po dang / so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas lta bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gtong ba po dang / so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas lta bu ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not like the giver who is an ordinary person, a śrāvaka, or a pratyekabuddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la btang bas gzhi mchog go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la btang bas gzhi mchog go //
translated: Because it is given to the bodhisattva, the basis is the best.

original: dngos po ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'i nang nas nang gi dngos po mchog go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dngos po ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'i nang nas nang gi dngos po mchog go zhes bya ba la /
translated: Of the material things, the supreme is the inner one.

original: sbyin pa'i dngos po yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dngos po yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The material things are of three kinds:

original: zang zing sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / chos sbyin pa'o //🔽zang zing sbyin pa la yang rnam pa @37a * //
analyzed: zang zing sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / chos sbyin pa'o // zang zing sbyin pa la yang rnam pa @37a * //
translated: the giving of material things, the giving of fearlessness, and the giving of Dharma.🔽The giving of material things is of two kinds:

original: gnyis te / nor dang 'bru la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po gtong ba dang / mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa nang gi dngos po gtong ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis te / nor dang 'bru la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po gtong ba dang / mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa nang gi dngos po gtong ba'o //
translated: the giving of external things such as wealth and grain, and the giving of internal things such as one’s head, legs, and arms.

original: de la yang nang gi dngos po mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa gtong ba ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'i nang nas mchog go //
analyzed: de la yang nang gi dngos po mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa gtong ba ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'i nang nas mchog go //
translated: Of these, the giving of internal things such as one’s head, legs, and arms is the supreme among the material gifts.

original: ngan song dang 'khor bar 'jigs pa med pa'i sbyin pa de 'jigs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngan song dang 'khor bar 'jigs pa med pa'i sbyin pa de 'jigs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The gift of fearlessness is the gift to those who are afraid of the lower realms and saṃsāra.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The giving of fearlessness is of two kinds:

original: 'phral du mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / yun du mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phral du mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / yun du mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: the giving of immediate fearlessness and the giving of long-term fearlessness.

original: 'phral du mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni rgyal po dang rkun po dang me dang chu la sogs pas 'jigs pa'i skyabs byed pa'o //🔽yun du mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni ngan song du skye ba'i 'jigs pa 'khor bar skye ba'i 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'phral du mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni rgyal po dang rkun po dang me dang chu la sogs pas 'jigs pa'i skyabs byed pa'o // yun du mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni ngan song du skye ba'i 'jigs pa 'khor bar skye ba'i 'jigs pa ste /
translated: Giving fearlessness is giving freedom from fear in the present, by protecting from the fear of kings, thieves, fire, water, etc.🔽Giving freedom from fear in the future is giving freedom from the fear of birth in the lower realms and the fear of birth in samsara.🔽Giving freedom from fear in both respects is giving freedom from fear in the present and in the future.🔽Giving freedom from fear in the present is giving freedom from fear of birth in the lower realms and samsara.

original: de gnyis su mi skye bar skyabs byas pas ni yun du mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis su mi skye bar skyabs byas pas ni yun du mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ste /
translated: Giving freedom from fear in both respects is giving freedom from fear in the present and in the future.🔽Giving freedom from fear in the present is giving freedom from fear of birth in the lower realms and samsara.🔽Giving freedom from fear in both respects is giving freedom from fear in the present and in the future.

original: ngan song dang 'khor bar skye ba'i 'jigs pa med pa byin na mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i mchog go //🔽de la so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rgyud la 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong ba skyed de /🔽rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa'am /
analyzed: ngan song dang 'khor bar skye ba'i 'jigs pa med pa byin na mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i mchog go // de la so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rgyud la 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong ba skyed de / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa'am /
translated: Giving freedom from fear in the present is giving freedom from fear of birth in the lower realms and samsara.🔽Giving freedom from fear in both respects is giving freedom from fear in the present and in the future.🔽Giving freedom from fear in the present is giving freedom from fear of birth in the lower realms and samsara.🔽Giving freedom from fear in both respects is giving freedom from fear in the present and in the future.🔽Giving freedom from fear in the present is giving freedom from fear of birth in the lower realms and samsara.🔽Giving freedom from fear in both respects is giving freedom from fear in the present and in the future.🔽Giving freedom from fear in the present is giving freedom from fear of birth in the lower realms and samsara.🔽Giving freedom from fear in both respects is giving freedom from fear in the present and in the future.🔽Giving freedom from fear in the present is giving freedom from fear of birth in the lower realms and samsara.🔽Giving freedom from fear in both respects is giving freedom from fear in the present and in the future.🔽Giving freedom from fear in the present is giving freedom from fear of birth in the lower realms and samsara.🔽Giving freedom from fear in both respects is giving freedom from fear in the present and in the future.🔽Giving freedom from fear in the present is giving freedom from fear of birth in the lower realms and samsara.🔽Giving freedom from fear in both respects is giving freedom from fear in the present and in the future.

original: sa dang po la bkod na ngan song gi 'jigs pa las skyabs pa yin te /🔽ci'i phyir zhe na bden pa mthong ba rnams 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dang po la bkod na ngan song gi 'jigs pa las skyabs pa yin te /🔽ci'i phyir zhe na bden pa mthong ba rnams 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Giving freedom from fear in the present is giving freedom from fear of birth in the lower realms and samsara.🔽Giving freedom from fear in both respects is giving freedom from fear in the

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / sa dang po la zhugs pa rnams dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gzhag pa'am /🔽sangs rgyas la bkod pa ni 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa las skyabs pa yin te /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de phan chad nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / sa dang po la zhugs pa rnams dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gzhag pa'am / sangs rgyas la bkod pa ni 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa las skyabs pa yin te / de ci'i phyir zhe na / de phan chad nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: To establish stream-enterers and those who have entered the first stage in the fruit of arhatship,🔽or to establish them in Buddhahood, is to protect them from the dangers of cyclic existence.🔽Why is that?🔽Because they are no longer born by the power of the afflictions.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The gift of the Dharma is the Great Vehicle.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa la yang 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag dang sman dpyad dang / byad dang gtar ka sbyin pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sbyin pa yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa la yang 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag dang sman dpyad dang / byad dang gtar ka sbyin pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sbyin pa yang yod mod kyi /
translated: The gift of the Dharma is also the gift of worldly treatises, of medical prescriptions, of astrology, of blood-letting, and of the Dharma of the Sravakayana and the Pratyekabuddhayana.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos bshad de byin na chos sbyin pa'i mchog yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos bshad de byin na chos sbyin pa'i mchog yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But when one explains and gives the Dharma of the Great Vehicle, that is the best gift of the Dharma.

original: mtshan ma snying rje'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan ma snying rje'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sign is compassion.

original: mtshan ma dang rgyu dag ces bya ba don gcig ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang rgyu dag ces bya ba don gcig ste /
translated: The sign and the cause are synonymous.

original: tshe 'dir sbyin pa yongs su gtong bar byed pa'i mtshan ma ni snying rje ste /
analyzed: tshe 'dir sbyin pa yongs su gtong bar byed pa'i mtshan ma ni snying rje ste /
translated: The sign of giving in this life is compassion.

original: sems can yo byad kyis phongs te sdug bsngal ba rnams mthong nas snying rje'i dbang gis gtong bar byed de /
analyzed: sems can yo byad kyis phongs te sdug bsngal ba rnams mthong nas snying rje'i dbang gis gtong bar byed de /
translated: Having seen beings who are suffering from the lack of necessities, one gives through the power of compassion.

original: snying rje'i rgyus gtong bas na @37b mtshan ma mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje'i rgyus gtong bas na @37b mtshan ma mchog ces bya'o //
translated: Since one gives through the cause of compassion, it is called the supreme sign.

original: bsngo ba des byang chub chen po'i 'bras bur 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsngo ba des byang chub chen po'i 'bras bur 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: By that dedication, one desires the result of great enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa yongs su btang ba yang lha dang mi la sogs pa'i longs spyod 'dod pa'i phyir bsngo ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa yongs su btang ba yang lha dang mi la sogs pa'i longs spyod 'dod pa'i phyir bsngo ba ma yin zhing /
translated: The bodhisattva's giving is not dedicated for the sake of desiring the enjoyments of gods, humans, and so on.

original: nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir sngo bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir sngo bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not dedicated for the sake of attaining the hearers' nirvana.

original: byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngo ste de bas na bsngo ba mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngo ste de bas na bsngo ba mchog ces bya'o //
translated: It is dedicated for the sake of attaining the result of great enlightenment. Therefore it is called the supreme dedication.

original: rgyu ni sngon sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa'i bag chags so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu ni sngon sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa'i bag chags so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cause is the instinct for the cultivation of the perfection of generosity in the past.

original: 'di ltar tshe rabs gzhan du 'dod la ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum gyis yang dag par zin pa'i sems pa sbyin pa la sogs pa yang dag par spyad pa las goms par byas nas kun gzhi la bag chags brlan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe rabs gzhan du 'dod la ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum gyis yang dag par zin pa'i sems pa sbyin pa la sogs pa yang dag par spyad pa las goms par byas nas kun gzhi la bag chags brlan te /
translated: Thus, in other lives, one has cultivated the practice of generosity, etc., with a thought that is well-taken hold of by the three roots of virtue, i.e., non-attachment, etc. The instinct is moistened in the store-consciousness.

original: bag chags kyi dbang gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug par byed pa de ni rgyu mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi dbang gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug par byed pa de ni rgyu mchog ces bya'o //
translated: The cause of the engagement in the perfection of generosity by the power of the instinct is called the supreme cause.

original: mtshan ma dang rgyu gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod nas rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ce na /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang rgyu gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod nas rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ce na /
translated: What is the difference between a sign and a cause, since they are both posited as two?

original: rgyu ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: rgyu ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause is the uncommon cause.

original: dper na myu gu la sa bon lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu la sa bon lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the seed is for the sprout.

original: mtshan ma ni grogs su byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni grogs su byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The sign is the cause that acts as a companion.

original: dper na myu gu de nyid bskyed par bya ba las chu me rlung bzhi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu de nyid bskyed par bya ba las chu me rlung bzhi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the four, earth, water, fire, and wind, are for the production of that sprout.

original: de bzhin sbyin pa'i skabs su yang tshe rabs gzhan du sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba la goms pa'i bag chags ni sa bon lta bu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin sbyin pa'i skabs su yang tshe rabs gzhan du sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba la goms pa'i bag chags ni sa bon lta bu ste /
translated: Likewise, in the context of generosity, the habitual tendencies of being accustomed to generosity and so forth in other lives are like seeds.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyur gzhag go //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyur gzhag go //
translated: They are posited as the uncommon cause.

original: tshe 'dir sems can rnams la snying rje ba ni grogs su byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: tshe 'dir sems can rnams la snying rje ba ni grogs su byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Compassion for sentient beings in this life is the cause of being a friend.

original: sa chu me rlung lta bur gzhag go //
analyzed: sa chu me rlung lta bur gzhag go //
translated: It is posited as being like earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom is nonconceptuality.

original: ye shes mchog ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zin pas na ye shes mchog ste /
analyzed: ye shes mchog ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zin pas na ye shes mchog ste /
translated: The supreme wisdom is the supreme wisdom that is embraced by nonconceptual wisdom.
