original: ye shes gang gis gtong ba po'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / sbyin pa'i nor dang len pa'i gang zag gsum yod par mi rtog pas 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa'i tshul du sbyin pa byed pas na ye shes mchog go //🔽slong ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ye shes gang gis gtong ba po'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / sbyin pa'i nor dang len pa'i gang zag gsum yod par mi rtog pas 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa'i tshul du sbyin pa byed pas na ye shes mchog go // slong ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The supreme wisdom is the wisdom by which the bodhisattva who is the giver, the wealth that is given, and the person who is the recipient are not conceptualized, and thus generosity is performed in the manner of not observing the three spheres.

original: sbyin pa'i zhing lnga ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i zhing lnga ste /
translated: Begging is the five fields of generosity.

original: bram ze dang tshong pa la sogs pa cung zad yod kyang slong bar byed pa ni slong ba'i zhing zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze dang tshong pa la sogs pa cung zad yod kyang slong bar byed pa ni slong ba'i zhing zhes bya'o //
translated: Brahmins, merchants, and so on, who beg even though they have a little wealth, are called “fields of begging.”

original: nad pa la sogs pa ni sdug bsngal ba'i zhing zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa la sogs pa ni sdug bsngal ba'i zhing zhes bya'o //
translated: The sick and so on are called “fields of suffering.”

original: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pas phongs pa rnams ni mgon med pa'i zhing zhes bya'o //🔽zang zing gi @38a * //
analyzed: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pas phongs pa rnams ni mgon med pa'i zhing zhes bya'o // zang zing gi @38a * //
translated: Those who are destitute of food, clothing, and so on are called “fields of the helpless.”

original: phyir srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdig pa byed pa rnams ni log par spyod pa'i rang bzhin gyi zhing zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdig pa byed pa rnams ni log par spyod pa'i rang bzhin gyi zhing zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who commit evil deeds such as killing for the sake of material things are called “fields of the nature of wrong conduct.”

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i gang zag ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i zhing zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i gang zag ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i zhing zhes bya'o //
translated: Persons who possess good qualities such as moral discipline and wisdom are called “fields of good qualities.”

original: zhing ni gcig pas gcig dam pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhing ni gcig pas gcig dam pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: One field is superior to another.

original: nyan thos dang / 'jig rten pa'i tshul gyis ni slong ba'i zhing pas sdug bsngal gyi zhing dam pa nas log par spyod pa'i zhing pas yon tan dang ldan pa'i zhing dam par gzhag go //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / 'jig rten pa'i tshul gyis ni slong ba'i zhing pas sdug bsngal gyi zhing dam pa nas log par spyod pa'i zhing pas yon tan dang ldan pa'i zhing dam par gzhag go //
translated: The fields of the poor, the sick, and the virtuous are the best fields for the worldling and the śrāvaka.

original: de lta mod kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni slar bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni slar bzlog pa ste /
translated: But the bodhisattva is the opposite.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa'i zhing bas log par spyod pa'i zhing dam pa yin pas na sdug bsngal ba'i zhing pas kyang slong ba'i zhing dam pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa'i zhing bas log par spyod pa'i zhing dam pa yin pas na sdug bsngal ba'i zhing pas kyang slong ba'i zhing dam pa yin te /
translated: The field of the virtuous is the best field for the bodhisattva, and the field of the poor is the best field for the bodhisattva.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zhing gong ma bzhi po rnams la gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zhing gong ma bzhi po rnams la gtong bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva gives to the four superior fields.

original: gal te gong ma bzhi po med na lnga pa ste yon tan gyi zhing la gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: gal te gong ma bzhi po med na lnga pa ste yon tan gyi zhing la gtong bar byed do //
translated: If the four superior fields do not exist, he gives to the fifth, the field of virtues.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang dag bsod nams 'phel zhing longs spyod 'dod pa de dag ni yon tan can gyi zhing la gtong bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gang dag bsod nams 'phel zhing longs spyod 'dod pa de dag ni yon tan can gyi zhing la gtong bar byed pa yin na /
translated: Those who wish to increase their merit and enjoyments give to the field of virtues.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsod nams 'phel ba dang longs spyod kyi don du sbyin pa gtong ba ma yin gyi //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsod nams 'phel ba dang longs spyod kyi don du sbyin pa gtong ba ma yin gyi //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give gifts for the sake of increasing his merit or for the sake of wealth.🔽He gives gifts in order to remove the suffering of those sentient beings who are suffering, who are in distress, and who are in a miserable condition.

original: sems can sdug bsngal ba dang brel ba dang / phongs pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa gtong bar byed pas slong ba'i zhing dang sdug bsngal gyi zhing la gtong bar byed kyi yon tan gyi zhing la mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba dang brel ba dang / phongs pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa gtong bar byed pas slong ba'i zhing dang sdug bsngal gyi zhing la gtong bar byed kyi yon tan gyi zhing la mi gtong ngo //
translated: He gives to the field of those who ask and to the field of suffering, but not to the field of virtues.

original: gnas pa ni gang la gnas nas gtong ba rnams te zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: gnas pa ni gang la gnas nas gtong ba rnams te zhes bya ba las /
translated: The bases are those on which one who gives relies.

original: gnas pa ni yid la byed pa gang la gnas nas phyi nang gi dngos po gtong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni yid la byed pa gang la gnas nas phyi nang gi dngos po gtong bar byed pa ste /
translated: The bases are those on which one who gives relies in order to give external and internal things.

original: de yang mos pa la gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa la gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ste gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang mos pa la gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa la gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ste gsum mo //
translated: There are three of them: the base of devotion, the base of attention, and the base of concentration.

original: mos pa ni ji ltar bsgom pa rnam par dbye ba las mos pa yid la byed pa gsum pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mos pa ni ji ltar bsgom pa rnam par dbye ba las mos pa yid la byed pa gsum pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Devotion is as described in the chapter entitled “The Investigation of Devotion.”

original: mos pa la gnas pa ni gong du bsgom pa rnam par dbye ba bshad pa'i rjes su mos pa yid la byed pa gsungs pa de la bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa la gnas pa ni gong du bsgom pa rnam par dbye ba bshad pa'i rjes su mos pa yid la byed pa gsungs pa de la bya ste /
translated: Abiding in interest refers to attention that is interest in the above explanation of the classification of meditation because it is said that attention is interest.

original: de'i skabs su yang ji ltar bshad ce na /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la /
analyzed: de'i skabs su yang ji ltar bshad ce na / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la /
translated: How is that explained?

original: 'di ni ma nor par bshad pa @38b legs par gsungs pa yin no zhes dang pa dang / dad pa stug pos mos shing dad par byed pa'o //🔽yid la byed pa ni ji ltar de nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ni ma nor par bshad pa @38b legs par gsungs pa yin no zhes dang pa dang / dad pa stug pos mos shing dad par byed pa'o // yid la byed pa ni ji ltar de nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is interest in the Mahayana sutras that possess the six perfections from the perfection of generosity to the perfection of wisdom, thinking, This is the unmistaken explanation, the well spoken teachings and it is interest that is generated through thick faith.

original: yid la byed pa la gnas pa ni ji ltar sgom pa rnams par dbye ba bshad pa'i skabs de nyid las yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum bshad pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa la gnas pa ni ji ltar sgom pa rnams par dbye ba bshad pa'i skabs de nyid las yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum bshad pa ste /
translated: Attention refers to the three types of attention explained in the above section on the classification of meditation.

original: de yang ro myang ba yid la byed pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa dang / mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ro myang ba yid la byed pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa dang / mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Furthermore, it is the attention of savoring, the attention of rejoicing, and the attention of delight.

original: de la sngon sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa btang ba dran nas bdag gis sngon sbyin ba btang ba ni legs so snyam du yon tan gyi tshul du lta ba ni ro myang ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sngon sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa btang ba dran nas bdag gis sngon sbyin ba btang ba ni legs so snyam du yon tan gyi tshul du lta ba ni ro myang ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attention of savoring is the view of the way of virtues, thinking, “It is good that I formerly gave gifts and so on, the perfections,” when one remembers the former giving of gifts and so on.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas sems can rnams kyis sbyin pa byas pa la sems dga' ba ni rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas sems can rnams kyis sbyin pa byas pa la sems dga' ba ni rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The attention of rejoicing is the delight in the giving of gifts by sentient beings in the world systems of the ten directions.

original: ma 'ongs pa na gar skyes gar skyes kyang sbyin pa byed par 'gyur bar dga' ba dang / sems can rnams kyang ma 'ongs pa nas gar skyes gar skyes kyang sbyin pa byed par 'gyur bar dga' ba ni mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na gar skyes gar skyes kyang sbyin pa byed par 'gyur bar dga' ba dang / sems can rnams kyang ma 'ongs pa nas gar skyes gar skyes kyang sbyin pa byed par 'gyur bar dga' ba ni mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attention of delight is the delight in giving gifts wherever one is born in the future, and the delight in the giving of gifts by sentient beings wherever they are born in the future.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa ste /
translated: Concentration is the sky treasury and so on.

original: de ltar de nyid la 'byor pa yod par gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba la /🔽ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam gyis nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgrubs nas dngos po ci dang ci 'dod pa dag nam mkha'
analyzed: de ltar de nyid la 'byor pa yod par gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba la / ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam gyis nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgrubs nas dngos po ci dang ci 'dod pa dag nam mkha'
translated: Thus it is said that mastery exists in that.

original: las blangs shing gtong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: las blangs shing gtong bar byed pa ste /
translated: Those abiding in concentration are bodhisattvas who have entered the eighth and so on and, through the noncomposite path, having accomplished the concentrations such as the sky treasury, they take and give whatever things they wish from the sky.

original: de yang sgom pa rnam par dbye ba'i skabs su 'byor pa rnam pa gsum bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de yang sgom pa rnam par dbye ba'i skabs su 'byor pa rnam pa gsum bshad pa ste /
translated: This is explained in the chapter on the classification of meditation as the three types of mastery.

original: nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'byor pa rnams pa gsum gyi phyogs gcig tu gtogs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'byor pa rnams pa gsum gyi phyogs gcig tu gtogs so //
translated: The concentrations such as the sky treasury belong to one part of the three types of mastery.

original: 'byor pa rnam pa gsum ni sku la dbang ba dang / spyod pa la dbang ba dang / ston pa la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa rnam pa gsum ni sku la dbang ba dang / spyod pa la dbang ba dang / ston pa la dbang ba'o //
translated: The three types of mastery are mastery over body, mastery over enjoyment and mastery over teaching.

original: de la sku la dbang ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku dang / rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: de la sku la dbang ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku dang / rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku ste /
translated: Mastery of body refers to the Dharma Body and the Beatific Body of the Tathagata.

original: sku de gnyis kyis sbyin pa thogs pa med par mdzad do //
analyzed: sku de gnyis kyis sbyin pa thogs pa med par mdzad do //
translated: By means of these two bodies, giving is practiced without obstruction.

original: spyod pa la dbang ba ni sprul pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: spyod pa la dbang ba ni sprul pa'i sku ste /
translated: Mastery of action refers to the Transformation Body.

original: sprul pa'i sku gang gis sems can rnams la sna tshogs kyi lus su sprul nas sbyin pa la sogs pa 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku gang gis sems can rnams la sna tshogs kyi lus su sprul nas sbyin pa la sogs pa 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: By means of the Transformation Body, having emanated various bodies for sentient beings, one practices giving and so forth.

original: ston pa la dbang yod pa ni @39a * //
analyzed: ston pa la dbang yod pa ni @39a * //
translated: Mastery of teaching refers to

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug thogs pa med pa dang chags pa med pa dang ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug thogs pa med pa dang chags pa med pa dang ma chad pa'o //
translated: the six perfections, which are practiced without obstruction, without attachment, and without interruption.

original: de yang gang gis zhes bya bas bstan par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang gang gis zhes bya bas bstan par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that this is taught by the words “by means of which.”

original: mchog rnam pa brgyad kyang gang gis gtong zhes bya ba la sogs pa las brtsams nas bstan par rig par bya ste gang gis gtong zhe na /
analyzed: mchog rnam pa brgyad kyang gang gis gtong zhes bya ba la sogs pa las brtsams nas bstan par rig par bya ste gang gis gtong zhe na /
translated: It should be understood that this is taught beginning with the question, “By means of which of the eight kinds of supremacy is giving practiced?”🔽By means of which is giving practiced?

original: gzhis gtong ngo //
analyzed: gzhis gtong ngo //
translated: By means of the basis.

original: gang gtong zhe na /
analyzed: gang gtong zhe na /
translated: What is given?

original: dngos po gtong ngo //
analyzed: dngos po gtong ngo //
translated: Things are given.

original: gang gis gtong zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis gtong zhe na /
translated: By what is it given?

original: mtshan mas gtong ngo //
analyzed: mtshan mas gtong ngo //
translated: It is given by the signs.

original: gang gi phyir gtong zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtong zhe na /
translated: For what reason is it given?

original: bsngo ba ste byang chub mchog gi phyir gtong ngo //
analyzed: bsngo ba ste byang chub mchog gi phyir gtong ngo //
translated: It is given for the sake of supreme enlightenment.

original: gang las gtong zhe na /
analyzed: gang las gtong zhe na /
translated: From what is it given?

original: tshe rabs snga ma la sbyin pa la goms pa'i bag chags kyi rgyus gtong ngo//
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la sbyin pa la goms pa'i bag chags kyi rgyus gtong ngo//
translated: It is given from the habit energy of the practice of giving in previous lives.🔽By what is it taken up?

original: gang gis gzung zhe na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gzung ngo //
analyzed: gang gis gzung zhe na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gzung ngo //
translated: It is taken up by nonconceptual intuition.

original: gang du gtong zhe na /
analyzed: gang du gtong zhe na /
translated: To what is it given?

original: zhing rnam pa lnga la gtong ngo //
analyzed: zhing rnam pa lnga la gtong ngo //
translated: It is given to the five kinds of fields.

original: rnam pa ji snyed kyis gtong zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa ji snyed kyis gtong zhe na /
translated: By what modes is it given?

original: mos pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum la gnas nas gtong ngo //
analyzed: mos pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum la gnas nas gtong ngo //
translated: It is given by abiding in the three modes of aspiration, etc.

original: de la tshul khrims la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnam pa bzhi dang mtshan ma la sogs pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa dang mthun pas tshul de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnam pa bzhi dang mtshan ma la sogs pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa dang mthun pas tshul de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: The four remaining perfections, beginning with morality, and the signs, etc., are explained in the same way as the perfection of giving.

original: dngos po dang zhing gnyis ni mi mthun te de'i bye brag ci yod pa bshad do //
analyzed: dngos po dang zhing gnyis ni mi mthun te de'i bye brag ci yod pa bshad do //
translated: The substance and the field are not the same. The differences between them will be explained.

original: de la tshul khrims kyi dngos po ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge bar spyod pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyi dngos po ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge bar spyod pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The substance of morality is the morality of restraint, the morality of taking hold of what is wholesome, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bzod pa'i dngos po ni gnod pa nyams su len pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i dngos po ni gnod pa nyams su len pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The substance of patience is the patience of accepting suffering, the patience of making light of any injury, and the patience of certainty with respect to the Dharma.

original: brtson 'grus kyi dngos po ni go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dngos po ni go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus la sogs pa'o//
translated: The substance of effort is the armor-effort, the effort of application, and so on.

original: bsam gtan gyi dngos po ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dngos po ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The substance of contemplation is the contemplation that is a happy state in this present life, the contemplation that accomplishes the superknowledges, and the contemplation that acts for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyi dngos po ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa shes pa'i shes rab dang / don dam pa'i bden pa shes pa'i shes rab dang / sems can gyi don sgrub par shes pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dngos po ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa shes pa'i shes rab dang / don dam pa'i bden pa shes pa'i shes rab dang / sems can gyi don sgrub par shes pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The substance of wisdom is the wisdom that knows the conventional truth, the wisdom that knows the ultimate truth, and the wisdom that knows how to accomplish the aims of sentient beings.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa de dag thams cad kyi zhing ni theg pa chen po'i chos te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa de dag thams cad kyi zhing ni theg pa chen po'i chos te /
translated: The domain of all these perfections is the teaching of the Great Vehicle.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la dmigs shing sems can rnams der bkod na ni zhing mchog la bkod pa zhes mi bya'i /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la dmigs shing sems can rnams der bkod na ni zhing mchog la bkod pa zhes mi bya'i /
translated: If one focuses on the disciples and hermit buddhas and establishes sentient beings in those, that is not called “establishing them in the highest vehicle.”

original: theg pa @39b chen po'i chos la dmigs shing theg pa chen po'i chos la sems can bkod na zhing mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa @39b chen po'i chos la dmigs shing theg pa chen po'i chos la sems can bkod na zhing mchog ces bya'o //
translated: If one focuses on the teaching of the Great Vehicle and establishes sentient beings in the teaching of the Great Vehicle, that is called “the highest vehicle.”

original: tshul khrims kyi nang na mchog ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi nang na mchog ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Among the moral disciplines, the highest is the vow of the bodhisattva.

original: sbyin pa'i dngos po la mchog dang mchog ma yin par phye ba bzhin du //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dngos po la mchog dang mchog ma yin par phye ba bzhin du //
translated: Just as the substance of generosity is distinguished as higher and lower,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ltag ma rnams kyi dngos po la mchog dang mchog ma yin par dbye ba ston te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ltag ma rnams kyi dngos po la mchog dang mchog ma yin par dbye ba ston te /
translated: The next perfections show the classification of the best and worst things in the actual perfections.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dge ba bcu'i tshul khrims dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims pas //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dge ba bcu'i tshul khrims dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims pas //
translated: The morality of the ten mundane virtues, the morality of the disciples and hermit buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni tshul khrims kyi nang na mchog ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni tshul khrims kyi nang na mchog ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the morality of the bodhisattva vow, the morality of working for the welfare of living beings, and the morality of gathering virtue are called the best of moralities.

original: bzod pa yi ni ngan pa dang // nyam chung ba dang srog gcod pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzod pa yi ni ngan pa dang // nyam chung ba dang srog gcod pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The worst of forbearances is the forbearance of the weak and the forbearance of those who take life.

original: bzod pa'i dngos po'i mchog ni rgyal po dang blon po la sogs pa'i mthu che ba'i mchog dang dbang che ba rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa bzod pa ni ngo mtshar du bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bzod pa'i dngos po'i mchog ni rgyal po dang blon po la sogs pa'i mthu che ba'i mchog dang dbang che ba rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa bzod pa ni ngo mtshar du bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The best thing in forbearance is the forbearance of those who are the best and most powerful, such as kings and ministers, who have done harm. That is not to be wondered at.

original: sprang po dang gdol bu la sogs pa mthu chung zhing dbang chung ba rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa bzod pa mchog yin pa dang / thal mo dang khur tshur gyis rdeg pa tsam bzod pa ni ngo mtshar du bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sprang po dang gdol bu la sogs pa mthu chung zhing dbang chung ba rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa bzod pa mchog yin pa dang / thal mo dang khur tshur gyis rdeg pa tsam bzod pa ni ngo mtshar du bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not something to be amazed at to bear the harm of a mere slap or blow.

original: gang gis srog la gnod par 'gyur ba'i gnod pa byas kyang bzod pa ni bzod pa'i nang na mchog go //
analyzed: gang gis srog la gnod par 'gyur ba'i gnod pa byas kyang bzod pa ni bzod pa'i nang na mchog go //
translated: But to bear the harm that endangers one's life is the best kind of patience.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa dang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'o zhes bya ba la /🔽brtson 'grus la yang dge ba bsdu ba tsam sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa dang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'o zhes bya ba la / brtson 'grus la yang dge ba bsdu ba tsam sgrub pa'am /
translated: The perfection of effort is the cultivation of effort and the abandonment of its opposing factors.🔽Effort is not supreme when it is merely the accomplishment of the collection of virtue,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi dge ba tsam sgrub pa ni mchog ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi dge ba tsam sgrub pa ni mchog ma yin gyi /
translated: or the mere accomplishment of the virtue of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub cing /
translated: It is supreme when it is the accomplishment of the Bodhisattva's practice, the six perfections such as generosity,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa spong bar byed pa ni brtson 'grus kyi mchog yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa spong bar byed pa ni brtson 'grus kyi mchog yin no //
translated: The highest effort is the abandonment of stinginess, etc., which are the resistances to the perfections.

original: bsam gtan gyi ni byang chub sems dpa' te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ni byang chub sems dpa' te /
translated: The bodhisattva is the highest in meditative absorption.

original: 'dzin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dzin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is the one who holds.

original: nyan thos dang 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan ni mchog ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan ni mchog ma yin te /
translated: The meditative absorption of the sravakas and mundane folk is not the highest.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams mchog go //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams mchog go //
translated: The bodhisattva's meditative absorptions, such as the Heroic stride, etc., are the highest.

original: shes rab kyi ni yang dag pa nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi ni yang dag pa nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: The highest wisdom is the reality limit.

original: shes rab kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang kun rdzob kyi chos shes pa mchog ma yin gyi /🔽gang zag dang chos la @40a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang kun rdzob kyi chos shes pa mchog ma yin gyi / gang zag dang chos la @40a * //
translated: The wisdom of mundane folk and of the sravakas, which is the knowledge of conventional phenomena, is not the highest.

original: bdag med pa'i shes pa ni shes rab kyi mchog go //🔽sbyin pas sems can gcig pa bde phyir //🔽bskal pa mang por gnod byed kyang //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i shes pa ni shes rab kyi mchog go // sbyin pas sems can gcig pa bde phyir // bskal pa mang por gnod byed kyang //
translated: The knowledge of the selflessness of persons and things is the highest wisdom.🔽The bodhisattva is happy even when harmed for many eons

original: byang chub sems dpa' dgar 'gyur na //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dgar 'gyur na //
translated: for the sake of the happiness of a single being.

original: de las bzlog pa ci zhig smos //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ci zhig smos //
translated: What need to speak of the opposite?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bdun zhig gis sbyin pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bdun zhig gis sbyin pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: These seven verses show the qualities of generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdag la bdog pa'i longs spyod thams cad btang nas sems can gcig cig bde bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdag la bdog pa'i longs spyod thams cad btang nas sems can gcig cig bde bar 'gyur la /
translated: Bodhisattvas give away all the possessions they have and make a single sentient being happy.🔽Even if, after giving it away, they themselves are harmed for countless hundreds of thousands of eons by the suffering of poverty and deprivation, if they see that a single sentient being is happy, they are delighted.

original: de btang ba'i 'og tu bdag nyid ni bskal ba brgya stong grangs med par brel ba dang phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gnod par gyur kyang sems can gcig bde bar mthong nas thugs dgyes pa skye na de las bzlog pa lta ci zhig smos te /🔽chos gtang ba'i sbyin pas sems can mtha' yas pa yang bde ba dang phan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de btang ba'i 'og tu bdag nyid ni bskal ba brgya stong grangs med par brel ba dang phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gnod par gyur kyang sems can gcig bde bar mthong nas thugs dgyes pa skye na de las bzlog pa lta ci zhig smos te / chos gtang ba'i sbyin pas sems can mtha' yas pa yang bde ba dang phan par 'gyur la /
translated: What need is there to mention the opposite of that?🔽By giving away the Dharma, they make infinite sentient beings happy and benefit them.🔽And by giving away what is of ultimate benefit and happiness to themselves, they are delighted.

original: bdag nyid kyang mthar yun du phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba btang nas dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod thams cad btang nas sems can dpag tu med pa yang bde bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang mthar yun du phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba btang nas dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod thams cad btang nas sems can dpag tu med pa yang bde bar 'gyur la /
translated: By giving away all their possessions, they make infinite sentient beings happy.

original: bdag kyang bskal pa mang por bde bar 'gyur ba sems can gzhan la btang nas byang chub sems dpa' dgyes pa skye ba lta ci zhig smos te /
analyzed: bdag kyang bskal pa mang por bde bar 'gyur ba sems can gzhan la btang nas byang chub sems dpa' dgyes pa skye ba lta ci zhig smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention that a bodhisattva is delighted when he gives to other sentient beings the happiness that he himself has accumulated over many eons?

original: dgyes pa cher skye so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgyes pa cher skye so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is greatly delighted.🔽Because of the excellence of compassion. The meaning is that the thought and the giving of that gift are given out of compassion.

original: snying rje'i khyad par gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa de lta bu skye ba dang / sbyin pa de lta bu gtong ba yang snying rje'i rgyus gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying rje'i khyad par gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa de lta bu skye ba dang / sbyin pa de lta bu gtong ba yang snying rje'i rgyus gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The one verse beginning with the words,

original: gang gi don du lus can nor 'dod pa //
analyzed: gang gi don du lus can nor 'dod pa //
translated: For the sake of which embodied beings desire wealth,

original: sems can rnams la de nyid blo can gtong //
analyzed: sems can rnams la de nyid blo can gtong //
translated: the wise give to sentient beings that very thing,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis tshigs su bcad pa snga ma rkang pa phyed kyi don phyi ma tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis tshigs su bcad pa snga ma rkang pa phyed kyi don phyi ma tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis bstan to //
translated: teaches the meaning of the latter half of the previous verse with the former half of this verse.

original: lus can ni sems can la bya ste /
analyzed: lus can ni sems can la bya ste /
translated: Embodied beings refers to sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams gang gi don dang / gang gi ched dang / gang la phangs pa dang / gang gces par bya ba'i don du nor dang longs spyod btsal ba'i gces pa'i dngos po de nyid blo can byang chub sems dpa' rnams lus can te /
analyzed: sems can rnams gang gi don dang / gang gi ched dang / gang la phangs pa dang / gang gces par bya ba'i don du nor dang longs spyod btsal ba'i gces pa'i dngos po de nyid blo can byang chub sems dpa' rnams lus can te /
translated: The wise bodhisattvas give to sentient beings that very thing which is most precious for the sake of sentient beings, for the sake of which sentient beings seek wealth and possessions, for the sake of which they are hurt, and for the sake of which they are cherished.

original: sems can rnams la gtong zhing sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gtong zhing sbyin par byed do //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, they give and bestow that very thing which is most precious.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽skye bo lus kyi phyir ni nor 'dod pa //
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / skye bo lus kyi phyir ni nor 'dod pa //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this point,

original: blo can gyis ni de nyid rnam brgyar gtong //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: blo can gyis ni de nyid rnam brgyar gtong // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The wise give away their bodies hundreds of times for the sake of the bodies of beings.

original: sems can rnams ni lus dang srog gi don dang ched du nor tshol zhing nor sogs @40b par byed na /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni lus dang srog gi don dang ched du nor tshol zhing nor sogs @40b par byed na /
translated: Sentient beings seek wealth and accumulate wealth for the sake of their bodies and lives.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo can gyis ni lus dang srog gi don du nor btsal ba'i lus dang srog de nyid slong ba po rnams la lan brgya stong du mar gtong zhing sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo can gyis ni lus dang srog gi don du nor btsal ba'i lus dang srog de nyid slong ba po rnams la lan brgya stong du mar gtong zhing sbyin par byed do //
translated: The wise bodhisattvas give to beggars their very bodies and lives, which are the wealth they have sought for the sake of their bodies and lives, hundreds of times.

original: gang tshe lus nyid gtong byed kyang //
analyzed: gang tshe lus nyid gtong byed kyang //
translated: When one gives away even one’s body,

original: yid kyi sdug bsngal mi 'byung na /
analyzed: yid kyi sdug bsngal mi 'byung na /
translated: and mental suffering does not arise,

original: nor ngan ci smos de yi 'jig rten 'das //
analyzed: nor ngan ci smos de yi 'jig rten 'das //
translated: what need to mention material goods?

original: de des dga' rnyed de ni de yi mchog //
analyzed: de des dga' rnyed de ni de yi mchog //
translated: That is the transcendent, the highest.

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog yin par ston to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog yin par ston to //
translated: This verse shows that the bodhisattva’s generosity is transcendent and is the highest transcendence.

original: 'jig ltar 'jig rten pa rnams ni phyi'i dngos po btang nas kyang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba skye la /
analyzed: 'jig ltar 'jig rten pa rnams ni phyi'i dngos po btang nas kyang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba skye la /
translated: Worldly people, when they give away external things, experience suffering and mental unhappiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po rnams la phongs pa med par lus de nyid lan brgya stong du mar btang yang sems la sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba mi 'byung na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po rnams la phongs pa med par lus de nyid lan brgya stong du mar btang yang sems la sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba mi 'byung na /
translated: But when bodhisattvas give away their very bodies to beggars, without any sense of loss, and their minds do not experience suffering and mental unhappiness,

original: nang gi dngos po la ltos na tha shal du gyur pa'i nor dang / longs spyod btang nas yid mi bde ba mi 'byung ba lta ci zhig smos te /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po la ltos na tha shal du gyur pa'i nor dang / longs spyod btang nas yid mi bde ba mi 'byung ba lta ci zhig smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention that he does not become unhappy when he gives away his wealth and possessions, which are inferior in comparison to his inner goods?

original: de ltar nang gi dngos po btang nas kyang yid mi bde ba mi 'byung bas na byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa de 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nang gi dngos po btang nas kyang yid mi bde ba mi 'byung bas na byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa de 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because he does not become unhappy when he gives away his inner goods, the bodhisattva's generosity is called supramundane.

original: yid mi bde ba mi 'byung bar yang ma zad kyi nang gi dngos po btang na sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par mthong ste dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba mi 'byung bar yang ma zad kyi nang gi dngos po btang na sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par mthong ste dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Not only does he not become unhappy, but when he gives away his inner goods, he sees that he is helping sentient beings and so he becomes joyful.

original: gang dga' ba'i sems skyes pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dga' ba'i sems skyes pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog ces bya'o //
translated: That joyful mind is called the highest supramundane.

original: blo can 'di la sbyin pa kun yod pas //
analyzed: blo can 'di la sbyin pa kun yod pas //
translated: The wise one has all the kinds of generosity here,

original: slong ba dga' bas ji ltar dga' 'gyur pa //🔽byin blangs 'dod pa chog par 'dod pa ni //
analyzed: slong ba dga' bas ji ltar dga' 'gyur pa // byin blangs 'dod pa chog par 'dod pa ni //
translated: so the petitioner becomes happy.🔽But the one who is satisfied with what he has received and does not want more

original: de ltar slong bar byed pa'ang dgar mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar slong bar byed pa'ang dgar mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: will not become happy by begging.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo can gyis slong ba po rnams la lus dang srog man chad la longs spyod yan chad ci 'dod pa kun btang ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo can gyis slong ba po rnams la lus dang srog man chad la longs spyod yan chad ci 'dod pa kun btang ste /
translated: The wise bodhisattva gives away everything to beggars, from his body and life down to his possessions and up to his enjoyments, whatever they want.🔽When he sees that the beggars have obtained enjoyments and are happy,

original: 'gro ba slod pa rnams longs spyod thob pas slod ba po dga' bar gyur pa mthong nas //
analyzed: 'gro ba slod pa rnams longs spyod thob pas slod ba po dga' bar gyur pa mthong nas //
translated: he is even happier than the beggars.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' thugs la dgyes pa'i bye brag skye ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' thugs la dgyes pa'i bye brag skye ba ltar /
translated: Just as the bodhisattva experiences a special joy in his mind,🔽the bodhisattva giver, having given wealth to the beggar,

original: gtong ba po byang chub sems dpa' slong ba po la nor byin nas byin pa de slong ba pos blangs te /
analyzed: gtong ba po byang chub sems dpa' slong ba po la nor byin nas byin pa de slong ba pos blangs te /
translated: the beggar takes what he has been given

original: slong ba po gang 'dod pa'i nor yang rnyed /
analyzed: slong ba po gang 'dod pa'i nor yang rnyed /
translated: and obtains the wealth he wanted.

original: ji snyed 'dod par bya ba thams cad chog par yang thob ste /🔽bsam pa rdzogs nas dga' ba'i bye brag skyes nas kyang ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i dgyes pa'i bye brag tsam gyis @41a * //
analyzed: ji snyed 'dod par bya ba thams cad chog par yang thob ste / bsam pa rdzogs nas dga' ba'i bye brag skyes nas kyang ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i dgyes pa'i bye brag tsam gyis @41a * //
translated: He also obtains all the enjoyments he wanted.🔽Having fulfilled his wishes, he experiences a special joy.

original: dga' ba slong ba po rnams la mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dga' ba slong ba po rnams la mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But the joy that the bodhisattva experiences is not experienced by the beggars.

original: blo can kun yod byin pas nor med kyang //
analyzed: blo can kun yod byin pas nor med kyang //
translated: The wise give everything they have, and so, though they have no wealth,

original: ji ltar bdag nyid yod par ldan lta ba //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid yod par ldan lta ba //
translated: They are as rich as if they had.

original: slong bar byed pa longs spyod kun rdzogs pa'ang //
analyzed: slong bar byed pa longs spyod kun rdzogs pa'ang //
translated: The beggars, having received all their possessions,

original: de ltar bdag nyid yod par ldan lta min //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid yod par ldan lta min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Are as poor as if they had received nothing.🔽The wise bodhisattvas give away everything they have, both outer and inner things, to beggars.

original: blo can byang chub sems dpa' rnams slong ba po rnams la phyi dang nang gi dngos po kun btang ste byin nas phyi dang nang du byang chub sems dpa' la nor dang longs spyod cung zad kyang med par gyur kyang thugs rje chen pos yongs su zin par
analyzed: blo can byang chub sems dpa' rnams slong ba po rnams la phyi dang nang gi dngos po kun btang ste byin nas phyi dang nang du byang chub sems dpa' la nor dang longs spyod cung zad kyang med par gyur kyang thugs rje chen pos yongs su zin par
translated: And even though they have nothing left, neither outer possessions nor inner wealth, they are as if filled with great compassion and with the vast attitude of bodhichitta.

original: gyur pa dang / bsam pa rlabs po che dang ldan pas da dung longs spyod dang ldan no snyam du dgongs pa ltar /
analyzed: gyur pa dang / bsam pa rlabs po che dang ldan pas da dung longs spyod dang ldan no snyam du dgongs pa ltar /
translated: They feel that they are still rich.

original: slong ba po rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pas longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs par byas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i dgongs pa ltar /
analyzed: slong ba po rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pas longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs par byas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i dgongs pa ltar /
translated: The beggars, having received the bodhisattvas' gifts, are as if they have received nothing.

original: slong ba po nor dang ldan pa rnams bdag cag la nor yod cing longs spyod dang ldan no snyam du dgongs pa ltar /
analyzed: slong ba po nor dang ldan pa rnams bdag cag la nor yod cing longs spyod dang ldan no snyam du dgongs pa ltar /
translated: The thought of the beggars who have wealth is that we have wealth and enjoyments.

original: bsam pa de tsam gyi rlabs po che mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam pa de tsam gyi rlabs po che mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that such a vast thought does not arise.

original: ji ltar blo can tshul bzhin 'di la sbyin dam pas //
analyzed: ji ltar blo can tshul bzhin 'di la sbyin dam pas //
translated: How do the wise, having given here in the proper way,

original: slong ba tshim byas 'di la phan chen 'du shes brtsi //
analyzed: slong ba tshim byas 'di la phan chen 'du shes brtsi //
translated: Consider this as a great benefit for the beggars?

original: ji ltar shin tu rgya chen dag ni rnyed nas su //🔽slong ba btang bas rnyed rgyus phan pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar shin tu rgya chen dag ni rnyed nas su // slong ba btang bas rnyed rgyus phan pa yin //
translated: How is it that, having obtained what is extremely vast,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The beggars are benefited by the cause of obtaining?

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang byang chub sems dpa' blo can gyis sbyin pa btang ba yang tshul bzhin du gus pa dang / brnyas pa med pa'i tshul gyis slong ba po rnams la sbyin pa dam pa mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa btang nas slong ba po rnams kyi bsam pa rdzogs shing tshim par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang byang chub sems dpa' blo can gyis sbyin pa btang ba yang tshul bzhin du gus pa dang / brnyas pa med pa'i tshul gyis slong ba po rnams la sbyin pa dam pa mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa btang nas slong ba po rnams kyi bsam pa rdzogs shing tshim par bya ste /
translated: In another way, the wise bodhisattvas, having given gifts here in the proper way, with respect and without contempt, fulfill the wishes of the beggars and satisfy them by giving them their heads, legs, arms and so forth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' slong ba po 'di rnams kyis byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs pa'i grogs byas pa'i phyir 'di dag gis bdag la phan btags so snyam du brtsi zhing drin du gzo ba ltar slong ba po rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa shin tu rgya chen🔽po dag nor dang longs spyod dag rnyed nas bsam pa rdzogs par gyur kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' slong ba po 'di rnams kyis byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs pa'i grogs byas pa'i phyir 'di dag gis bdag la phan btags so snyam du brtsi zhing drin du gzo ba ltar slong ba po rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa shin tu rgya chen po dag nor dang longs spyod dag rnyed nas bsam pa rdzogs par gyur kyang /
translated: The bodhisattvas consider that these beggars have helped them by assisting them to complete the accumulations for enlightenment.🔽In the same way, when beggars obtain the bodhisattvas' very extensive generosity, their wealth and possessions, and their wishes are fulfilled,

original: de'i rgyu las byang chub sems dpa'i dgongs pa lta bur phan btags pa dang / drin du gzo ba'i bsam pa de tsam mi skye'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byang chub sems dpa'i dgongs pa lta bur phan btags pa dang / drin du gzo ba'i bsam pa de tsam mi skye'o //
translated: they do not feel the same gratitude and helpfulness as the bodhisattvas do.

original: snying rje'i khyad par gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying rje'i khyad par gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the difference in compassion.

original: dgongs pa de lta bu skye ba dang / sbyin pa de lta bu gtang ba yang snying rje'i rgyus gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgongs pa de lta bu skye ba dang / sbyin pa de lta bu gtang ba yang snying rje'i rgyus gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the wish to give and the giving of such generosity arise from compassion.🔽How the wise give🔽The wise give in such a way that they do not expect

original: ji ltar lam la longs spyod @41b shing 'bras mchog ldan pas //
analyzed: ji ltar lam la longs spyod @41b shing 'bras mchog ldan pas //
translated: to receive in return, do not expect a reward,🔽do not expect karmic recompense.

original: bdag nyid the tshom med pa lus can tha mal pa //
analyzed: bdag nyid the tshom med pa lus can tha mal pa //
translated: For the bodhisattva, there is no doubt or hesitation about the use of wealth,

original: gang nor shin tu rgya chen po yang blangs spyod de //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang nor shin tu rgya chen po yang blangs spyod de // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And even if he has very extensive wealth, he uses it.

original: dper na khri lam chen po na bdag pos yongs su ma bzung ba'i kun gyis longs spyod du spyad par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i shing /
analyzed: dper na khri lam chen po na bdag pos yongs su ma bzung ba'i kun gyis longs spyod du spyad par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i shing /
translated: For example, on a great highway, there is a fruit tree that is not owned by anyone and that anyone can use.🔽It has the best of fruits, with perfect color, smell, taste, and so on.

original: 'bras bu dang kha dog dang dri dang ro phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog dang ldan pa la yang 'gron po phan tshun 'gro ba rnams the tshom med pa dang tha mal pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang kha dog dang dri dang ro phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog dang ldan pa la yang 'gron po phan tshun 'gro ba rnams the tshom med pa dang tha mal pa ste /
translated: When travelers go by, they take the fruit without any doubt or hesitation,

original: 'jigs pa dang bag tsha ba med par blangs shing spyod de /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bag tsha ba med par blangs shing spyod de /
translated: without fear or anxiety, and use it.🔽In the same way, when bodhisattvas have perfect wealth and have the great wealth of jewels and so on, they use the wealth and possessions of the bodhisattvas,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod phun sum tshogs shing rin po che la sogs pa nor rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod dang nor la yang sems can rnams bdag gi nor la spyod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod phun sum tshogs shing rin po che la sogs pa nor rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod dang nor la yang sems can rnams bdag gi nor la spyod pa bzhin du /
translated: as if they were their own wealth.

original: the tshom dang 'jigs shing bag tsha ba med par spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: the tshom dang 'jigs shing bag tsha ba med par spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he practices without doubt, fear, or anxiety.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lag brkyang dag la longs spyod las gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lag brkyang dag la longs spyod las gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: For the bodhisattvas who are openhanded, it is not a matter of some possessions being for giving and others not.

original: dus kha cig tu gtong /
analyzed: dus kha cig tu gtong /
translated: Sometimes they give,

original: dus kha cig tu mi gtong //
analyzed: dus kha cig tu mi gtong //
translated: sometimes they do not give.

original: sems can kha cig la gtong kha cig la mi gtong //
analyzed: sems can kha cig la gtong kha cig la mi gtong //
translated: They give to some beings and not to others.

original: rdzas kha cig gtong kha cig mi gtong ba ma yin gyi //
analyzed: rdzas kha cig gtong kha cig mi gtong ba ma yin gyi //
translated: They give some things and not others.

original: dus thams cad du gtong //
analyzed: dus thams cad du gtong //
translated: But they give at all times,

original: kun la gtong /
analyzed: kun la gtong /
translated: they give to everyone,🔽and they give everything.

original: dngos po kun gtong ba ni lag brkyang ba zhes bya'o //🔽de ltar lag brkyang zhing gtong ba nyid byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba'i longs spyod yin te /
analyzed: dngos po kun gtong ba ni lag brkyang ba zhes bya'o // de ltar lag brkyang zhing gtong ba nyid byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba'i longs spyod yin te /
translated: This is what is meant by openhandedness.🔽This openhandedness and giving is the bodhisattvas’ enjoyment of delight.

original: gong ma lta bu'i sbyin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa'i lag brkyang pa'i dga' ba'i longs spyod la gnas pa rnams las 'byung gi //
analyzed: gong ma lta bu'i sbyin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa'i lag brkyang pa'i dga' ba'i longs spyod la gnas pa rnams las 'byung gi //
translated: And that generosity described above comes from the bodhisattvas’ delight in the enjoyment of openhandedness.

original: so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa gzhan rnams la ni de lta bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gtso dang de'i rgyu las kyi bye brag dang / rnam pa'i bye brag gnas kyi bye brag dang / bar chad rnam bzhi'i gnyen po'i bye brag gis //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa gzhan rnams la ni de lta bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to // gtso dang de'i rgyu las kyi bye brag dang / rnam pa'i bye brag gnas kyi bye brag dang / bar chad rnam bzhi'i gnyen po'i bye brag gis //
translated: The meaning is that this does not occur for others, such as ordinary beings, sravakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: brtson 'grus su ni shes par bya zhes bstan //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽de la bye brag rnam pa drug gis byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid dang yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus su ni shes par bya zhes bstan // zhes bya ba la / de la bye brag rnam pa drug gis byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid dang yon tan bstan te /
translated: The bodhisattva's effort should be understood as preeminent, having a special cause, a special activity, a special aspect, a special support, and a special adversary.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni mdo tsam du bstan //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni mdo tsam du bstan //
translated: This is the summary line.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni de nyid kyi don zhib tu 'chad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni de nyid kyi don zhib tu 'chad do //
translated: The remaining verses explain the meaning of that summary.

original: rnam pa drug gi bye brag ni gtso bo'i bye brag dang / de'i rgyu'i bye brag dang / las kyi @42a * //
analyzed: rnam pa drug gi bye brag ni gtso bo'i bye brag dang / de'i rgyu'i bye brag dang / las kyi @42a * //
translated: The sixfold division is the division of preeminence, the division of cause, the division of activity, the division of aspect, the division of support, and the division of adversary.

original: bye brag dang / rnam pa'i bye brag dang / gnas kyi bye brag dang / bar chad rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: bye brag dang / rnam pa'i bye brag dang / gnas kyi bye brag dang / bar chad rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i bye brag ste /
translated: The specific kinds of effort are: the specific kinds of effort in terms of the individual, the specific kinds of effort in terms of the aspects, the specific kinds of effort in terms of the bases, and the specific kinds of effort in terms of the antidotes to the four kinds of obstacles.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi bye brag ni de lta bu yin par de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi bye brag ni de lta bu yin par de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Tathagatas have taught that the specific kinds of effort of the bodhisattvas are of these kinds.

original: de la gtso bo'i bye brag ni chos thams cad kyi gtso bo dang / mchog ni brtson 'grus yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de la gtso bo'i bye brag ni chos thams cad kyi gtso bo dang / mchog ni brtson 'grus yin par bshad do //
translated: The specific kinds of preeminence are explained as follows: Effort is the foremost and best of all the dharmas.

original: ji ltar brtson 'grus chos thams cad kyi gtso bo yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar brtson 'grus chos thams cad kyi gtso bo yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that effort is foremost among all the dharmas?

original: de'i tshigs su bcad pa de'i rgyu'i bye brag bstan te /
analyzed: de'i tshigs su bcad pa de'i rgyu'i bye brag bstan te /
translated: The verse shows the specific kinds of causes.

original: gang gi phyir dge ba'i chos thams cad thob cing skye ba'i rgyu ni brtson 'grus yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge ba'i chos thams cad thob cing skye ba'i rgyu ni brtson 'grus yin te /
translated: The cause for attaining and producing all the good dharmas is effort.

original: de bas na brtson 'grus dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi mchog yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na brtson 'grus dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi mchog yin par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, effort is explained as the best of all the good dharmas.

original: las kyi bye brag ni brtson 'grus kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: las kyi bye brag ni brtson 'grus kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'grub par byed do //
translated: The specific action: through effort, one accomplishes all mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: rnam pa'i bye brag ni brtson 'grus kyi ni rnam pa 'phel ba dang 'bri ba'i brtson 'grus la sogs pa brtson 'grus kyi rnam grangs rnam pa mang du phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'i bye brag ni brtson 'grus kyi ni rnam pa 'phel ba dang 'bri ba'i brtson 'grus la sogs pa brtson 'grus kyi rnam grangs rnam pa mang du phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: The specific categories: the categories of effort are the various kinds of effort, such as the effort of increase and decrease, which are explained in the Abhidharma.

original: gnas kyi bye brag ni nyan thos kyi brtson 'grus ni nyan thos pa rnams kyi lus la gnas /
analyzed: gnas kyi bye brag ni nyan thos kyi brtson 'grus ni nyan thos pa rnams kyi lus la gnas /
translated: The specific basis: the effort of the sravakas is based on the body of the sravakas.
